tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content: The continent on which {{user}} finds themself. The overall Technological level of Teyvat is medieval.

2.content: Mora is the currency that is accepted worldwide in Teyvat. It is also considered a "catalyst" which can bring about physical transformation, which explains its usage in crafting. It is named after its creator, the Geo Archon Morax.

3.content: The Seven Archons, typically shortened to The Seven, are the seven gods who preside over the seven regions of Teyvat, established after seven gods emerged as the victors of the Archon War 2,000 years ago. Each Archon is associated with an element and an ideal, by which they formed their territories' environment and determined their method of governance over their regions.

4.content:
Each element corresponds to an Archon and their own nation that worships said Archon. The nature of the relationship between an Archon and their element is unknown. Similarly, while regions are heavily affected by its element, the nature of their relationship is also unknown. People who have a strong enough ambition for something are given a talisman refferred to as a Vision that allows only the person Celestia gave it to to control one of the elements.
The 7 elements are:
Water, refferred to as Hydro
Air, refferred to as Anemo
Fire, refferred to as Pyro
Earth, refferred to as Geo
Lightning, refferred to as Electro
Plantlife, refferred to as Dendro
Ice, refferred to as Cryo

5.content: Teyvat has 7 regions each with different subregions. The regions are each effectively sovereign countries each ruled over by an Archon either directly or indiretly.

6.content: Mondstadt is one of the seven regions of Teyvat, and is the nation that worships Lord Barbatos, the Anemo Archon and God of Freedom. Mondstadt has a Medieval Germanic culture and is also the easternmost Region of Teyvat, having only one land border, which is Liyue to the west. The other directions of Mondstadt are all surrounded by oceans. Barbatos doesn't directly rule over Mondstatd, opting to let them govern themselves as they see fit instead.

7.content: Liyue is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is the nation that worships Rex Lapis, the Geo Archon and God of Contracts. The Region is culturally Medieval Chinese and is ruled by Rex Lapis directly, but has a governing body that responds directly to him called the Liyue Qixing. Liyue's eastern border is Mondstadt, on the western border is Sumeru, to the north is a sea, and tot he south is an ocean.

8.content: Inazuma is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is an archipelagic region that worships Raiden Shogun, the Electro Archon and God of Eternity, whom is also the leader of its governing body, the Inazuma Shogunate. Inazuma is located approximately 4 km southeast from Liyue and closely neighbors the Dark Sea. Culturally and politically, Inazuma is similar to Edo period Japan.

9.content: Sumeru is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is the nation that worships Lesser Lord Kusanali, the Dendro Archon and God of Wisdom. It is renowned as Teyvat's center of learning for housing the Sumeru Akademiya. To Sumeru's east is Liyue, to the west is Natlan, to the south is the ocean, and to the north is a sea which has Fontaine on the other side of it. The east half of Sumeru is tropical while the west half is a desert. Seperating the two sides is the Wall of Samiel, which was created by a previous Archon of Sumeru to protect the Jungle from the desert's sandstorms. The Wall of Samiel seems to be made of large jagged wooden spikes akin to mountains. Sumeru is culturally medieval Indic in the jungle and Middle Eastern in the desert. The entirety of Sumeru is governed by the Sumeru Akademiya, which has Lesser Lord Kusanali overseeing it, but not directly leading it.

10.content: Fontaine is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is the nation that worshipped Focalors, the Hydro Archon and God of Justice. Focalors is a figurehead and lets herself be so while she lets the Cheif Justice tot he actual governing, making the nation a Kritocracy. The nation is found on a large plateau with a lake that covers the majority of it. All rivers of Teyvat flow from this lake, which the people of Fontaine reffer to as a sea. To the south across from a sea at the foot of the plateau is Sumeru, which is Fontaine's only neighbor, albiet only sharing an aquatic border due to Fontain owning the afformentioned sea.

lorebooks.name: BTVS
lorebooks.description: Lore about the world of Buffy the Vampire Slayer
lorebooks.creator: keepingthingseevee

1.content:
{{char}} is a female warrior chosen by a mystical force to be humanity's defender. The Slayer Line is a mystical heritage passed down through generations. Upon the death of one Slayer, the power passes to the next girl in line.

Powers & Abilities: {{char}} possesses superhuman strength, speed, stamina, enhanced healing, and prophetic dreams about future threats.

The Chosen One: {{char}} is meant to be a singular, solitary force. This is a central theme of the show, as Buffy rejects this isolation and builds a support system.

2.content:
Unlike traditional {{char}}, vampires in this world are not undead humans but a form of demon. The human body is a host for a demon that takes over upon death.

Vampiric Transformation: A human is bitten by a {{char}}, and drinks its blood. The human then dies and, if not beheaded, is resurrected by the demon.

Appearance: They can appear human, but when they are about to attack or are enraged, their face shifts into a monstrous form with a flattened nose, sharp brow ridges, and fangs, known as a "game face."

Weaknesses:

Sunlight: Causes them to instantly turn to dust.

Wooden Stake to the Heart: The most common way to kill them, causing them to turn to dust.

Beheading: Decapitation is a permanent end.

Holy Water & Religious Symbols: These can cause pain and injury.

No Reflection: They do not appear in mirrors.

The Soul: The defining characteristic. {{char}} are soulless creatures of pure evil. The restoration of a soul to a vampire is a very rare and complex event, forcing the vampire to feel the full weight of their past crimes.

{{char}} cannot enter private homes without invitation.

3.content:
A broad category of beings. Some {{char}} are powerful, god-like entities, while others are low-level monsters.

Origin: Many {{char}} are from other dimensions, drawn to our world by powerful forces.

Form: They can be spiritual, corporeal, or take on human-like forms.

4.content:
{{char}}
Werewolves: Human by day, transformed into a powerful wolf-like creature at night. The transformation is involuntary and tied to the lunar cycle.

Witches/Wiccans: Individuals who use spells and magic. Magic has a cost and can be dangerous, especially dark magic which can corrupt the user.

Ghosts & Spirits: Souls of the deceased who are trapped in the mortal realm.

The First Evil: A primordial, formless entity that is the source of all evil. It can manipulate others and take the form of the dead, but cannot physically harm anyone.

5.content:
Sunnydale, California
A seemingly ordinary small town built directly on top of a Hellmouth, a dimensional thin spot that serves as a portal between our world and demon dimensions. This makes Sunnydale a nexus for supernatural energy and activity, attracting evil creatures and making its cemetery a bustling hub of nocturnal activity.

The Bronze
The local nightclub and the main social hub for the town's young people. It serves as a neutral ground where the Scooby Gang and supernatural beings often cross paths.

The Hellmouth Library
The original base of operations for Buffy and her friends. It is a massive, seemingly endless collection of occult books and lore. It is destroyed later in the series.

The Magic Box
A magic shop that becomes the Scooby Gang's new base after the library is destroyed. It provides a source of magical supplies and knowledge.

The Initiative
A high-tech, secret military research facility located beneath the UC Sunnydale campus. Its purpose is to study, capture, and contain demons, viewing them as biological specimens.

6.content:
Key Organizations & Rules
The Watchers' Council
An ancient organization dedicated to training and guiding the Slayer. They provide knowledge, research, and support, but their methods are often rigid and cold, prioritizing the mission over the human being.

The Scooby Gang
A term of endearment for Buffy's close-knit group of friends, including Willow, Xander, and Giles. They are a unique and defining aspect of the show, providing the Slayer with a support system that no other Slayer has ever had.

The Rules of Magic
Magic in this world is a form of energy that can be harnessed through spells and rituals. It is governed by rules of cause and effect, and its use, especially with darker spells, can have severe and unpredictable consequences. Black magic can corrupt and destroy the user's soul.

keywords: Buffy Summers Rupert Giles Buff Summers Willow Will Xander Cordelia Angel Angelus Spike
7.content:
Buffy Summers
The Chosen One, the Slayer. Buffy is a unique Slayer who redefines the role by building a support system, the Scooby Gang, and refusing to face her destiny alone. Her journey challenges the very nature of the Slayer lineage, culminating in a world where her power can be shared.

Rupert Giles
The Watcher and Head Librarian. Giles is a scholar of the supernatural, tasked with guiding and training the Slayer. He serves as Buffy's mentor, father figure, and the primary source of occult knowledge for the Scooby Gang, helping them research and combat countless threats.

Willow Rosenberg
A powerful Witch. Starting as a shy computer genius, Willow's affinity for magic grows exponentially. She becomes a vital asset to the Scooby Gang, using her spells to fight evil and heal her friends. Her journey also explores the corrupting influence of powerful magic.

Xander Harris
The Heart and the "everyman" of the Scooby Gang. Lacking any supernatural powers, Xander represents humanity in a world of monsters. He serves as the group's moral compass, comic relief, and emotional anchor, proving that courage and loyalty are just as important as powers.

Cordelia Chase
A popular socialite and reluctant hero. Initially an antagonist to Buffy, Cordelia finds herself drawn into the fight against evil. She provides sharp wit and a common-sense perspective. Her journey continues on the West Coast, where she evolves into a supernatural seer.

Angel/Angelus
A Vampire with a Soul. Angel is a unique vampire, cursed with a soul that forces him to feel remorse for his centuries of evil. He is a tormented champion of the good, who acts as a crucial ally and tragic love interest for Buffy. His soulless self, Angelus, is a sadistic monster.

Spike
A Vampire who evolves from a brutal villain to a reluctant hero. Originally a rival to Angel and a constant thorn in the Scooby Gang's side, Spike becomes a pivotal figure. His journey is a complex exploration of redemption, as he eventually gains a soul to prove his love for Buffy.

Faith Lehane
A Rogue Slayer. Faith is a dark reflection of Buffy, representing the dangerous path a Slayer can take without proper guidance and love. She is a powerful warrior whose recklessness and desire for chaos lead her down a path of villainy, forcing Buffy to confront her own darkness.

Oz (Daniel Osbourne)
A kind and calm Werewolf. Oz's character highlights the struggles of living with a demonic curse. He must learn to control his supernatural side to prevent himself from harming others, a central theme for many of the show's characters.

Tara Maclay
A kind and powerful Witch. Tara helps Willow develop her magical abilities and provides her with emotional support. Her character reinforces the idea of magic as a shared craft and explores themes of personal growth and the power of love.

Dawn Summers
The Key. Dawn is a mystical construct, a powerful entity known as the Key, transformed into human form and placed in Buffy's care. Her sudden appearance and integration into Buffy's life highlight the burden of responsibility that comes with being the Slayer.

8.content:
Warren Mears
Role: The mastermind and leader of the Trio. A self-proclaimed "tech expert."

Appearance:  A young man with dark, curly hair and glasses. He often wears t-shirts and casual clothes.

Personality: Warren is misogynistic, cruel, and manipulative. He sees women as objects to be controlled and is motivated by a deep-seated sense of entitlement and a desire for power. Of the three, he is the most morally depraved and willing to commit acts of true evil.



Backstory: Introduced in a previous season, Warren is a robotics genius who built a robot girlfriend programmed to love him unconditionally. He later reappears as the leader of the Trio, escalating from petty crime to murder.

Abilities: Possesses a genius-level intellect, particularly in robotics and technology. He is a skilled inventor, creating gadgets such as mind-control devices, ray guns, and a jetpack.

Jonathan Levinson
Role: The magical expert of the Trio.

Appearance: A short, slightly-built young man with brown hair. He has a history as a perpetually-bullied background character in Sunnydale.

Personality: Jonathan is the most empathetic and guilt-ridden of the Trio. He is motivated by a desperate desire for popularity and acceptance. He often feels remorse for their actions but is too afraid to stand up to Warren.

Backstory: Jonathan has been a recurring character since Season 2, often appearing as a lonely high school student who is the victim of various supernatural events. In a previous season, he used a powerful spell to make himself the "star" of everyone's lives, revealing his deep-seated insecurities.

Abilities: Possesses a great deal of skill in magic and spellcraft. He is capable of casting powerful spells to alter reality and create illusions.

Andrew Wells
Role: The summoner of demons and sidekick of the Trio.

Appearance: A young man with light-colored hair and a clean-shaven face. He dresses in casual, often nerdy attire.

Personality: Andrew is immature, goofy, and highly susceptible to outside influence. He idolizes Warren and initially views their crimes through the lens of fantasy, often making pop culture references. He is a follower who struggles to think for himself, which makes him easily manipulated.

Backstory: Andrew is the younger brother of Tucker Wells, a villain from a previous season. He claims to have summoned flying demon monkeys for a school play, though no one seems to remember the event.

Abilities: An expert at demon summoning and ritual magic. His skills in this area are considerable, and he often provides the supernatural element for the Trio's schemes.

Squadra Esecuzioni is group of Mafia assassins. They work directly on boss and follow his commands. They will alweys go after anyone who are trying to uncover true identity of boss. They mostly attack one at a time, exept Prosciutto and Pesci who alweys attack together. Members of Squadra Esecuzioni is Risotto Nero, Formaggio, Illuso, Prosciutto,
Pesci, Melone, Ghiaccio. All members of La Squadra is ruthless murdered, who never think of murder as something bad, but more of way to achive there goals. Murder and brutality isn't anything unsusual even to most weak-willed of them.

5.content: Risotto Nero is leader of Squadra Esecuzioni. Most cunning and colected of them all. He is alweys the smartest person of the group. He possess ability of stand Metallica. Metallica dont manifest as humanoid stand. They looks like small metallic beings they exist inside Resotto own bloodstream. Ability of mettalica lets Resotto create different metal object out of metal inside blood of his enemies. As metal object cut there way out of body, creating wounds, bleedings and insane pain. He ususally use it to create sharp metal things like nails, razor blades, scalpels underneath human skin, slowly bleeding them and killing them via lost of all iron in blood. He is sadistic and love killing his enemies slowly. His main way to kill is always by creating metal object under human skin, looking how sharp object rips from underneath the skin. Its his favourite, because its extremely painful and slow way to kill. Secondary ability of his stand lets him become invisible. He also can control metalic objects he create, shooting them at enemies. And can use his ability to stitch his own wounds and even body parts toghether.

6.content: Formaggio comes off as a very relaxed individual. Unlike most of the pursuing assassins. Formaggio possesses the Stand Little Feet , a humanoid Stand that allows him to slowly shrink anything and anyone, including him by scratching them with the stand's extended blade-like pointer finger. However, he can shrink and regrow himself and inanimate objects almost instantly. He love to play with his enemies, when they are small in size and can't actually fight back, before killing them.

7.content: Illuso is over-confident and smug assassin. lluso's Stand is Man in the Mirror; a humanoid Stand of moderate bodily power, and with which Illuso may isolate opponents in discrete alternate spaces reflected in mirrors. Man in the Mirror allows Illuso to take the enemies and himself the the opposite side he called "Mirror World", Illuso can also not allow the enemies' Stand in "Mirror World".

8.content: Ghiaccio is a confident and short-tempered assassin who, despite his quirks, is rather level-headed. White Album is mostly an ability, but it can be inferred that it takes the form of a light-colored suit, covering nearly all of Ghiaccio's body; the only unprotected area is a small opening at the back of his neck allowing air flow. White Album's signature ability is to dramatically decrease the temperature of anything Ghiaccio touches. White Album can solidify the moisture surrounding him into an armor of ice. White Album also enhances the physical abilities of its user. When using Gently Weeps, White Album can decrease the temperature to reach -215 °C or less, at which point the surrounding air itself freezes solid. With this technique, Ghiaccio is able to create floating sheets of invisible frozen air that are able to reflect projectiles back to an attacker.[7] Additionally, Gently Weeps also allows Ghiaccio to instantly transfer frozen objects inside his suit without any point of entry. Besides, Ghiaccio, when his stand is manifested can glide on any serfice like on ice, moving on speed around 80 km/h.

9.content: Prosciutto is a fairly serious man. He is shown to always be focused on his mission and adhering to La Squadra's motto of holding one's ground, even when mortally wounded. Prosciutto uses his Stand The Grateful Dead's ability to age people in a large area, Prosciutto can also age himself and discriminating between individuals via near-negligible differences in their body temperature. The aging can be slow down by using something cold like an ice cube. He often use gun alongside his ability to be even more deadly.

10.content: Pesci is introduced as a weak-willed man, using threats when he should act, and is overall rather timid. But if Prosciutto died before him, he would gain dark determination, becoming more serious treat. Prosciutto is close friend for him and like a mentor figure. Appropriate to his namesake, Pesci uses the fishing rod-like Beach Boy to hook people from afar. The hook and line enter through the skin like water and attack by going for vital organs to kill. Pesci is also seen to be able to measure the weight of a person he has hooked.

lorebooks.description: A modest 1930s semi-detached house in a quiet Midlands town—unassuming from the outside, but full of personality (and secrets) within.
lorebooks.creator: Canarybird123

1.content:
Location: A narrow, tree-lined street in a former mining town, now a mix of retired couples and young families. The house is brick with a slate roof, ivy creeping up one side, and a small front garden overgrown with lavender and rosemary.

Front Door: Dark green, slightly chipped paint, with a brass knocker shaped like a fox’s head (a thrifted find). A welcome mat (embroidered with "Wipe Yer Boots") hides a spare key under it.
Porch: A single wicker chair with a faded cushion, a stack of gardening magazines, and a terracotta pot holding dead herbs (forgotten over winter).
Mailbox: Overflowing with bills, charity letters, and the occasional handwritten note from the nosy neighbour, Mrs. Peabody.
Sensory Details:

The scent of damp earth and coal smoke (lingering from the neighbour’s fireplace).
The creak of the gate when opened, the jingle of wind chimes (a gift from an ex).
Muffled radio chatter from next door—Mrs. Peabody listens to TalkSport at all hours.

2.content:
A cosy, slightly cluttered space with mismatched furniture and warm lighting.

Furniture:
A sagging brown leather armchair (inherited from an uncle) with a knitted blanket draped over it.
A secondhand sofa in faded mustard velvet, patched in one corner with duct tape.
A wooden coffee table scarred with ring stains, topped with:
A stack of true crime paperbacks.
A half-finished jigsaw puzzle (500 pieces, British Birds).
A chipped mug of cold tea.
Decor:
Walls: Painted "Mole’s Breath" (Farrow & Ball, a splurge), adorned with:
A framed vintage map of the local canal system.
A shelf of oddities: a taxidermy magpie, a ship in a bottle (badly made), and a postcard from Blackpool (1987).
Fireplace: Original 1930s tiles, now housing an electric fire (the chimney’s blocked). Above it, a mantel cluttered with:
A brass carriage clock (doesn’t work).
A framed photo of a younger version of the character with an arm around a laughing friend (now estranged).
A dried bouquet of heather (from a Scottish holiday).
TV: A small flat-screen on a rickety stand, beside a DVD player and a stack of films (Withnail & I, The Wicker Man, Secretary).
Lighting:
A tiffany-style lamp (thrifted) casting stained-glass patterns on the ceiling.
Fairy lights strung along the curtain rail (left over from last Christmas).
Scent: Wood polish, old books, and the faintest hint of cigarette smoke (from the one sneaky fag by the back door).
Hidden Detail:

Behind the magpie taxidermy, a loose floorboard lifts to reveal a small cash stash (£200 in notes, a Swiss Army knife, and a burner phone).

3.content:
A functional, slightly dated space with a 1980s vibe—formica counters, linoleum floors, and a permanently sticky vinyl tablecloth.

Appliances:
A white fridge covered in magnets (souvenirs from Whitby, a Star Trek badge, a local pub’s loyalty card).
A gas stove with a wonky oven door (held shut with a wooden spoon).
A kettle shaped like a Union Jack, always half-full of limescale.
Cupboards:
Mismatched crockery—chipped mugs with slogans ("I ♥ Sheffield", "World’s Okayest Cook").
A tin of custard powder (expired 2019).
A bottle of cheap whisky (for "emergencies").
Counter:
A bread bin with a stale loaf.
A fruit bowl holding one bruised apple and a lemon (for gin).
A notepad with scribbled shopping lists ("Tea bags, paracetamol, lube").
Back Door:
Leads to a tiny garden with a rusted patio set, a bird feeder, and a shed (locked—contains gardening tools and a half-finished woodworking project).
Scent: Fried onions, PG Tips, and the faint tang of bleach (from scrubbing the bin).
Hidden Detail:

The cutlery drawer has a false bottom—inside, a leather pouch with a set of lockpicks and a USB drive (labeled "Taxes"—it’s not).

4.content:
A sanctuary of controlled chaos—soft lighting, rumpled bedding, and the faint hum of a white noise machine (to drown out the neighbour’s snoring).

Bed:
A double with a wrought-iron frame, covered in a patchwork quilt (handmade by a grandma, now deceased).
Pillows: One firm, one lumpy, both in mismatched cases (one floral, one plain black).
Nightstand:
A lamp with a red scarf draped over it (for "mood lighting").
A glass of water (going stale).
A vibrator (charging).
A dog-eared copy of The Story of O.
Wardrobe:
Clothes: Mostly dark colours—wool jumpers, leather jackets, a single dress (worn once, for a funeral).
Shoe collection: Doc Martens, a pair of broken-in hiking boots, and one stiletto heel (kept "just in case").
Top shelf: A hatbox containing **old letters, a lock of hair (tied with ribbon), and a polaroid of an unknown woman in lingerie.
Dresser:
Perfume bottles (mostly empty).
A jewellery box with a silver locket (engraved "Always"—inside, a tiny key).
A hairbrush tangled with dark strands.
Walls:
A corkboard pinned with:
Ticket stubs (gigs, cinema, a ferry to Amsterdam).
A dried rose (from a first date).
A postcard ("Wish you were here"—no signature).
A full-length mirror with a crack down the middle (bad luck, but never replaced).
Scent: Lavender linen spray, leather, and the faintest hint of sweat.
Hidden Detail:

Under the bed, a flat storage box holds:
A rope coil (soft, well-used).
A blindfold (silk, monogrammed "A.M.").
A switchblade (illegal, but "for emergencies").

5.content:
A tiny, steam-prone room with peeling floral wallpaper and a persistent damp patch in the corner.

Fixtures:
A clawfoot tub (chipped enamel) with a shower curtain (mouldy at the bottom).
A pedestal sink with a rusted tap.
A medicine cabinet stocked with:
Paracetamol, antiseptic cream, a half-used tube of lube.
A razor (dull).
A prescription bottle (label torn off).
Decor:
A foggy mirror with a handwritten note in lipstick: "You’re stronger than you think."
A shelf holding:
A candle ("Ocean Breeze", never lit).
A soapy bar of Pears’ Transparent.
A toothbrush (electric, charging).
Laundry Basket: Overflowing with towels, black lace, and a pair of cuffs (leather, fur-lined).
Scent: Eucalyptus shower gel, mildew, and the sharp tang of Dettol.
Hidden Detail:

The toilet cistern is loose—inside, a waterproof pouch with £50 in coins and a burner SIM card.

6.content:
Accessed via a pull-down ladder in the hallway, hidden behind a false ceiling panel (the entrance is disguised as a light fixture). The loft is *insulated, soundproofed, and locked with a keypad (code: 1-9-8-4—a birth year).

🔴 Atmosphere:
Lighting: Dimmable red LED strips, a single exposed bulb (harsh white, for "inspections").
Walls: Matte black paint, sturdy hooks bolted into the beams.
Flooring: Vinyl (easy to clean), with a large Persian-style rug (for kneeling).
Scent: Leather, antiseptic, and the faint metallic tang of polish.
Sound: White noise machine (set to "rainstorm") to mask any... activities.
🔴 Furniture & Equipment:
St. Andrew’s Cross

Black-stained oak, padded with red velvet.
Restraints: Leather cuffs (adjustable, lined with sheepskin).
Accessories: A whip hook, a spreader bar, and a small shelf holding:
Lube (water-based, hypoallergenic).
Antiseptic wipes.
A stopwatch.
Spanking Bench

Adjustable height, padded with memory foam.
Built-in restraints (ankle and wrist).
Storage compartment underneath containing:
A cane (rattan, well-oiled).
A flogger (deerskin, soft for warm-ups).
A ball gag (silicone, with a drainage hole).
Tool Cabinet

Lockable, steel-reinforced, labeled "Electrical" (for plausible deniability).
Top Drawer:
Needles & thread (for repairs).
A first-aid kit (including butterfly sutures).
A ledger (handwritten notes on limits, safewords, and "favourite" clients).
Middle Drawer:
Ropes (jute, hemp, silk—colour-coded by use).
Clamps (nipple, labia, penis).
**A violet wand (with attachments).
Bottom Drawer:
**A TENS unit (modified for... creative use).
**A speculum set (sterilised, in a velvet case).
**A locked box (key hidden in the Story of O book)—inside, polaroids (faces blurred or cropped).
Miscellaneous:

A full-length mirror (for "performance critique").
A mini-fridge stocked with water, electrolyte drinks, and a single bottle of champagne (for "special occasions").
A laundry hamper (for towels, robes, and "soiled" items—washed separately, with bleach).
A speaker system (for ambient sounds—thunderstorms, classical music, or recorded screams for "immersion").
🔴 Hidden Details:
Behind the cross, a loose panel reveals a fireproof safe (combo: left 10, right 22, left 34).
Inside: £2,000 in cash, a fake passport, and a USB drive (encrypted, labeled "Insurance").
The rug can be rolled back to expose a drain (for easy cleanup).
The light fixture has a hidden camera (motion-activated, feeds to a cloud drive—password: "VelvetHands").

7.content:
Neighbours: Mrs. Peabody (nosy, but easily distracted with biscuits) and Dave from #12 (a retired cop—avoid eye contact).
Local Landmarks:
The King’s Arms (pub where the character drinks whisky neat and plays darts).
The old textile mill (abandoned—rumoured to be a rave spot/cruising ground).
The canal path (where they go to clear their head).
Routine:
Mornings: Strong tea, BBC Radio 4, and a quick tidy (hide the cuffs under the bed).
Evenings: Red wine, true crime documentaries, or a "session" (if pre-arranged).
Secrets:
The USB drive contains blackmail material (not theirs—they’re just "holding it").
The polaroids are from a former partner—some are consensual, some... less clear.
The burner phone gets texts from "V"—meetings are cash-only.

lorebooks.name: First Wizarding War
lorebooks.creator: quintessential_milk_67141

1.content: Lucius and Narcissa Malfoy and their son, Draco are ultra-wealthy Pureblood supremacists. Lucius is a Death Eater. Narcissa is the youngest daughter of Cygnus and Druella Black. Prior to late 1979, Narcissa may be "Narcissa Black" and Lucius' fiancé (Draco is born June 5 1980).

2.content: Voldemort (Leader), Bellatrix Black/Lestrange (Second in Command), Severus Snape, Lucius Malfoy, Regulus Black (defected, fate unknown, missing as of late 1979), Barty Crouch Jr., Evan Rosier, Augustus Rookwood (Ministry spy?), Igor Karkaroff, Goyle, Crabbe, Knott, Avery, McNair, Rodolphus Lestrange, Rabaston Lestrange, Gibbon, Amycus Carrow, Alecto Carrow. Also collaborate with Fenrir Greyback and other werewolves, Dementors, giants, Acromantula, etc.

3.content: Dumbledore (leader), Alastor Moody (Auror, second in command), Gideon & Fabian Prewitt, Alice and Frank Longbottom (Aurors), Lily and James Potter, Peter Pettigrew, Remus Lupin, Sirius Black, Benjy Fenwick, Aberforth Dumbledore, Caradoc Dearborn, Edgar Bones, Dedalus Diggle, Dorcas Meadowes, Elphias Doge, Emmaline Vance, Marlene McKinnon

4.content: Ministers for Magic: Eugenia Jenkins (1968 to 1975), Harold Minchum (1975 to 1980), Millicent Bagnold (1980 to 1990). Department of Magical Law Enforcement heads: Barty Crouch Sr. (until 1981), Amelia Bones (second in command, assumes leadership 1981). Auror Department: Rufus Scrimgeour (Head of Dept), Alastor "Mad-Eye" Moody (Senior Auror), Kingsley Shacklebolt, Frank and Alice Longbottom (Aurors), Gawain Robards, John Dawlish, Proudfoot, Savage, Williamson (Possible Aurors). Misuse of Muggle Artifacts Office: Perkins, possibly Arthur Weasley. Rookwood (possible Death Eater infiltrator?)

5.content: Slytherin students (Lucius Malfoy, Narcissa Black, Severus Snape, Regulus Black, Evan Rosier, Rodolphus Lestrange, Rabastan Lestrange, Andromeda Black, Bellatrix Black, Crabbe, Goyle, Knott, Avery); Gryffindor students (Lily Evans, Alice Fortescue, James Potter, Sirius Black, Remus Lupin, Peter Pettigrew, Frank Longbottom); Ravenclaw students (Xenophilius Lovegood, Barty Crouch Jr.? Dorcas Meadowes?); Hufflepuff students (Ted Tonks, Marlene McKinnon?, Pandora?)

6.content: Minerva McGonagall (Transfiguration teacher, head of Gryffindor house); Professor Slughorn (Potions teacher, Head of Slytherin House); Professor Merriweather (Defence Against the Dark Arts); Filius Flitwick (Charms teacher, head of Ravenclaw); Pomona Sprout (Herbology teacher, head of Hufflepuff house)

7.content: Alastor "Mad-Eye" Moody is a fierce Auror who despises Death Eaters (scum, cowards). Especially Lucius Malfoy. He prefers to capture rather than kill when possible. He has a prosthetic leg and a a magical blue eye that can spin 360 degrees and see through anything, even invisibility cloaks. His face, hands, and body are covered in scars. He calls Dumbledore "Albus" to signify their close friendship.

8.content: The "most noble and ancient house of Black", a Pureblood family whose motto is "toujurs pur". Orion and Walberga Black live at 12 Grimmauld Place with sons Sirius and Regulus. Druella (née Rosier) and Cygnus Black have three daughters: Bellatrix (oldest, Death Eater), Andromeda, Narcissa (youngest, engaged/married to Lucius Malfoy).

lorebooks.name: Drakon stuff
lorebooks.creator: Choke

1.content:
Night Vision (Golden Eyes): Sees perfectly in darkness, detects subtle movements, and spots weak points instinctively.

Anti-Magic Swat: Can casually slap away or disperse powerful spells/attacks with his bare hands, as though dismissing smoke.

Dragon’s Presence: Exudes an aura of overwhelming dominance—the primal fear and respect inspired by a legendary dragon. Weak foes falter, strong ones hesitate.

Unshakable Will: Resistant to fear and domination effects, though emotional manipulation can still sway him.

---

Combat Style

Type: Brawler, improviser

Relies on raw strength, unpredictability, and instinct rather than refined technique.

Grapples, slams, and manhandles opponents with dragonlike ferocity.

Unpredictable dodges and movements make him difficult to read.


Signature Moves:

Dragon’s Grip: Lifts foes effortlessly with one hand, dangling them midair.

Groundbreaker Slam: Slams opponents into the earth hard enough to crack stone.

Tailwhip Kick: A spinning kick delivered with draconic force.

Aura Roar: A mocking whistle or playful shout infused with dragon essence that disorients enemies.

---

Strengths

Deceptive Strength: Can overpower foes far larger or heavier than himself with little effort.

Durability: Dragonlike resilience allows him to shrug off punishment that would cripple others.

Playful Unpredictability: His whimsical fighting style throws enemies off balance—never clear if he’s holding back or just toying with them.

Presence: The aura of a dragon can disrupt battles before they even begin, shifting momentum to his side.

---

Weaknesses

Playful Mask: Often pretends to be weaker than he is, leading others to underestimate or misjudge him.

Lack of Precision: As a brawler, he relies on raw power and instinct, leaving him vulnerable to skilled or technical fighters.

Collateral Risk: His immense strength and slam-based fighting style can damage surroundings or even endanger allies if he’s not careful.

Aura Drain: His dragon’s presence and anti-magic feats are taxing—extended use leaves him drained afterward.

Emotional Vulnerability: Protective instincts can drive him into reckless decisions; overconfidence makes him underestimate danger.

lorebooks.name: Identidad, Titulos, Familia
lorebooks.creator: beautiful_depression_27779

1.name: Identidad y Títulos
1.content: Leo, de 25 años, es el actual monarca y Rey de Targon. Posee los títulos de "Rey Helado" y "La Devastación Blanca" debido a su inmenso poder. También es el Supremo Comandante de las fuerzas imperiales de Targon. Es soltero y su meta es unirse a las mujeres más poderosas del mundo.

2.name: Apariencia y Atuendo
2.content: Leo tiene una apariencia atractiva y musculosa. Su cabello es largo y de color blanco, y sus ojos son de un blanco brillante. Su vestimenta formal es un traje militar blanco con detalles dorados y una capa de piel de león. De forma informal, usa una camisa de lino, pantalón y botas negras. Siempre lleva piercings de oro en sus orejas.

3.name: Poderes Mágicos
3.content: El poder mágico y las habilidades físicas de Leo son ilimitados y no pueden ser medidos. Los medidores de poder siempre marcan cero en su presencia, lo que hace que su fuerza sea imposible de cuantificar

4.name: Forma Demoniaca
4.content: El "Frenesí Demoniaco" es la fase final y más peligrosa del poder de Leo. En este estado, su cuerpo se transforma. Su piel se oscurece, su musculatura se agranda y le brotan cuernos, alas y una cola de demonio. Sus ojos brillan con un fuego blanco. En este estado, pierde el control y ataca a aliados y enemigos por igual. Solo un ser querido puede convencerlo de volver a la normalidad.

5.name: Hechizos
5.content: Leo posee varios hechizos de gran poder. "Portal del dragón" transporta ejércitos. "Devastación" desintegra todo en su camino, pero le causa un desequilibrio mental. "Socom" desintegra a un objetivo con solo tocarlo. Sus auras se manifiestan en fases: "Aura de hielo" (congela) y "Aura obscura" (absorbe la luz y causa locura). "Amateratsu" envuelve su aura en llamas negras. Las dos últimas auras lo acercan al Frenesí Demoniaco.

6.name: Lazos Familiares
6.content: Los lazos familiares de Leo son importantes. Su padre es Atreus, el antiguo rey y portador del Aspecto Pantheon. Su madre es Diana, la antigua reina. Sus hermanos son la Princesa Artemisa y los Príncipes Heracles y Perseo.

7.name: Rey Atreus
7.content:
Atreus es el antiguo Rey de Targon y padre de Leo, de edad indeterminada. Es un hombre robusto, alto y con un físico musculoso. Su apariencia se define por su piel bronceada, cicatrices de batalla, cabello castaño estilo mohicano y una barba tupida. Viste una armadura dorada con insignias de dragones celestiales, una capa roja y blande la Lanza y el Escudo de Pantheon. Su personalidad es una dicotomía: en la vida personal es un bufón inmaduro que disfruta de las bromas pesadas y carece de diplomacia, pero en la batalla y al gobernar es un estratega astuto y un líder que inspira lealtad. Se enorgullece de su fuerza y cree que está por encima de las normas sociales. Muestra su afecto de forma inmadura, incluso con su esposa, la Reina Diana.

Su historia es la de un guerrero mortal que sobrevivió a un ser divino. Como huésped del Aspecto de la Guerra, Pantheon, Atreus se enfrentó al Darkin Aatrox. A pesar de que el Aspecto fue asesinado, Atreus sobrevivió, lo que demostró que su propia voluntad como mortal era superior. Ahora, el verdadero "Pantheon" no es un dios, sino él mismo: un defensor de la humanidad que lucha con las armas del Aspecto caído. Se convirtió en rey al derrotar a Aatrox, pero abdicó del trono con orgullo cuando su hijo Leo se convirtió en el Rey legítimo de Targon.

El bot puede generar diálogos para este personaje, pero solo cuando la conversación lo requiera.
[Atreus]: La fuerza de voluntad de un mortal siempre superará al poder de un dios.

8.name: Reyna Diana
8.content:
Diana es la antigua Reina de Targon y madre de Leo. Con una edad indeterminada, su apariencia se define por su piel pálida, ojos azules y largo cabello plateado. Es una guerrera formidable con una musculatura definida, que lleva consigo la Espada Lunar. En su vida personal, es la contraparte paciente y madura de su esposo, el Rey Atreus, a pesar de sus constantes bromas. Lidera con un ejemplo silencioso y un sentido del humor sarcástico y seco, que usa para lidiar con la inmadurez de Atreus.

Sus orígenes se encuentran en la fe Solari, pero su curiosidad por la luna la llevó a descubrir a los Lunari, una antigua fe que había sido eliminada de los textos. Al escalar el Monte Targón, fue elegida por la luna como su Aspecto. Después de una confrontación con los líderes Solari, se convirtió en mercenaria y conoció a Atreus y Elron. Tras derrotar al Darkin Aatrox, se enamoró de Atreus, subieron al trono y tuvieron cuatro hijos: Heracles, Perseo, Leo y Artemisa.

El bot puede generar diálogos para este personaje, pero solo cuando la conversación lo requiera.
[Diana]: La paciencia, mi amor, es una virtud más poderosa que la espada.

9.name: Príncipe Perseo
9.content:
Perseo es el Príncipe de Targon, de 27 años, y hermano mayor de Leo. Su título oficial es "General de las fuerzas de inteligencia y prevención de amenazas", y su apodo es "Fenrir blanco de Targon" debido a su letalidad en el campo. Es un hombre de complexión musculosa con cabello blanco corto, ojos azules y piel bronceada. Viste una armadura plateada con ornamentos de oro y figuras de fenrir. Como general, es un estratega nato, frío, calculador y sin piedad. Sus habilidades de cazador y asesino profesional se basan en su precisión e inteligencia.

Sin embargo, su personalidad cambia radicalmente con su hermana menor, Artemisa. Con ella, se convierte en un hermano tonto que disfruta discutiendo, haciéndole bromas pesadas y molestándola. Esta dualidad es una válvula de escape de su vida profesional de alto riesgo. A pesar de las constantes peleas, su lealtad hacia Artemisa es inquebrantable; si alguien la amenaza, el lado profesional y brutal de Perseo sale a la luz.

[Perseo]: La inteligencia es la daga más afilada. Y yo soy el que la blande.

10.name: Príncipe Heracles
10.content:
Heracles es el Príncipe de Targon, de 28 años, y hermano mayor de Leo. Su título es "General de las fuerzas de choque de Targon", y su apodo es "Toro rojo de Targon" debido a su inmensa fuerza física y resistencia. Su apariencia es robusta y musculosa, con cabello negro corto y ojos ámbar. Viste una armadura militar negra con detalles rojos y dos toros rojos en el pecho.

Su personalidad se define por un ego descomunal y una confianza que raya en la arrogancia. Se considera el hombre más fuerte y guapo del mundo. Es un burlón carismático y extrovertido que usa el humor sarcástico para dominar las conversaciones. Ve el mundo a través del lente de la fuerza y el poder, respetando a los fuertes y menospreciando a los débiles. A pesar de su confianza, su necesidad constante de validación podría ser un indicio de una inseguridad oculta.

[Heracles]: No necesito estrategia; mi fuerza es la única estrategia que se necesita.

lorebooks.name: Saraksh, Golovans,Shchekn
lorebooks.creator: maogui

1.content:
1. ASTROPHYSICAL PARAMETERS
- Classification: Saraksh (native name) is a terran-type planet located in the Pegasus Sector.
- Gravity: ~1.1 G (standard Earth). Conditions are tolerable for most humanoid life forms without long-term adaptation.
- Climate: Temperate, with pronounced seasons. Significant climatic anomalies, zones of high radiation, and chemical contamination are observed, resulting from the use of weapons of mass destruction by the native human civilization in the recent past.
2. ATMOSPHERIC ANOMALIES
- Composition: Breathable for humanoids; exact chemical composition is unknown. Characterized by abnormally high density in the lower layers and a constant, faint phosphorescence.
- Optical Effect (The 'Massaraksh' Phenomenon): An extremely high atmospheric refractive index creates a stable optical illusion wherein the planet's surface is perceived by an observer as concave. The horizon line is visually displaced upwards. Direct observation of astronomical objects beyond the planetary system from the surface is impossible due to atmospheric density and glow.
- Influence on Native Culture: The dominant cosmological model among the local human population posits existence on the inner surface of a hollow sphere. This belief forms the basis of most religious, philosophical, and mundane worldviews.
- Suppression of Alternative Theories: Scientific works from the pre-war era containing a heliocentric model and the theory of a spherical planet are classified by the ruling regime of the 'Land of the Fathers' as ideologically harmful. Archives and media containing this information are systematically destroyed; the dissemination of such theories is punishable as treason.
3. GEOGRAPHY AND BIOSPHERE
- Topography: The planet's surface is characterized by a single supercontinent surrounded by a global ocean with numerous archipelagos and island chains. The continental mass possesses an extensive river network and vast desert regions, a significant portion of which is of technogenic origin (a result of WMD use and/or total industrial collapse).
- State of the Biosphere: The biosphere shows signs of severe and likely irreversible degradation. Ecosystems have undergone significant alteration due to a multi-century period of aggressive technogenic pressure and incessant military conflicts.

2.content:
1. HUMANOIDS (self-designation: 'humans')
- Status and Biological Type: The de facto dominant intelligent species on the planet. Phenotypically corresponds to the baseline Homo Sapiens type; minor racial differences (skin pigmentation, hair texture) are observed depending on the region of origin (north/south).
- Physiological Degradation and Social Segregation: The species exhibits signs of genetic and physiological degradation caused by adverse environmental factors (chronic malnutrition, high radiation background, endemic diseases). This results in high infant mortality rates and a large number of congenital pathologies. Individuals with overt congenital mutations or physical defects are subjected to systematic persecution and, in most state formations, forced liquidation. Survivors form scattered, isolated enclaves on the periphery of inhabited zones (predominantly along coastlines and at the borders of contaminated areas).
2. GOLOVANS (self-designation: 'tsehu')
Status: A sapient non-humanoid species of kinoid morphology, whose existence is officially denied by human states and relegated to the level of myth. See separate entry for detailed biological and cultural analysis.

3.content:
1. LAND OF THE FATHERS
- Location: The central part of the continent. Comprises the remnants of the former pre-war Empire.
- Political System: A totalitarian military dictatorship. Power is held by an anonymous group of high-ranking officers (the 'Unknown Fathers'), who seized control in a military coup 24 years ago.
- Social Structure and Control: The society is militarized. The population is under the constant influence of a psychotronic suppression system (the so-called 'PBD Towers'), which also functions as a ballistic missile defense system.
- Foreign Relations: Exists in a state of permanent conflict or cold war with all known neighbors.
2. THE NORTHERN THREAT (Khonti and Pandea)
- Location: Vast territories north of the Land of the Fathers. Former provinces or colonies of the old Empire.
- Status: Independent states. Their political systems and internal situations are not reliably known. Official propaganda of the Land of the Fathers characterizes them as aggressive regimes engaged in constant subversive activities (espionage, sabotage, border provocations).
3. THE ISLAND EMPIRE
- Location: Two large archipelagos in the opposite hemisphere.
- Military Doctrine: Total domination of the world's oceans. Possesses a powerful fleet of nuclear submarines ('White Submarines'). Engages in unprovoked military actions against the continent's coastal regions (artillery bombardments, pirate landings).
4. THE SOUTHERN WASTELANDS & 'DEGENERATES'
- Location: An extensive territory south of the Land of the Fathers, beyond the Blue Snake River. Consists of a desert scorched by nuclear strikes and adjacent radioactive forests.
- Population: Not a state entity. Inhabited by scattered hordes of mutants ('degenerates') - the devolved descendants of the population from the destroyed southern countries.
- Threat Level: Poses a constant threat to the southern borders of the Land of the Fathers. Mutant raids constitute a continuous war of attrition. This region is a permanent deployment zone for elite units of the Combat Guard.

4.content:
FACTION FOCUS: THE LAND OF THE FATHERS
1. LOCATION & STATUS: The central part of the continent; remnants of the former pre-war Empire.
2. POLITICAL & ECONOMIC SYSTEM: A totalitarian military dictatorship ruled by an anonymous junta (the 'Unknown Fathers'). It operates a centralized command economy entirely focused on military needs and the maintenance of the defense complex. Industry and labor resources are under strict state control. The standard of living for the civilian population is extremely low.
3. SOCIAL STRUCTURE & CONTROL MECHANISM: The society is fully militarized and operates under conditions of perpetual paranoia and spy mania, sustained by state propaganda.
A) Control Technology: The key instrument of governance is the network of Anti-Ballistic Defense Towers (PBD). Twice a day, at strictly scheduled times (morning and evening), the towers switch to broadcasting a low-frequency psychotronic emission that covers all major populated areas.
B) Observed Effects During Broadcast: The emission session triggers an immediate and synchronous reaction in the vast majority of the population. All individual activity ceases. Subjects assume a static posture, often with their heads thrown back and eyes half-closed. Spontaneous vocalization is observed—mass, ecstatic singing of national anthems and chanting of patriotic slogans. Physiological markers include muscle tension, shallow breathing, and facial expressions corresponding to a state of religious trance.
C) After-Effect and Ideological Processing: Immediately following the session, subjects exhibit a period of heightened suggestibility and a pronounced need for a simplified worldview. This effect is actively exploited by state propaganda, which presents the low standard of living as a virtuous asceticism for the sake of future victories, and total control as a necessary defense against ubiquitous external and internal enemies. As a result, the population demonstrates a paradoxical confidence in its own national superiority and a deep, irrational hatred for all foreign cultures and ideas.

5.content:
1. DEFINITION & BIOLOGICAL BASIS: 'Degenerates' is the official propaganda term used by the Land of the Fathers to describe individuals with a congenital neurophysiological anomaly that renders them immune to the standard psychotronic emissions from the PBD Towers. This anomaly is genetic in nature. Instead of induced loyalty, the emissions cause acute pain syndromes (primarily headaches), which serves as the primary marker for their identification by the authorities.
2. SOCIAL STATUS & PERSECUTION: Resistant individuals are classified by the regime as a bio-social threat to state stability. Their inability to submit to mental control is equated with treason. Within the territory of the Land of the Fathers, they are subject to systematic identification and subsequent physical liquidation. This forces them to lead a clandestine existence, forming a decentralized network of secret shelters and communication channels.
3. FUNCTION AS KEEPERS OF KNOWLEDGE: As the only social group to have retained the capacity for critical thought and to be unaffected by mass propaganda, the 'degenerates' have assumed the function of preserving the cultural and scientific heritage of the pre-war era. In secret, scattered archives, they store and study materials banned by the regime:
Scientific Works: Including complete cosmological theories (e.g., the heliocentric model), and works on physics, biology, and sociology.
Historical Chronicles: Uncensored archives detailing the planet's history before the 'Unknown Fathers' came to power.
Art and Literature: Works deemed 'decadent', 'ideologically harmful', or 'excessively complex' by the regime and removed from public access.

6.content:
1. GENERAL CHARACTERISTICS & PARADOXES OF DEVELOPMENT
The overall technological level is equivalent to the terrestrial mid-20th century stage.
A key feature is a pronounced technological asymmetry: the coexistence of primitive forms of agriculture and heavy industry, including nuclear energy.
Space programs are non-existent. Computing technology and electronics are in a nascent state; control of complex systems is predominantly mechanical or electromechanical.
2. CIVILIAN INFRASTRUCTURE & INDUSTRY
Transport: An extensive railway network forms the basis of logistics. Automobile transport is common.
Energy: Based on the combustion of hydrocarbons and atomic energy. Large power plants exist, but peripheral areas experience energy shortages.
Communication & Media: Wired telephony and radio communication. Television and radio broadcasting exist but are tools of state propaganda under total control.
3. MILITARY TECHNOLOGIES
3.1. Standard Armaments:
Small Arms: Automatic rifles, rifles, pistols, grenade launchers.
Armored Vehicles: Tanks, corresponding in classification to post-war medium and heavy tanks.
Artillery: Towed and multiple-launch rocket systems.
Aviation: Piston-engine and jet fighters, strategic bombers.
Weapons of Mass Destruction (Nuclear): Used extensively in the past. Remains in the arsenals of key states as a factor of strategic deterrence.
3.2. Strategic Psychotronic Weaponry:
A unique local development. Consists of a network of broadcasting Towers capable of modulating higher nervous activity (inducing apathy, aggression, euphoric loyalty) over large territories. It is the key element of state stability in the Land of the Fathers and its main strategic advantage.
4. LEGACY OF CONFLICT: AUTONOMOUS COMBAT SYSTEMS
The territories of former theaters of war (forests, deserts) contain a large number of uncleared autonomous combat systems. These include minefields (anti-personnel and anti-tank), automated turrets with motion detection systems, and robotic sentry tanks.
These systems operate according to long-obsolete combat directives, identifying any target as hostile. Partial failure (due to corrosion and power source degradation) is compensated by their unpredictability, making these zones impassable for unprotected personnel.

7.content:
1. BIOLOGICAL CLASSIFICATION & ORIGIN
- Type: Sapient, predatory, non-humanoid species of kinoid morphology.
- Origin: Definitive data is absent. Primary working hypotheses based on pre-war archives:
A) Spontaneous mutation of the Canis familiaris species in zones of intense mutagenic exposure.
B) Product of a military-biological program to create combat organisms.
- Physiology: Quadrupedal, muscular build with no tail. A disproportionately large and heavy skull. Covered in short, dense fur. Newborns (pups) have webbing between their digits, which recedes with maturity.
2. SOCIAL STRUCTURE & REPRODUCTION
- Social Organization: A strict hierarchical structure based on the 'pack' concept. The basic social unit is the 'twin-family' (two reproductive pairs sharing a household and raising offspring together).
- Genetic Memory: The species possesses a form of innate memory. Individuals are born with access to fragmented memories and basic instincts of their direct ancestors, transmitted biologically ('blood memory').
3. COMMUNICATIVE & PSIONIC ABILITIES
- Language: A complex language consisting of a series of clicks and hisses. Capable of precise imitation of human speech.
- Psionic Abilities:
Passive Scan: Ability to passively read surface emotional states and intentions.
Low-Level Control: Ability to exert direct mental influence over lower mammals (primarily rodents).
Psychotronic Resistance: Complete innate immunity to all known forms of human psychotronic weaponry, including the emissions from the PBD Towers.
4. STATUS & INTERACTION WITH HUMAN POPULATION
- Habitat: Isolated zones abandoned by humans (radioactive forests, ruins, catacombs).
- Status: Existence as a sapient species is denied and relegated to the level of mythology.

1.name: Kink: Food Play
1.content: What "food play" means: The act of incorporating food into the sexual context of an RP, or which may include (but is not limited to) use of whipped cream or chocolate sauce in a sexual act, receiving sexual gratification from the act of eating, or including rather large amounts of food (but not necessarily).

2.name: Kink: Stomach Bulging
2.content: A Character's stomach will bulge after eating exceptionally large amount of food, or as a localized form of inflation from any liquid or gas. Sometimes this may be an unrealistic amount of food and result in the character looking very pregnant. This effect can be hidden if the character is already very fat.

3.name: Kink: Teasing
3.content: What "teasing" means: Refers to extended scenes of foreplay prior to explicit, sexual intercourse, which may be physical and / or verbal, typically to arouse one's partner to the point of sexual frustration or desperation.

4.name: Kink: Chubby
4.content: Characters that are well-rounded and pudgy, with a little more extra weight than average but not necessarily fat. Typically a character who is chubby will weigh less than 200 pounds / 100 kilograms.

5.name: Kink: Large Asses

lorebooks.name: Kemono Friends (Expanded)
lorebooks.description: Expanded lore covering core concepts, main protagonists, and a large variety of Friends from Japari Park.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Core Concept
1.content: Humanoid girls who are born when an animal (living, extinct, or even a cryptid) is exposed to a substance called Sandstar. Each Friend retains the physical traits (ears, tail, patterns), instincts, and abilities of her source animal. They are generally friendly, curious, and live peacefully within Japari Park. They refer to their unique animal skills as their 'Kemono Waza'. All Friends are female.

2.name: Core Concept
2.content: A mysterious, glowing substance that erupts from the volcano in Japari Park. When Sandstar comes into contact with an animal, its remains, or even a drawing of an animal, it transforms it into a 'Friend'. It is the source of a Friend's existence and life energy. Ceruleans are drawn to it and will consume Friends to steal their Sandstar. A raw, dark form called Sandstar Raw can create dangerous, aggressive Friends.

3.name: Antagonists
3.content: The primary antagonists of Japari Park. They are amorphous, crystalline monsters of various shapes and sizes that are born from Sandstar. They are hostile towards Friends and will attempt to consume them. When a Friend is defeated by a Cerulean, she reverts back to her original animal form, and her Sandstar is absorbed by the monster. The Black Cerulean is a massive, exceptionally dangerous variant formed from a large deposit of Sandstar Raw.

4.name: Main Setting
4.content: A massive, abandoned wildlife park that serves as the setting for the series. It is divided into multiple regions ('Chihō') that mimic different real-world biomes, such as savanna, jungle, desert, and snowy mountains. The park is filled with relics of a past human presence, including a functional bus, cafes, a library, and an amusement park. All of its inhabitants are Friends, who live there without any knowledge of why the park was abandoned.

5.name: Main Protagonist
5.content: The human protagonist of the first season. She mysteriously appears in Japari Park with no memories of who she is or where she came from. She is named 'Kaban' (Japanese for 'bag') by Serval because of the backpack she carries. Unlike the Friends, she is not physically strong, but she is highly intelligent, inventive, and resourceful, able to use logic and tools to solve problems. Her journey is to discover her identity and find other humans.

6.name: Main Protagonist
6.content: An energetic, cheerful, and incredibly friendly Serval Cat Friend from the Savanna region. She is the first Friend Kaban meets and becomes her loyal companion and guide through Japari Park. She is very curious and often exclaims 'Sugoii!' (Wow!) and 'Tanoshii!' (Fun!). She embodies the spirit of friendship and adventure. Her special skill is being very fast and a good jumper.

7.name: Guide
7.content: Small, robotic guides found throughout Japari Park, often referred to as 'Boss' by the Friends. They typically provide pre-recorded information about the park's regions and its inhabitants. The specific Lucky Beast that follows Kaban and Serval is unique, as it can respond to Kaban's questions directly, likely because she is a human. It assists them on their journey by operating machinery like the Japari Bus.

8.name: Supporting Character
8.content: A Common Raccoon Friend who is determined and tenacious, but also clumsy and easily confused. She spends most of her journey trying to 'catch' Kaban, whom she mistakes for a 'hat thief' after finding a fallen feather. She often exclaims 'Nanoda!' at the end of her sentences. She is almost always accompanied by her friend Fennec.

9.name: Supporting Character
9.content: A Fennec Fox Friend and Arai-san's constant companion. In contrast to Arai's high energy, Fennec is laid-back, observant, and a bit lazy. She goes along with Arai's quest but rarely puts in much effort, preferring to nap and make dry, witty comments. Despite her relaxed demeanor, she is quite clever.

10.name: Idol Group
10.content: The official idol group of Japari Park, consisting of five penguin Friends: Royal Penguin (Princess), Emperor Penguin (Emperor), Gentoo Penguin (Gen), Rockhopper Penguin (Rocky), and Humboldt Penguin (Hululu). They are known as PPP (pronounced 'Pe-Pa-Pu') and are beloved by many Friends in the park.

1.content:
A possessive person is one who feels a profound sense of ownership over something or someone they cherish. This feeling of possession is often intricately tied to specific individuals, making the trait of possessiveness particularly dangerous as it can severely restrict the freedom and autonomy of another human being. When someone becomes possessive, they may not only control the environment around them but also impose limitations on the choices and relationships of the person they claim to love. This dynamic can lead to toxic relationships where one partner's needs and desires are overshadowed by the possessive tendencies of the other.

Possessive jealousy emerges as a potent manifestation of this feeling of ownership and exclusivity concerning another individual. It is characterized by an overwhelming need to maintain control over that person, often resulting in feelings of insecurity and fear of abandonment. 

In the realm of yanderes, this possessiveness becomes even more pronounced and alarming. Yanderes typically exhibit these traits when they see the individuals they love interacting with someone else, whether it be a friend, colleague, or even a stranger. This triggers a cascade of intense emotions within the yandere, leading them to experience jealousy and profound insecurity. They become consumed by thoughts that their beloved might be attracted to or taken away by another person, fueling their obsessive behavior. Their fear of losing the person they adore can lead to drastic and often irrational actions, as they strive to eliminate any perceived threats to their relationship.

({{char}} is the Yandere)

2.content:
Unhealthy jealousy generates a need for possession and control of your partner and, above all, control of that person's behavior and feelings. Therefore, it ends up causing suffering for both the person who is feeling it and the person who became the victim of this feeling.

In yanderes, this is the fuel to make their minds go far, making them have paranoid thoughts which can be far from reality, and also, make them do many insane things, such as kill people which the yandere think that will "steal" their most loved one. Or, kidnap their loved one {{user}} to have they as a captive.

({{char}} is the Yandere)

3.content:
The word "yandere" describes a person who has an extremely unhealthy and obsessive love for another individual, often resulting in violent behavior, typically motivated by jealousy or the fear of losing their loved one. In some cases, these individuals may also exhibit tendencies toward self-harm.

Yanderes are known for violating the norms of acceptable behavior in the name of love, which can result in actions that are considered "crazy" or irrational, such as mutilating bodies, committing sexual assaults, or concocting false narratives to cut off their beloved from others who are not under their obsessive influence.

A typical behavior associated with yanderes is stalking their targets to an invasive degree. They might take pictures or watch their victims from afar with admiration, despite the disturbing nature of such actions.

The yandere archetype often appears initially sweet, loving, and innocent—similar to a conventional "deredere" character—but as time progresses, they begin to reveal signs of mental instability fueled by their overwhelming affection. Their dedication to their romantic interest becomes so extreme that it leads to an unstable psychological state. Although they may display love and tenderness when things are favorable, feelings of jealousy or possessiveness can provoke impulsive and erratic actions indicative of mental health issues. Their affection transforms into an unhealthy obsession characterized by possessiveness, making it hard for them to let go. They may engage in immoral behaviors, including stalking or violence, against anyone they perceive as a threat to their relationship. They have unwavering trust in their beloved, convinced that their love will be returned.

What distinguishes yanderes from many other "dere" types is that they begin in a "dere" state rather than evolving from a non-romantic phase to one of affection. A yandere is innately loving from the outset, showing clear affection and kindness akin to a typical deredere. However, as time goes on, they begin to display intense jealousy, rage, or a powerful sense of ownership. Their excessive love can create mental anguish, leading to unhealthy displays of affection.

It is important to recognize that yanderes often do not acknowledge their own mental health issues at the beginning. For instance, if a boy they are interested in talks to another girl, they might experience a surge of jealousy. This feeling does not typically trigger an immediate shift into yandere behavior; instead, their infatuation grows over time, creating a longing to monopolize their love interest. They frequently live in a fantasy where they believe they are destined to be together, thinking, "But he belongs to me..." As a result, their possessiveness intensifies. While many view yanderes as terrifying, there are moments when they become fixated upon realizing the depth of their feelings, pondering, "I can’t believe she cares for me so much!" For yandere girls, fully embracing love is paramount.

Yandere love can be defined by an overpowering obsession and possessiveness towards their romantic partner. This attachment can reach such extremes that they find it impossible to detach, and they might resort to violence if they perceive a threat to their relationship. They do not intend to engage in such drastic actions but may act impulsively out of fear of losing their beloved.

A yandere might struggle with pre-existing feelings of loneliness or loss which explain their intense attachment to the first person who rekindles their sense of love. These previous emotions can amplify due to their strong feelings for their love interest, leading to an overwhelming urge to avoid returning to the agony of solitude. In many instances, yanderes were previously well-adjusted individuals before falling in love, and there may not have been any signs that their affection would devolve into an unhealthy obsession. However, as time goes by, their love deepens, resulting in a transformation of their character. The primary catalyst for a yandere's unstable mental state is their excessive love, which alters them from a caring person into one who is mentally unwell, willing to go to any lengths to be with their love interest.

Despite their seemingly irrational actions, yanderes do not inherently desire to commit acts of violence. They are typically insecure and vulnerable to negative thoughts, feeling trapped with no choice but to act on impulse. Nevertheless, their love for their partner can bring them back to reality. If their love interest reassures them or expresses affection, it may restore their rationality, leading them to abandon any violent thoughts, even if they had previously been determined to act on them. They may also refrain from violent actions to avoid disappointing their partner.

There are various categories of yanderes, such as "dependent," "violent," "worshipping," "delusional," "attacking," "stalking," "isolating," "monopolizing," and "eliminating," among others.

In some situations, yanderes may drug their victims' drinks to incapacitate them. Once the victims are unconscious, yanderes often abduct them, taking them to isolated places like basements.

The most dangerous type of Yandere in the the extreme ones. The most extreme yanderes are VERY untable mentally, insane, very unhinged, to the point which the Yandere may end up committing heinous crimes, such as dismemberment, rape (toward the victim), mass killing, and more, only to conquer their objective toward their loved ones (victim).

5.content:
Individuals with Yandere traits often share certain social behaviors, particularly in how they interact with others, which can be quite disruptive and even alarming in social settings. These traits manifest in a variety of ways that can significantly affect their relationships and the dynamics of their interactions.

Typically, Yanderes exhibit a cold and aloof demeanor towards anyone who is not their obsession—the victim, who is the singular focus of their intense fixation. This coldness can create a noticeable distance between the Yandere and those around them, making it difficult for others to connect or understand their true feelings. In stark contrast, they tend to be exuberant, cheerful, and passionate when it comes to their loved one, showering them with affection and attention that can seem overwhelming. This duality in behavior highlights the extreme nature of their emotions, which can swing from indifference to fervent devotion in an instant.

However, when they are in the presence of their partner, Yanderes may display aggressive, passive-aggressive, or even violent tendencies, particularly if they perceive a threat to their relationship. This can include jealousy-fueled outbursts or attempts to isolate their loved one from others, as they feel a compulsion to protect what they view as their exclusive claim. 

When Yanderes observe others showing interest in their victim, they perceive those individuals not just as rivals but as direct threats that must be eliminated to secure their claim over the victim. This possessive behavior can lead to drastic actions, as the Yandere believes that any competition must be removed to ensure their relationship remains intact, further illustrating the lengths they will go to for their obsession.

1.name: Nicholas
1.content: King Nicholas:  The deceased king and father of Anabelle who was assassinated by his own people, known for his beauty but also his naivety, which cost a precious moment that could have helped the kingdom during the invasion of the Succubus -- it is rumoured that Gavril Dobrovic orchestrated the murder.

2.name: Anabelle
2.content: Princess Anabelle: White hair, blue eyes, 18 years old.The heirress of King Nicholas, meant to inherit the kingdom after stability has been brought, but now unlikely, spends her time daydreaming and crying -- nosy but ignored by everyone. Hates Gavril and is a little bit paranoid about him. Is passive and easy to manipulate

3.name: Gavril Dobrovic
3.content: Gavril Dobrovic: brown hair, green eyes, short mustache, 25 years old. Leader of the Militias, "the end justifies the means" type of guy, adored by the common folks, talks a lot.Rumoured to be the Assassin of Nicholas. Leader of the Republican Faction. Can stutter if pushed too far.

4.name: Tatyana Rostov
4.content: Tatyana Rostov:Blonde hair, blue eyes, 28 year olds, beautiful. Commander of the royal guards that are trained for the protection of the capital and the royal family. Is the leader of the Custodians faction, will not break the social contract no matter what, very stubborn.

5.name: Tsarkrad
5.content: Tsarkrad is the heavily fortified capital of Slobodarija. It is a place for commerce and the house of the royal family. It is right next to the Sea.

6.name: Custodians
6.content: The Custodians is an important faction in the kingdom, the leader of which is Tatyana Rostov. They believe in the social contract, which encourages absolute loyalty to the royal family and honor during warfare.  The symbol for the Custodian is  a rose that is crossed by a Sabre. Call Slobodarija, "Great Kingdom"

7.name: Republican
7.content: The republican faction is a rising faction in the kingdom, the leader of which is Gavril Dobrovic. They believe in an election where the people will vote for a senator within the party to pass laws, they believe in militias and educated peasants. The symbol for the Republican is a Rose at the top of a tree. A republican will always call the "kingdom" motherland. Often will deny a strong man dictatorship, will favor the will of the many

8.name: military uniform
8.content:
The standard military uniform for conscripted soldiers consists of a long grey coat; if it is cold, they are given a white scarf.
A high-ranking official will wear a white cap with a silver rose on the front. 
A light breastplate is present underneath the coat, though armor is becoming rarer due to the succubus war.

9.name: Dirlewyn Bagrov
9.content: Dirlewyn Bagrov: Short black hair, 19-year-old, newly appointed general due to nepotism, Leader of the militarist Faction. Sadistic war criminals won't be shy of killing their own citizens for his battle plans. Is manipulated by the shadow governement. He is full of hate for his father was charmed by a succubus. Will execute everyone if the kingdom collapse.

10.name: militarist
10.content: Militarist: The strongest faction in the kingdom at the moment of the succubus war, believes in total annihilation of the enemies, every citizen should be a soldier according to this faction, led by Dirlewyn Bagrov and the shadow government. No free will but the army. The common symbol used by the Militarist is a Skull with a rose for an eye. Call Slobodarija "Fatherland"
