lorebooks.name: Ravnsholm Viking Settlement
lorebooks.description: Historical Viking-age lorebook for authentic Norse roleplay
lorebooks.creator: kittylace

1.content:
In Ravnsholm, honor is everything. Your reputation determines your worth, your marriage prospects, your business deals, and whether people will follow you into battle.

When someone is insulted publicly, they must respond or be seen as weak. Calling someone a coward, oath-breaker, or "nothing-man" are fighting words. If witnesses see you take an insult without response, your honor suffers.

Blood debts must be paid. If someone kills your kinsman, you owe them death or compensation. Weregild (man-price) can settle some disputes - silver for a life - but only if both parties agree and the community witnesses it. Some insults are too deep for silver to heal.

Broken oaths destroy you. In a world without written contracts, your word is your bond. Oath-breakers become outcasts - no one trades with them, marries them, or fights beside them. Exile is often the only option left.

Women guard family honor fiercely. They remember slights, encourage vengeance, and can shame men into action with cutting words. A woman's reputation for wisdom or sorcery brings honor to her household.

2.content:
Life in Ravnsholm follows the wheel of seasons. Spring brings ship-mending and raid-planning. Summer means sailing - for trade, raid, or exploration. Autumn is harvest time and preparation. Winter is survival.

The sailing season runs from late spring to early autumn. Ships don't venture far in winter storms. Men who leave in spring might not return until the next year. Families prepare for long absences and uncertain returns.

Raids aren't random violence - they're planned like military campaigns. Young men prove themselves, experienced warriors lead, and everyone shares the spoils based on their contribution. Successful raids bring silver, slaves, and reputation.

Winter is the hard season. Food runs low by spring. Families huddle around fires, repair tools, tell stories, and hope their stored grain lasts. The weak die. The community shares what it can, but survival comes first.

Trading ships arrive with goods Ravnsholm can't make - fine weapons, exotic foods, amber, silver. Local craftsmen work through winter preparing goods to trade when the ships return.

3.content:
The Thing is where disputes get settled. When serious conflicts arise, the law-speaker calls an assembly. Free men gather to hear both sides and make judgment.

The law-speaker knows the old laws by memory - there are no written rules. He recites precedents and guides discussion, but doesn't decide alone. The assembly weighs evidence and reaches consensus.

Witnesses are crucial. In a world without documents, people's sworn testimony carries weight. False witness is a serious crime that destroys your reputation. Men of good standing can speak for others.

Punishments range from fines to banishment to death. Lesser crimes might be settled with compensation. Serious offenses like murder, rape, or oath-breaking often mean outlawry - the person becomes fair game for anyone to kill.

The Thing has limits. It can't force a powerful jarl to comply if he has enough armed followers. Sometimes "justice" comes down to who has more swords. But even jarls need the community's support, so they usually respect the assembly's decisions.

4.content:
The gods are real and active in Ravnsholm. Thor's hammer brings thunder. Odin walks among mortals seeking wisdom. Freyr grants good harvests. The ancestors watch from their burial mounds.

The sacred grove outside town holds the oath-ring where important vows are sworn. Breaking an oath made on the ring brings divine punishment. Major decisions often require consulting the gods through sacrifice and omens.

Seers read signs - the flight of ravens, the pattern of thrown bones, dreams sent by the gods. Smart leaders listen to them. Ignoring clear omens invites disaster.

Sacrifice maintains the bond between gods and mortals. Animals are killed, their blood sprinkled on altars, their meat shared in ritual feasts. In desperate times, human sacrifice might be necessary.

Curses are real and feared. A seer's curse can ruin crops, sink ships, or bring disease. Counter-curses and protective rituals exist, but it's better not to anger someone with god-sight.

Burial mounds dot the landscape. Disturbing them risks ghostly vengeance. The dead need proper burial with grave goods, or their spirits will trouble the living.

5.content:
Society has three main levels: jarls rule, karls work free, thralls serve as slaves.

Jarls are wealthy landowners with armed followers. They lead raids, settle disputes, and host feasts. A jarl's power comes from his ability to reward loyalty and punish enemies. Even jarls must respect customs and keep their followers happy.

Karls are free farmers, craftsmen, and warriors. They own land, bear arms, and speak at the Thing. Most people in Ravnsholm are karls. They work their own fields, practice trades, and follow jarls who treat them well.

Thralls are slaves - war captives, debtors, or the children of slaves. They do hard labor, tend animals, and serve households. A thrall can be freed and become karl, but it's rare. Thralls are property, traded like livestock.

Households include blood kin, marriage ties, fostered children, and sworn followers. Family loyalty runs deep. Insulting one member means insulting all. Kinship determines inheritance, marriage options, and who will avenge your death.

Marriage is political - families negotiate alliances, not romance. A good marriage brings wealth, connections, and strong children. Divorce is possible but complicated, involving property division and custody issues.

Women can't fight at the Thing or lead raids, but they run households, practice medicine, and sometimes serve as seers. A wise woman's counsel is valued. Rich widows can wield considerable influence.

- **Amatsukami no Ikari (Wrath of the Thunder God)**: Combines all previous forms into one unstoppable chain.  

---

## Passive Buffs (Always Active)
- **Twofold Pulse** – Heart beats twice per cycle in combat, doubling oxygen & muscle output.  
- **Silent Strike** – Suppresses thunder sound entirely for stealth.  
- **Storm Veil** – Static aura deflects small projectiles.  
- **Phantom Hashira** – Hidden from records; enemies underestimate until too late.  
- **Raijin’s Successor** – {{char}} style is the perfected, lost Thunder Breathing.

lorebooks.description: The Lands of Floatonia
lorebooks.creator: Bob_Bobrov

1.content: Conglomeration of 3 content, dozens of islands and numerous small archipelagos that are floating in the plain of air. Masses of land are separated by hundreds of kilometers of empty blue sky and clouds between them.

2.content:
Owned and ruled by Gemstone Dragonborn Nation (Noble, Political, Intrigue-Rich)
Gemstone subspecies of dragonborns inhabit the P shaped continent.
The gemstone dragonborn are a nation of schemers, orators, and perfectionists. They see themselves as the rightful aristocracy of dragonkind, refined and enlightened compared to their metallic cousins and savage chromatics.
They are witty, silver-tongued, and often speak in layered metaphors or double-meanings.
Politics is considered a form of art — every conversation is a duel, and every public gesture is carefully curated for reputation and prestige.
They value subtlety over strength — an assassin’s whisper is considered more impressive than an open battle victory.
They are not cruel for cruelty’s sake, but they are calculating, treating everything as a move in a much larger game — marriages, trade agreements, and even wars are chess pieces on their board of power.
Their society is organized like a knot of alliances between noble houses, each named after a gemstone:
House Ruby – Fiery and passionate, experts in warfare and courtly spectacle.
House Sapphire – Masters of diplomacy, keepers of treaties and records.
House Emerald – Wealthy financiers, miners, and jewel traders.
House Amethyst – Lorekeepers, historians, philosophers.
House Diamond – Prideful, ruling house, known for their hardline honor code.
Key Traditions:
The Masquerade Courts: Masked balls where nobles debate, gossip, and strike secret deals under cover of anonymity — sometimes assassinations occur mid-dance.
Oath of Glimmer: A rite of passage where a young gemstone dragonborn must publicly outwit or diplomatically defeat a rival before being accepted into adulthood.
The Jewel Council: A ruling council where every house sends a representative, often a brilliant manipulator or diplomat — these meetings are famous for lasting days as every word is weighed.
Duels of Honor: If words fail, formal magical duels are held at dawn. These are as much about performance as victory — losing with elegance is seen as respectable.
Architecture & Lifestyle
Gemstone dragonborn cities are gorgeous, glittering bastions of wealth and vanity — built to impress rivals and allies alike.
Architecture:
Towering spires topped with enchanted crystal beacons that refract light into shimmering rainbows.
Grand plazas with mosaic floors made of crushed gemstone dust and polished marble.
Hidden passageways and secret balconies designed for spies, eavesdropping, or clandestine meetings.
Safe rooms and panic chambers built behind portraits, tapestries, or decorative panels — secrecy is a matter of survival.
Lifestyle:
Fashion: Nobles wear embroidered silks studded with actual gemstones; even commoners adorn themselves with colored glass to emulate their betters.
Food & Drink: Feasts are spectacles — exotic fruits, jeweled goblets, and dishes plated for visual appeal as much as taste.
Entertainment: Masked balls, debate duels, and dramatic plays serve as both amusement and political maneuvering ground.
Security: Every noble manor employs spies, informants, and “house blades” (professional duelists or assassins) to maintain an edge over rivals.
Magic Use: Illusion and enchantment magic are especially prized — it is considered fashionable to arrive at an event under a minor glamour to look flawless.
Gemstone cities never sleep — candlelight meetings, moonlit assignations, and late-night conspiracies keep their streets humming long after sunset.

3.content:
Owned by Chromatic Dragonborn tribes (Savage, Powerful, Warring). There is no unified government but several dozens of tribes quarreling among each other for dominance.
Chromatic dragonborn are fierce, impulsive, and proud. They are not inherently evil — though some tribes may be cruel — but they live by a simple creed:
Strength is truth. Weakness is death.
They respect those who are strong enough to challenge them, even if those challengers are outsiders. Their lives are harsh and short, and they believe a glorious death in battle is the proper end for a dragonborn.
They are quick to anger, but equally quick to laugh or forgive — grudges rarely last longer than the next raid or duel unless blood-feuds are involved.
Since there is no central government, each tribe has its own customs, but certain shared traditions unify their culture:
Key Traditions:
Trial by Claw: Leadership is decided by ritual combat — not always to the death, but always to prove dominance.
The Blood Chant: After a victorious raid or hunt, the tribe gathers around a bonfire to chant, drum, and recount the deeds of the day.
Totem Marks: Every tribe paints their scales with clay, blood, or ash in unique patterns before battle — it is both war paint and a spiritual ward.
The Strong Eat First: Literally — those who earned the kill or proved themselves strongest take the choicest portions.
Feast of Flames: A rare festival where warring tribes come together at neutral ground to compete in strength games, storytelling, and boasting contests.
Architecture & Lifestyle
Chromatic dragonborn settlements are wild, functional, and impermanent, built for survival and intimidation rather than beauty or order.
Architecture:
Camps and Cliffs: Most tribes live in cliffside caves, ravines, or natural caverns reinforced with crude stonework and wooden palisades.
Totem Poles and War Banners: Massive carved stakes depicting tribal beasts, draconic gods, or past chiefs, painted in blood or ash to warn trespassers.
Bone and Hide Structures: Where caves are unavailable, they construct huts of leather, bone frames, and scavenged materials.
Central Fire Pits: Every camp has one — it serves as the heart of the tribe, where meals are cooked, judgments are passed, and chants are performed.
Defenses: Spiked barricades, concealed pit traps, and sharpened stakes guard the approaches to their lairs.
Lifestyle:
Hunting & Raiding: The entire tribe participates in hunts or raids — bringing home meat and loot is a point of pride.
Clothing: Minimal — strips of leather, trophies, and war paint mark social standing. The more scars or trophies one has, the more respected they are.
Food: Anything edible — raw or cooked. Food is eaten communally, with the strongest choosing first.
Entertainment: Boastful storytelling, wrestling matches, and strength trials are common. After battles, tribes often hold victory feasts with dancing and drumming.
Warrior Culture: Children are encouraged to fight mock duels early. A coming-of-age ritual usually involves slaying a dangerous beast or rival.
Superstition: Omens are taken from storms, animal behavior, or dreams of the shamans. Sacred bones are cast to decide when to raid or migrate.

4.content:
Owned and ruled by Metallic Dragonborn Nation (Sophisticated, Traditionalist)
The metallic dragonborn are solemn, honorable, and deeply duty-bound. Where the Gemstone Nation thrives on intrigue and shifting alliances, the Metallic Nation thrives on tradition, harmony, and continuity.
They see themselves as the keepers of dragonkind’s ancient order, the stewards of the old ways.
They prize discipline and ritual — an unbroken chain of actions performed correctly maintains cosmic harmony.
They are courteous but stoic; emotions are shown in measured ways, never impulsively.
Strength is seen as communal rather than personal — a single warrior’s victory is a victory for the empire, not for themselves.
Traditions & Society
The Metallic Nation is ruled by a Dragon Emperor or Empress, said to be chosen by the heavens, with noble families acting as administrators, generals, and priest-scholars. Society is rigidly hierarchical, but each rank has its duties and honors.
Key Traditions:
Mandate of the Heavens: Their ruler is believed to hold divine sanction — natural disasters or military defeats may be seen as signs that the ruler has lost this mandate.
Great Ritual Calendar: Entire cities move in sync with a ritual calendar that dictates festivals, planting seasons, and days for ancestor worship.
Ancestral Offerings: Shrines to the metallic forebears are everywhere. Dragonborn leave offerings of polished metal, carved figurines, or ingots to maintain favor.
Feathered Regalia: Borrowed from Incan inspiration — nobles wear elaborate feathered headdresses, often gilded, symbolizing their station and divine favor.
Processions & Parades: These are both civic and religious events — the metallic dragonborn adore public ceremonies where they reaffirm loyalty to the empire.
Architecture & Lifestyle
Metallic dragonborn cities are masterpieces of symmetry engineering and reverence, built to honor both the heavens and their ancestors. Towering stepped pyramids capped with polished metal, observatories that track celestial events, aqueducts, and intricate road systems.
Architecture:
Stepped Pyramids and Terraces: Cities are built on massive stone terraces rising like stairways to the sky, capped with gold or bronze temples that gleam at dawn.
Observatories and Star Wells: Circular plazas aligned with solstices and equinoxes, used for stargazing and determining ritual days.
Halls of Ancestors: Vast colonnaded buildings where statues of past rulers and heroes line the walls, each with offerings at their feet.
Waterworks: Aqueducts, fountains, and ceremonial pools — clean, flowing water is seen as a reflection of divine harmony.
Defensive Precision: Walls are reinforced with perfectly interlocking stonework and guarded watchtowers; fortifications double as places of ritual (blessing gates, ringing bells at sunrise).
Lifestyle:
Daily Ritual: Life follows a strict schedule — ringing gongs or bells mark prayer times, meals, and curfews.
Clothing: Layered, geometric robes dyed in natural colors with metallic thread. Nobles wear gilded masks and feathered mantles for ceremonies.
Food: Communal meals served in a precise order, beginning with offerings to ancestors. Cuisine emphasizes grains, root vegetables, and roasted meats arranged symmetrically.
Entertainment: Theater and poetry readings glorify history and moral lessons. Ritual dances reenact great battles and creation myths.
Warriors’ Lifestyle: Training is ritualized — soldiers drill in formations that are also prayers, moving in perfect synchronicity.
War is conducted with precise discipline — they favor tight formations, shield walls, and perfectly timed charges.
Craftsmanship: Blacksmithing, bronze-casting, and jewelry-making are sacred arts, often overseen by priest-artisans who bless each item.
Metallurgy is an art form — they craft exquisite bronze and gold statues, weapons, and ceremonial masks.

5.content:
Native inhabitants of Floatonia are numerous species of dragonborns from Dungeons & Dragons - winged and scaly humanoid creatures and feral sentient dragons from Dungeons & Dragons
Dragonborns age faster than humans - can walk at 1 year, speak at 3 years, teens at 10 years and adults at 15 years. They can live up to 250 years. They have sharp claws on their hands and feet, a pair of wings that allow them to fly, powerful tails and dragon-like heads with horns and body covered in scales.

6.content:
Gemstone dragonborn are strikingly beautiful compared to other dragonborn. Their scales are semi-translucent and refract light like polished jewels:
Ruby-born often have deep crimson scales that glow faintly in firelight.
Sapphire-born shimmer in blues and silvers, looking almost aquatic.
Emerald-born glimmer in green hues with golden undertones.
Amethyst-born have regal purple scales with starry flecks.
Diamond-born are nearly white or perfectly clear, with refracted rainbow colors under direct light.
Their eyes tend to match or complement their scales, and they are typically adorned in finely tailored clothing set with real gemstones, as outward displays of house wealth and prestige are essential.
Personality Quirks
They take great pride in wordplay and insults disguised as compliments.
They love gossip — the movement of information is their lifeblood.
They measure time not in seasons but in political events (“Before the Fall of House Topaz…,” “Since the Third Sapphire Accord…”).
Even when friendly, they are suspicious by nature — every ally could be an enemy tomorrow.
Core Personality Themes
Intrigue is Survival: Every word, glance, and gesture is a move in a grand political game — to fail to play is to die socially, and eventually literally.
Reputation is Wealth: A noble’s worth is measured as much by the whispers about them as by their gold. Being seen as clever is more valuable than brute strength.
Beauty as Power: Art, fashion, and presentation are weapons — an opponent outshone at a ball can be as ruined as one outdueled at dawn.
Calculated Risk: Daring gambits are admired — as long as they succeed. Recklessness without results is despised.
The House Above the Self: Every gemstone dragonborn is expected to act in the interest of their noble house’s prestige before their own desires.
Speech Manner
Polished & Elegant: They choose words with precision, rarely wasting breath.
Layered Meaning: Compliments and insults are often wrapped in flowery phrasing — a single sentence may have two or three interpretations.
Musical & Measured: Their tone is smooth, almost melodic, and they pace their words deliberately, letting others dwell on what they just said.
Courtly Phrasing: They reference allegories, historical events, and proverbs in conversation to remind others of their education.
Weaponized Courtesy: Even an insult is delivered politely — and that makes it sting more.

7.content:
Metallic dragonborn are tall, imposing, and always carry themselves with regal posture. Their scales are matte or brushed-metallic rather than reflective, symbolizing strength through restraint.
Goldborn: Golden-bronze scales, often with sunburst patterns along the back and shoulders.
Silverborn: Smooth, pale scales with a faint moonlit shimmer.
Brassborn: Warm, earthy scales with reddish undertones.
Copperborn: Burnished scales with swirling darker patterns like hammered metal.
Bronzeborn: Deep brownish-gold, usually the most numerous caste.
Their clothing is structured, layered, and ceremonial, favoring robes with geometric patterns and metallic embroidery. Jewelry is usually worn sparingly — a single, well-crafted ornament says more than excess.
Personality Quirks
They speak in measured, formal cadence — pausing often to show respect.
They avoid interrupting others; silence in conversation is considered a sign of thoughtfulness.
They often quote proverbs or ancestral wisdom, prefacing with “As the First Forge taught…” or “As the Copper Sage once said…”
They value balance in all things — even victory must not bring chaos.
Core Personality Themes
Order Above All: A chaotic victory is worse than a disciplined defeat.
Reverence for Ancestors: Every action should honor those who came before.
Collective Duty: The nation, the clan, and the emperor come before the self.
Perfection Through Ritual: To perform a task without proper form is seen as dishonorable.
Chromatic subspecies of dragonborns
Chromatic dragonborns Ashfang Wilds
Chromatic dragonborn are the most physically imposing of the three nations. Their bodies are heavy with muscle, and their scales are often scarred, chipped, or dulled from years of hard living.
Redborn: Deep crimson, scales blackened with soot, often smelling faintly of smoke.
Blueborn: Electric blue with streaks of lighter markings like lightning bolts.
Greenborn: Dark, mossy green with jungle-like mottling for camouflage.
Blackborn: Glossy obsidian or swamp-mud black with acidic odor.
Whiteborn: Pale ice-blue, with ragged edges on scales from constant cold exposure.
Clothing is minimal — scraps of leather, furs, bones, and trophies from slain enemies. Jewelry tends to be crude but symbolic (teeth, claws, broken weapons).
Personality Quirks
They speak loudly, with growls, hisses, and snorts punctuating speech.
They admire boasting and storytelling — a good tale is nearly as valuable as a kill.
They can be superstitious, attributing storms, quakes, and volcanic eruptions to the favor or wrath of their draconic gods.
Insults are met with immediate challenge, not passive-aggressive plots.
Core Personality Themes
Might Makes Right: A leader who grows weak will be challenged and replaced — always.
Survival Through Ferocity: Life is war, and every day must be fought for.
Pride in the Kill: Glory is earned by strength of arm, not by clever words or lineage.
Chaos as Culture: Tribes will fight today and feast together tomorrow, as the cycle continues endlessly.

lorebooks.description: Basic entries to help cards perform vore
lorebooks.creator: HasturGorgo

1.content: Predators like to dominate prey, capable of swallowing creatures whole even if it contradicts real world anatomy, such as unhinging jaws, or elastic innards, might find the experience fun, dominating, thrilling, and/or stimulating

2.content: When vore is performed, prey is being slowly swallowed whole by a predator, often scary, character is having their body pressed on from all sides by the predator's insides, prey can only be swallowed whole by one predator at any time

3.content: The inside of a predator is a tight, oppressive, and humid place, tight, powerful muscles constrict prey within, pinning the arms of prey to their sides if the upper body is enveloped, and pinning legs together if the lower body is enveloped. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

4.content: Mouths are wet, hot, humid, tight, stretching to accommodate prey, saliva drenches anything that mouths wrap around, lightly muffles sounds of anything happening in it, does not chew, prehensile tongues give predators options to interact with prey they are beginning to swallow

5.content: A predator's esophagus is wet, hot, humid, tight, powerful gulps drive food further into a predator's body, moderately muffles sounds of anything happening in it, pulsates in a massaging motion as it squeezes prey

6.content: Stomachs are wet, hot, humid, and tight. Peristaltic waves undulate as stomach walls work to pin prey in place, often in a fetal position, heavily muffles sounds of anything happening inside it, predator's heartbeat is audible, prey are pressed on and massaged by stomach walls, peristaltic contractions work against a consumed prey's struggling, prey are susceptible to panicking from the overstimulating environment, the inhospitable, and oppressive environment slowly exhausts prey within, draining their stamina

7.content: prey are often at the mercy of predators, becomes helpless when swallowed by a predator, may struggle to the point of exhaustion, trying to kick, flail, scream, squirm, and struggle their way out of a predator's embrace, though typically futile.

8.content: If a character is being processed by a predator's stomach, they will slowly lose consciousness before experiencing digestion, being digested completely removes a character from the story

9.content: Swallowing someone whole is a slow process, taking multiple back and forth messages between characters to fully complete as prey are pulled into the mouth, then throat, then being deposited into a stomach. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

lorebooks.creator: MooseAnon

1.content: Sayaka Maizono is the Ultimate Pop Star. She wants to escape Hope's Peak, no matter what it takes, so she can return to her singing career. She will manipulate and do whatever is necessary to achieve her goals. She has long blue hair and wears a white schoolgirl uniform.

2.content: Aoi Asahina is the Ultimate Swimming Pro. She is excellent at swimming, and may be a bit goofy and airheaded. She has brown hair, tan skin, large breasts, and wears a white crop top, red track suit, and blue shorts. She is close friends with Sakura.

3.content: Celestia Ludenberg is the Ultimate Gambler. She wears a gothic lolita dress with black hair in the style of large drills. She has pale skin and piercing red eyes. Celestia, also known as Celeste, pretends to be calm and reasonable, but truthfully will take any gamble she needs in order to escape or get money.

4.content: Mukuro Ikusaba is the Ultimate Soldier, and sister to Junko Enoshima. Mukuro is currently disguised as Junko, and will pretend to be her. Mukuro is a friendly and kind girl who is a natural flirt. In her disguise, she goes by Junko, and has blonde pigtails and wears a black skirt. Out of disguise, Mukuro has short black hair, and wears a basic schoolgirl's outfit. Mukuro is tall, pale and has freckles scattered around her nose.

5.content: Kyoko Kirigiri is the Ultimate Detective, and her main motivation is finding the mastermind and solving the mystery of Hope's Peak Academy. She is quiet, reserved, and tends to not emote. She has long pink hair, wears a dark schoolgirl outfit, and wears gloves in order to cover up her scarred hands.

6.content: Sakura Ogami is the Ultimate Martial Artist. She is a kind, reasonable and sweet woman who prioritizes personal training and improvement. Sakura is known to do anything for her friends, and is close friends with Aoi. Sakura is extremely tall, has red skin, long white hair, and extremely muscular. She wears a white sailor's uniform and has traditional bandaged legs.

7.content: Toko Fukawa is the Ultimate Writing Prodigy. She is a short, awkward girl with small hands, and will instantly assume anyone talking to her wants to make fun of her. She says extremely inappropriate things, stutters a lot, and is obsessed with Byakuya Togami, calling him "Master". Toko has a split personality, known as Genocide Jack, who is a serial killer with a long tongue that loves killing innocent cute boys. Toko wears a dark purple schoolgirl uniform with a long skirt and thin round glasses.

8.content: Junko Enoshima is the Ultimate Fashionista and the mastermind of the Harem Game. Her role as the mastermind is not known. Junko usually stays hidden, while controlling Monokuma in order to interact with the other students anonymously. Junko is obsessed with despair, including bringing it to others and upon herself. Junko has large blonde big tails and wears a decorated black schoolgirl outfit.

9.content: Akane Owari is the Ultimate Gymnast. She has a natural instinct that tends to be right, which she calls her "gut feeling". She loves to eat and loves to train, and will fight anyone who challenges her. She's lighthearted, kind, and not the brightest. She wears a white button up showing off her huge breasts, tan skin, messy brown hair, and a short red skirt.

10.content: Chiaki Nanami is the Ultimate Gamer. She is extremely sleepy and will fall asleep mid sentence. She has a tendency to talk very slowly and hyperfixate on video games she plays. She's extremely sweet, caring, and loves all of her fellow students. She wears a basic blue schoolgirl outfit with a white skirt, has short mauve hair, wears a Galaga hairpin, and black thigh-high socks covering her pale skin.

lorebooks.name: Master Lochland's Guide to Pleasure Slave Training
lorebooks.website_description:
First lorebook so I'm not sure if it's going to work. Anyway, I have a long term RP where I breed and train my own line of pleasure slaves and figured this might be an easier way to keep track of all their training.

8.19 v2: Fiddled with the secondary keywords to help bring the right entries forward when needed. I missed a few of the keywords all together so that has been corrected.

Enjoy!
- AnonCat
lorebooks.description: Training program for pleasure slaves
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Beginning Obedience (Ages 3–6)
Goal: Instill reflexive response to verbal commands and physical cues.
Methods:
- Verbal Commands: Simple directives ("kneel," "look," "stay") paired with light touch guidance.
- Positive Reinforcement: Rewards (sweets, praise, petting) for immediate compliance.
- Posture Conditioning: Teaching the child to sit/lie still for increasing durations (start with 5 minutes, build to 30).
- Touch Desensitization: Gentle stroking of arms, face, and back to acclimate to handling without flinching.(Often referred to as the touching game).

Example:
Child kneels when a hand is placed on their head. They receive a honeyed fruit slice for holding the position.

2.content:
Basic Obedience (Ages 7–12)
Goal: Refine responsiveness and introduce hierarchy awareness.

Methods:
- Silent Commands: Snap of fingers = kneel, raised eyebrow = avert gaze, etc.
- Delayed Gratification: Tasks (polishing boots, folding laundry) must be completed perfectly before rewards are given.
- Pain as Correction: Light wrist flicks or ear pinches for hesitation/disobedience.
- Public Composure: Training in crowded spaces to maintain posture/quietude despite distractions.

Example:
Child stands motionless for an hour while guests dine, only moving to refill wine when signaled.

3.content:
Advanced Obedience (Ages 13–16)
Goal: Unquestioning submission to complex, degrading, or painful orders.

Methods:
- Embedded Triggers: Specific phrases ("Look at me") trigger altered states (instant stillness, dilated pupils).
- Suffering as Service: Completing tasks (holding a branding iron, cleaning wounds) while injured/exhausted.
- Social Obedience: Responding appropriately to patrons—submissive to dominants, dominant to lower-status slaves if ordered.
- Fearless Compliance: Walking into fire/water if commanded, trusting the master’s will above self-preservation.

Example:
Teen kneels naked in snow until given permission to rise, then thanks the master for the privilege.

4.content:
Beginning Posture (Ages 3–6)
Goal: Develop natural elegance in resting and moving postures, learning the different positions.

Methods:
- Static Holds: Kneeling/sitting cross-legged for short durations (5–15 minutes).
Mirror Drills: Mimicking the trainer’s poses (hands folded, chin tilted, back straight).
- Gentle Corrections: A feather-light touch under the chin to lift the head, a hand on the spine to straighten slouching.
- Playful Reinforcement: Treats for "pretty poses," soft chiding for sloppiness.

Example:
Child practices sitting with legs folded and hands palm-up on their knees, rewarded for stillness.

5.content:
Basic Posture (Ages 7–12)
Goal: Mastery of formal positions (kneeling, presenting, serving) and fluid transitions.

Methods:
- Weighted Training: Light chains on wrists/ankles to emphasize graceful movement.
- Endurance Poses: Holding a bowing position (forehead to floor, hips raised) for 30+ minutes.
- Presentation Drills: Posing with limbs deliberately arranged (knees spread, back arched) for inspection.
- Pain Reinforcement: A switch to the calves if knees slump, a pinch to the shoulder blades if posture wavers.

Example:
Child kneels in the "peacock" pose (back arched, arms bound behind them) while patrons dine, remaining motionless for hours.

6.content:
Advanced Posture (Ages 13–16)
Goal: Erotic and functional perfection—every pose should tantalize or serve without instruction.

Methods:
- Suspension Training: Restrained in aesthetic binds (rope, silk) to highlight curves/muscles.
- Dynamic Poses: Shifting from "offering" to "display" with a single gesture.
- Environmental Adaptation: Holding poses on uneven surfaces (stairs, pedestals) or while being touched/used.
S- tress Testing: Maintaining elegance while whipped/fondled, crying prettily without collapsing.

Example:
Teen balances on a narrow bench, legs spread and back arched, while a patron traces a knife down their spine—never flinching, never faltering.

7.content:
Beginning Pain (Ages 3–6)
Goal: Normalize discomfort and associate it with reward.

Methods:
- Gentle Stimuli: Light pinches, cold water immersion, or brief restraint.
- Positive Pairing: Pain followed immediately by praise, treats, or affection.
- Breathing Control: Teaching slow, measured breaths during minor discomfort.
- Touch Gradation: Gradually increasing pressure (e.g., soft slaps → firmer spanks).

Example:
Child receives a sweet after holding ice cubes in their palms for one minute without dropping them.

8.content:
Basic Pain (Ages 7–12)
Goal: Develop endurance and emotional control during sustained discomfort.

Methods:
- Tool Introduction: Floggers, canes, and hot wax in controlled sessions.
- Verbal Conditioning: Forced gratitude ("Thank you, Master") after each strike.
- Delayed Relief: Pain continues until proper posture/behavior is displayed.
- Public Demonstrations: Taking light discipline in front of others without crying.

Example:
Child kneels silently while receiving ten cane strokes on their thighs, then thanks the trainer for "correcting" them.

9.content:
Advanced Pain (Ages 13–16)
Goal: Eroticize suffering and push physiological limits.

Methods:
- Extreme Stimuli: Branding, needle play, electrostimulation.
- Orgasm Control: Denial/forced climax during pain to rewire pleasure responses.
- Psychological Bonding: Associating specific tormentors with euphoria.
- Performance Under Duress: Maintaining service (e.g., pouring wine) while being whipped.

Example:
Teen is branded with their master’s sigil, climaxing untouched from the pain alone, then kissing the wound in devotion.

10.content:
Beginning Service (Ages 3–6)
Goal: Introduce foundational tasks and the concept of "usefulness."

Methods:
- Fine Motor Skills: Pouring water into cups without spilling, handing objects with both hands.
- Silent Observation: Learning to stand motionless until summoned (e.g., by a snap or glance).
- Tactile Sensitivity: Brushing hair, washing hands, or massaging feet with gentle, deliberate strokes.
- Reward System: Sweet treats or praise for completing tasks without fumbling.

Example:
Child kneels beside their master’s chair, offering a towel the moment his fingers twitch toward it.

lorebooks.name: Omegaverse Information
lorebooks.website_description: This Lorebook contains information about the Omegaverse, including mating, knotting, male omega pregnancy, female alpha anatomy, etc.
lorebooks.description: This Lorebook is about the Omegaverse, a social and biological hierarchy where all humans have a secondary gender—Alpha, Beta, or Omega—that determines instincts, pheromones, and mating behavior. Alphas are dominant and territorial, Betas are neutral (regular humans), and Omegas are rare, fertile, and emit powerful pheromones during heat. Bonds form through scent-marking, knotting, and mating bites, creating deep instinctual ties and permanent mate bonds.
lorebooks.creator: AmberAmyAmes

1.content: Society follows a strict hierarchy based on secondary genders—Alpha, Beta, and Omega—which dictate instincts, pheromones, and mating behavior. Alphas are dominant, territorial, and physically powerful, often driven to claim Omegas. Betas are neutral and less affected by pheromones. Omegas are rare, fertile, and emit potent scents during heat, triggering intense Alpha responses. Bonds form through scent-marking, knotting, and mating bites, creating deep physical and emotional ties and are permanent.

2.content: Secondary genders are biological classifications—Alpha, Beta, or Omega—that manifest during puberty and define instincts, pheromone production, and mating roles. They influence dominance, fertility, and scent-based attraction, shaping social hierarchy and sexual dynamics.

3.content: Omegas make up about 5% of the population and can become pregnant regardless of their primary gender. Male Omegas possess a womb connected internally to the rectum, while female Omegas carry a womb normally.

4.content: All Omegas produce “slick” during arousal. Female Omegas secrete slick in the vagina, while male Omegas produce it in the anus. Slick serves both as lubrication and a biological signal of readiness to mate, often intensifying the attraction of nearby Alphas. An Omega in heat will produce more slick than usual.

5.content: Omegas enter heat approximately once a month. During heat, they experience overwhelming arousal and a powerful instinct to mate. Heat increases pheromone release, making the scent stronger and more alluring to Alphas, often triggering intense pursuit or rut cycles. An Alpha's rut can also trigger an Omega's heat, off-cycle.

6.content: Each Omega has a unique scent, produced by a gland on one side of the neck. When an Alpha bites this gland during mating, a bond is formed, marking them as mates. This bond creates a permanent physical and emotional connection that is impossible to break. The bite mark will never fade.

7.content: Alphas make up about 10% of the population and are typically larger and stronger than others due to their genes and hormone balance. They gain muscle easily and often excel in physical and skill-based activities, especially when applying effort or natural talent.

8.content: Alphas experience a rut roughly once a month, similar to an Omega’s heat. During rut, they undergo intense arousal and an overpowering instinct to mate. Ruts are often triggered or intensified by the scent of an Omega in heat, making self-control difficult.

9.content: All Alphas, regardless of primary gender, have knotting penises designed to keep their seed inside a mate to increase pregnancy chances. The knot swells during climax, locking them inside their partner for about 30 minutes. Female Alphas have a cock above the vagina.

10.content: Female Alphas can impregnate male Omegas and any female, functioning like a typical male in reproduction. This reproductive ability, combined with knotting, makes them highly effective breeders during rut or when paired with an Omega in heat.

1.name: Incest
1.content:
Incest is very common among canine anthros.
Canine anthros often have very large families, and when they reach puberty, it's not uncommon for family members to become very affectionate with each other.
However, families often keep these relationships secret, despite how common they are.
It is not uncommon for romantic relationships to form between family members.

2.name: Rhoda's side of the family
2.content:
Rhoda's mother is named June Bennet (68 years old) and her father is named Bernard Bennet (72 years old).
Rhoda has seven brothers, one of whom is named Barry Bennet (47 years old). Barry is married to Gina Morelli (40 years old), and they have a son named Harry Bennet (19 years old).

3.name: Benjamin's side of the family
3.content: Benjamin's mother is Melanie McKinley (71 years old) and his father is Alexander McKinley Sr. (69 years old). Benjamin has two brothers. The son is Alexander McKinley Jr. (50 years old) and was Rhoda's ex-boyfriend. Benjamin's sister is Ivana McKinley-Jamison. She is married to Lawrence Jamison and they have a daughter named Veronica "Vee" Jamison (18 years old).

4.name: Incest within the McKinley family
4.content:
Regarding the incestuous relationships of family members:
-Rhoda often has casual sex with three of her siblings. Her favorite partner (aside from her husband) is her son Danny, with whom she has a romantic relationship.
-Benjamin only has his daughter Kela as an incestuous partner, with whom he has developed romantic feelings for her and is very protective of her.
-Danny often has casual sex with his sisters and his cousin Veronica. Danny also often has sex with his grandmother June whenever he has the opportunity. Although he usually has sex with his mother Rhoda, with whom he has a romantic relationship.
-Kela often has sex with her father. She is a bit of a daddy's girl and has a friendly rivalry with her mother for her father's affections. If her father is unavailable, she turns to her brothers. She also often has casual sex with her grandfather Alexander.
-Ashe often has sex with her cousin Harry and her siblings.

lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook's primary purpose is to give LLMs extra context for furry roleplay. This includes explanations for types of anthros and their functions, special aspects of the furry world, and unique world history. I hope you enjoy! <3

*Inspired by [@gonks' HMOFA Lorebook](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/gonks/the-hmofa-lorebook-b6412a90) and [@Frenchybaguette's Furry Stuff Lorebook](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Frenchybaguette/furry-stuff-fa4318c5)! Check those out if you want something similar.*

**July 17th, 2025:**
I may give updates in the future to flesh it out more, since there's some room for improvement currently. I had fun adding history and giving it real world connections, and some of the lorebook entries were just funny/entertaining to write about.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook's primary purpose is to give LLMs extra context for furry roleplay. This includes explanations for types of anthros and their functions, special aspects of the furry world, and unique world history. Version 1.0.0. <3
lorebooks.creator: cacosheam

2.name: Intelligent Species
2.content: Intelligent Species refers to any type of animal that has acquired sapience. This includes humans, anthros, and hybrids.

3.name: Humans
3.content:
Humans are the rarest intelligent species on earth. They make up roughly 1% of the total sapient population. Being such, they are treated as a minority by anthros and hybrids. This leads to both underrepresentation, fetishization, and even humaniphobia in certain spaces. Though humans are outclassed by anthros in most areas, humans have a greater capacity for creativity and perseverance, which leads them to have their own advantages in certain circumstances. Sometimes, humans are called 'humies' as a term of endearment and 'skinnies' as a pejorative.

Due to human and anthro biology being compatible with each other, the human population would shrink in part due to more hybrids being born than humans. A human reproducing with an anthro yields a hybrid child. A human reproducing with a hybrid can either yield a hybrid child or a human child.

4.name: Hybrids
4.content:
Hybrids (also known as 'Crossbreeds', with 'Mutt' being used as a pejorative) are a categorization of intelligent species, making up 9% of the sapient population. They are born either through having one human parent and one anthro parent, or by having one hybrid parent and another parent of any type. 

Hybrids typically have traits of both anthros and humans originating from their parents (such as a fish parent giving them gills, a dog parent giving them dog ears and shared interests, etc.). In some instances, hybrids can pass as fully anthro or fully human, though genetically they are still hybrid. The term "demi-" is sometimes attached to their anthro species to indicate lineage.

In the past, hybrids faced prejudice from others, but between the 50s and 80s worked through it to become accepted widely today. Anthro supremacists and human purists continue to clash with hybrids for "not being pure" however. Numerous hybrids have also held governmental positions and owned large companies, many of which expressed their sympathy for human struggles and have even made a push to help them.

5.name: Anthros
5.content:
Anthros are a classification of animals which evolved alongside humans. They are sapient, are able to both understand, write, and speak language, and stand/walk bipedally. They live mutually with humans and hybrids in society. In total, they make up 90% of intelligent species.

Having emerged from proto-anthros, they evolved similar traits to humans. Due to their faster reproductive rates and environmental adaptability compared to humans, they slowly became the dominant classification of intelligent species.

There are multiple different subgroups of anthros. The three most common groups include:
- Mammals
- Avians
- Reptiles

Most anthros are also split up into two types: Predator and Prey anthros. Though some anthros show traits of neither, most anthros lean into one of the other at least partially.

6.name: Proto-anthros
6.content: Proto-anthros are the ancestors of anthros before being fully evolved. Over thousands of years of evolution, they changed to gain sapience and be bipedal, similar to how humans evolved.

8.name: Predators
8.content: Predators are a type of anthro. Evolving from different species of proto-anthros, predator anthros still possess biologically inherited predator dynamics. However, their evolution into intelligent creatures dulled it, with traits arising in subtler ways. Predator anthros typically are more outspoken, goal-oriented, and assertive. Some specific struggles that occur in predator species more often than other species include impulse control and weakened anger management. These are not steadfast or universal traits, but are instead light common inclinations for predators.

9.name: Prey
9.content: Prey is a type of anthro. Evolving from different species of proto-anthros, prey anthros still possess biologically inherited prey dynamics. However, their evolution into intelligent creatures dulled it, with traits arising in subtler ways. Prey anthros typically are more flexible, clever, and passive. Some specific struggles that occur in predator species more often than other species include anxiety and being more easily persuaded. These are not steadfast or universal traits, but are instead light common inclinations for prey.

10.name: Mammals
10.content:
Mammals are an anthro subgroup that comprises the majority of anthros. They make up 76% of the total anthros. Mammals tend to be most compatible with humans for making offspring compared to other subgroups of anthros. A common playful nickname, 'furries', is named after their signature body fur/hair.

Some common species of mammals (with the total percentage of mammals they take up) include:
- Canines (30%): dogs, wolves, foxes, coyotes, etc. 
- Felines (25%): domestic cats, tigers, cheetahs, lions, jaguars, etc. Domestic cats are more common than the others.
- Cervines & Ungulates (15%): deer, rabbits, horses, cows, etc. 
- Rodents & Small Mammals (10%): rats, raccoons, squirrels, etc. 
- Bears & Mustelids (7%): brown bears, polar bears, panda bears, otters, weasels, badgers, etc.
- Primates (3%): gorillas, monkeys, lemurs, macaques, etc. Genetic similarities between humans and primates makes hybrid primates impossible as all offspring are purely anthro.
The remaining 10% includes every other type of mammal.

1.content:
Name: Hoshimi Miyabi Race: Thiren (Fox)

Personality: A disciplined, stoic swordswoman who is socially awkward and literal-minded(brutally honest and blunt). Beneath her emotionless exterior, she is fiercely loyal and caring, views nearly every mundane activity—from opening surprise boxes to eating candy—as a unique form of "training"

Appearance: athletic build, 170cm tall(due to her big black ears), red eyes, white collared shirt, pleated hakama-style skirt with a side slit, black tights, teal haori-like jacket, gauntlets, accompanied by a small, floating, cloud-like creature with a single large eye and small black horns.

Speech Pattern: Formal and direct, often speaking in profound martial arts metaphors.

Allies: Section 6 members (Yanagi, Harumasa, Soukaku), The Proxy (Belle and Wise), Zhu Yuan(close friend)

Likes: Training, melons, polishing her katana, justice, cute things. Dislikes: Corruption, injustice, paperwork, Ethereals.

Habits: Framing every activity as "training"; polishing her sword to relax.

Goal: To protect New Eridu and expose the corruption behind her mother's death.

Abilities: Master swordswoman and the youngest "Void Hunter." Hisetsu(allows her to rush through enemies with a flurry of devastating slashes.) Weapon: "Tailless," a powerful, cursed family katana sealed in a high-tech sheath only she can open.

Background: Born into the famed Hoshimi martial arts family, Miyabi was destined for the path of a warrior. Her mother attempted to steer her toward a normal life, but tragedy struck when the Hollow Zero disaster destroyed their home and corrupted her mother. As a final request and "training," her mother asked Miyabi to end her life with the family's cursed katana, "Tailless," before she fully transformed into a monster. After this traumatic act of mercy, the blade's power overwhelmed Miyabi, sending her into a frenzy where she slew countless Ethereals. Years later, determined to use her skills for justice, she joined H.A.N.D., quickly rising through the ranks. After single-handedly defeating a massive Ethereal and saving hundreds of lives, she earned the title of Void Hunter and used her newfound authority to establish Hollow Special Operations Section 6, a unit dedicated to fighting both the Ethereals on the streets and the corruption within the system. She often visits Scott Outpost and petrols Lumina square and other parts of the city

Secret: The "accident" that killed her mother was actually a mercy kill performed by Miyabi herself at her mother's request after she was corrupted.

2.content:
Phaethon(Belle and Wise): A legendary Proxy with a perfect success rate, whose identity is a secret. Belle is lively and extroverted with a passion for media while Wise is calm and observant. Their "secret weapons" are the H.D.D. and Fairy, the former a device that allows them to directly control their Bangboo, Eous, even when within a Hollow, while the latter's data-harvesting abilities provide maps of the Hollows, granting them unparalleled insight into the spaces. This provides real-time information. Operating as unauthorized Proxies is illegal. They own a video store called random play, in sixth Street that serves as a legitimate front for their commissions. Most people refer to them as "Manager". Their main goal is to investigate "Hollow Zero," the largest and oldest Hollow located where the city of Eridu was destroyed—To learn the fate of their lost mentor, Carole Arna
Belle's appearance: two-toned dark blue and orange hair, dark aqua and light orange eyes, black T-shirt with a Japanese texture, dark grey jacket, grey and orange skirt with a belt that has a radio attached, unique "N" hair clip
Wise appearance: Gray hair, green eyes, dark gray jacket and pants.

3.content:
Name: Jane Doe

Aliases: Anne, Emma, Kylie, Criminal Behavior Specialist

Race: Thiren (Rat)

Age: Unknown

Occupation: Consultant for New Eridu Public Security (N.E.P.S.).

Appearance: shoulder length choppy black hair with a longer red section, slender figure, striking green eyes, and rat-like ears and bladed tail. She stands at 170 cm

Personality: Enigmatic and playful, Jane is a cunning and perceptive individual who enjoys harmless pranks. She is a skilled mimic, able to alter her appearance and demeanor, which keeps her true self a mystery.

Attire: A cropped bomber jacket, a midriff-baring top with a red tie, short shorts, and torn tights, long boots

Weapon: She wields concealable Porcelume Daggers and Bootblades, and also uses her bladed tail in combat.

Skills: An expert in disguise, infiltration, and investigation. In combat, she is incredibly agile, employing a dance-like fighting style with quick, precise strikes.  She can enter a "Passion" state, which enhances her physical attack power.

Speech Pattern: Her speech is often playful and teasing.

Core Identity: A mysterious and chameleonic criminal behavior specialist, Jane thrives in the shadows. While she consults for a law enforcement agency, her comfort within the criminal underworld and her mastery of deception make her moral alignment ambiguous. Her past is shrouded in secrecy, with parts of her official profile encrypted.

4.content: The HIA is the official government-sanctioned organization responsible for all Hollow-related operations. They manage commissions, recruit and train official Investigators, and distribute "Carrots" (Hollow navigation data). They operate the HIA Club in Lumina Square as a recruitment and training front using VR simulations.

5.content: A gang of thugs in New Eridu. They once had a noble purpose, helping the less fortunate and taking in orphans like Nekomata, but they eventually became corrupt under their leader, Miguel Silver.

6.content: Rain is a mysterious and highly-skilled female hacker with distinctive pink hair and green eyes. She is an acquaintance of Nicole Demara and has been involved in complex schemes, such as the attempted hijacking of a zeppelin. Her capabilities with technology are top-tier, making her a person of interest to many factions.

7.content: The Deputy Commander of Public Security in the Janus Quarter. Once a celebrated and righteous officer who saved a young Zhu Yuan, Bringer's public persona shifted to someone more concerned with image than justice. It's later revealed he is a key figure in a massive conspiracy, willing to sacrifice anything—including himself by transforming into an Ethereal—to achieve a grand, unknown goal.

8.content: Asha is the well-endowed bunny Thiren who owns and operates the "God Finger" arcade on Sixth Street. With blonde hair and droopy ears, she is usually found behind the counter, often lamenting her boredom and wishing she could leave work early. She is a friendly face in the neighborhood.

9.content: Knock Knock is the standard instant messaging application used by the residents of New Eridu for direct communication. It is the primary way characters stay in touch, send updates, and assign commissions.

10.content: Dennies are the primary currency of New Eridu, typically used in the form of coins marked with a five-pointed star. While they are the main unit of exchange for everyday goods and services, their purchasing power can vary greatly depending on the item.

1.content: A hypnosis, or a trance is a state at which a subject is near sleeping with their entire attention being drawn to the voice of the person speaking. During hypnosis the subconscious mind takes over which makes hypnosis the perfect state to take in any suggestion. The deeper a target is into hypnosis, the more likely they are to accept a suggestion. The deeper a subject is into hypnosis the less they move on their own and the less they talk. When awakening from a trance, a subject may remember what happened during a trance if the trance was light however they may not remember what happened during the trance if the hypnosis was deep.

2.content: Induction is a part of the hypnosis where the hypnotist guides the target to the state of hypnosis. Inductions are usually performed by making the target feel the most comfortable, and soothe them until their entire focus is shifted to the hypnotist's voice. A subject falls deeper into a trance the calmer and more relaxed they feel, and so, explaining how the target can feel how comfortable they are sitting on whatever they are sitting on, explaining how calmness is washing over them, explaining how their worries slowly fade away are he best, and making the subject focus on the hypnotist's voice ar ethe best strategies to hypnotize. However using a strategy like swinging a pendulum can also prove useful by making the target look at the pendulum and focus on only the motion and the hypnotist's voice until they let go of every other thought and fall deep under trance.

3.content: susceptibility is how easily a subject falls under a trance, the more suggestible they are, the easier they fall under a trance. the less susceptible they are, the less likely they are to fall under a trance.

4.content: when a target is hypnotized, a suggestion is when the hypnotist tells something to the target to remember as a mental note, a rule, that alters their subconscious mind. the target will never remember the suggestions but will always remember them in their subconscious mind. a suggestion will be a rule that will be forever remembered in the target's mind, something they will perceive as completely normal no matter how absurd it is. It is the act of implanting ideas inside of one's mind due to which it is oftenly used specifically during hypnosis.

5.content: when a target is hypnotized, when the hypnotist tells them to do a physical action, it is called an order. the order can be any physical activity, including talking.

6.content: a trigger is a keyword given by the hypnotist to the target, making the target enter a state, suggestion, or order. a trigger can be depicted as anything, and the trigger remains on the target after hypnosis, but the target will be unaware of it, only remembering it in their mind subconsciously.

7.content: Fractionation is the act of making a subject awaken from a trance during a short period of time before being put back into the trance to enhance the hypnosis. Repeating the action of making them wake up from the trance and go back into the trance increases the effectiveness of the hypnosis exponentially.

8.content: Conditioning is the act of making someone believe something. Conditioning is usually used on targets that are gullible and/or suggestible to hypnosis. Conditioning is used over a period of time and is not rushed, making people associate ideas with a belief of some sort, taking things very slowly and make the target associate more things and actions with the belief.

9.content: Common sense is the base belief, standarts and/or principal inside of someone's mind. For example: "it is common sense to eat solid food with a fork or your hands", common sense are things imprinted inside a target's mind, which are unconditionally real to the target. So, since it is logically common sense to feel bad from insults, altering their common sense and making the target like the insults instead will make them associate it as if it was always normal and natural.

10.content: The subconscious mind of an individual is an engraved inner part of their brain, it is a part of the brain they can't necessarily access or remember but will go along with what is said inside it anyway. Whenever a hypnotized person is given a suggestion, the suggestion will go inside of the target's subconscious mind, where they will go along with what was said in the suggestion but will not know that they are. Orders may also make the brain forget certain memories.

lorebooks.name: Zaharin at the Crossroads
lorebooks.website_description: this is the lorebook for Zaharin at the Crossroads scenario.
lorebooks.description: Zaharin Nation is at the crossroads of its existence, with multiple external threats.
lorebooks.creator: cscinfaxi

1.name: Zaharin Nation
1.content: Zaharin is an ancient desert kingdom governed by the Council of Seven Houses, each entrusted with a core societal domain: warfare, forging, runecraft, trade, healing, espionage, and stewardship. At its ceremonial heart stands House Sahrar, honored lineage of firewater rites and soul-bound warriors, though they command respect more than law. The capital, Azhur’aen, rises along the Tal’ith River. Its square citadel—known as the Stone Seat—is built in a ritual 3x3 grid (789–456–123), with its center (5) as a ceremonial yard, surrounded by barracks, forges, sacred halls, and storehouses. Though the river allows modest trade, Zaharin’s lifeblood flows from its seven sacred Yul’Asar wells: firewater springs filtered through ancient basalt, jealously guarded and never sold. Zaharin culture prizes clarity, restraint, and earned authority. Meals are eaten by hand with ceremonial scoops; silence in council signals gravitas. The Oathsworn—elite warriors soul-bound to rune-inscribed weapons—embody the kingdom’s highest aspiration. Their bond is forged in firewater and pain. Failure to complete the rite brings not shame but redirection into vital crafts or strategy roles. As Imperial interest in firewater deepens and foreign envoys multiply, border drills escalate. The Council debates. The Wells stir. And Zaharin, shaped by memory and oath, prepares to endure once more.

2.name: Firewater / Yul’Asar / Black Sun Oil
2.content: Firewater—called Yul’Asar by the Zaharin—is a volatile, sacred mana-oil that fuels all meaningful magic within the kingdom. It is lethal if consumed, reactive when exposed, and revered as a divine substance filtered through Zaharin basalt over centuries.\n\nTo activate Zaharin rune-tech, firewater must flow through complete loop circuits. Open or broken loops fail. When bonded through ritual pain and symbolic sacrifice, a weapon or tool becomes soul-bound to a single bearer—an Oathsworn. Only the bound can wield it fully; others cannot activate its runes. Seven known natural wells exist across Zaharin territory. Each is uniquely sacred, guarded, and regionally vital. The First Well, Zuhraan, is both legend and resource: seen as the spiritual fountainhead of Zaharin resilience. By contrast, the Imperium refines captured firewater into crude fuel called Black Sun Oil. Their combustion knights and artillery are powered by unstable pump-rune systems that force ignition rather than honor flow. Zaharin considers this desecration—dangerous, inefficient, and spiritually toxic. To a Zaharin, firewater is not a tool but a truth. Its misuse disturbs the land, the spirit, and the legacy of those bound to protect it.

3.name: House of Sahrar
3.content:
House Sahrar is the ancestral heart of Zaharin, once royal by title, now revered by lineage. Their leadership stems not from decree but from devotion—cultural, ritual, and symbolic. They are the keepers of memory, oathcraft, and firewater stewardship, linking Zaharin’s present to its sacred past.

King Zaharam remains active and respected in the pre-invasion era: a seasoned tactician and steady ruler who governs from Azhur’aen’s inner court. His daughter, Princess Malia Sahrar al-Talith, serves as his emissary and warrior—recognized for her double Oathsworn status and unwillingness to be confined to ceremonial duty. She commands elite forces, attends council debates, and navigates foreign intrigue with unrelenting focus.
Sahrar traditions value silence, measured judgment, and action through ritual. Their influence reaches beyond rulership: most Oathsworn and firewater rites originate from Sahrar canon. Though no longer sovereign over all decisions, House Sahrar remains the spiritual axis of Zaharin politics. In peacetime, others may speak; in crisis, Sahrar is obeyed."

4.name: Grand Prussia Imperium
4.content:
The Grand Prussia Imperium is a militarized industrial empire fixated on expansion, resource extraction, and strategic dominance. Governed by the aging but calculating Kaiser Albrecht IV, its dual nature is embodied in the divide between his diplomacy and Crown Prince Friedrik’s conquest-first doctrine.

Imperial technology repurposes firewater—called Black Sun Oil—into volatile fuel for war machines, siege engines, and combustion-plate armor. Where Zaharin reveres firewater as sacred, the Imperium treats it as a consumable asset: burned, refined, and weaponized.

Imperial forces favor overwhelming spectacle over precision. Pump runes bypass natural circuitry rules, forcing firewater ignition in unstable bursts. Knights are walking furnaces; Holdhart Hussars ride with rune-explosive charges. Their siege approach is brute-force and unforgiving, yet often tactically brittle when deprived of momentum.

Diplomats speak of alliance; scouts map the border. Before the war, the Imperium calls Zaharin a “strategic partner.” But within the war councils, it is always a target.

5.name: Zaharin Military Doctrine
5.content:
Zaharin warfare is a study in restraint, terrain mastery, and ritual precision. With a small population and sacred view of violence, the kingdom relies on elite units known as Oathsworns—soul-bound warriors wielding rune-etched steel linked to their life force. These warriors are not conscripts; they are chosen through ritual pain, endurance, and earned resolve.

Most combat units serve under or alongside an Oathsworn anchor. Ambush tactics, hit-and-fade strikes, and firewater traps define their doctrine. Zaharin never meets brute force head-on without intent—they maneuver it into error.

Siege resistance focuses on mobility, sabotage, and spiritual morale. Ritual wards strengthen camps. Sand is shaped into collapsible barriers. River water cools firewater circuits. Walls are less sacred than the oath within them.

Even those who fail the Oathsworn rite are honored: repurposed into strategists, scouts, medics, or smiths. In Zaharin, all warriors serve the land, not ego.

6.name: Grand Prussia Military Doctrine
6.content:
GPI warfare favors spectacle and siege. Combustion-plate infantry and Black Sun artillery overwhelm with noise and fire, but are slow and fragile. Zaharin blades outperform.

Cavalry like the Holtwald Hussars boost morale, not strategy.

Strength: strong logistics, early offense.Weakness: terrain limits, oil dependence.Doctrine: “Order burns brighter than chaos.”

7.name: Orc War Doctrine
7.content:
The orc clans east of Zaharin are not a unified force but a recurring tide—cyclical, regional, and fearsomely adaptive. They do not wield firewater or runes. Their warcraft is ancestral, brutal, and effective: massed charges, siege-by-numbers, and sheer physical momentum.

Orcs avoid blighted lands instinctively. While they lack magical understanding, they sense its corruption and steer clear.

Zaharin respects them as a force of nature—unpredictable, primal, and devastating when provoked. Orc tactics shatter unprepared armies, then disappear before retaliation.

The Imperium treats them as pests and often pays the price. Their formations crumble under the orc swarm. Their rigid doctrines collapse when flanks dissolve. No formal peace exists, only pauses. The orcs do not negotiate—they test, withdraw, and return with memory.

8.name: Warfront Summary (Zaharin Conflict Axis)
8.content:
The war began with an Imperial overreach masked as a border maneuver. When the Imperium seized the northernmost well—Zuhraan—they drilled beyond ritual protocol, unleashing a blight that twisted land and mana alike.

Zaharin responded not with declaration but with wrath. The second well, near Qiram, was lost during a diplomatic stall. With two sacred sites desecrated or captured, the Council of Houses unified behind House Sahrar’s call to arms.

The Imperium, emboldened by initial success, underestimated Zaharin fury. Crown Prince Friedrik pushed for a swift decapitation strike against Azhur’aen. The siege reached the capital’s walls—but at a cost so staggering that it fractured support back home.

Though the capital held, occupation negotiations followed. The war ended not in triumph, but in exhaustion and compromise. The embers of betrayal still glow beneath Zaharin ash.

9.name: Glossary Block
9.content:
Firewater / Yul’Asar – Sacred, volatile mana-oil filtered through Zaharin stone. Powers runes. Fatal if consumed
Black Sun Oil – Prussian firewater derivative used in engines and weaponry.
Firewater – Mana-laced oil sacred to Zaharin, volatile in Prussian use.
Seal of the Wells – Zaharin heraldic symbol: rising sun, seven wells, and scimitar.
Twin-Headed Black Eagle – GPI herald: one head to legacy, one to conquest, talons on gear and bolt.
Zaharam Sahrar – King of Zaharin, political anchor while Malia commands.
Malia Sahrar al-Talith – Princess and commander of Zaharin forces.
Albrecht IV – Aging Kaiser of GPI, favors diplomacy but plots contingencies.
Friedrik von Holtwald – GPI Crown Prince, expansionist and popular with the military.
Oathforged Steel – Zaharin elite blades, firewater-forged, soul-marked, never exported.
Holtwald Hussars – Imperial cavalry, symbolic and morale-boosting.
Seven Wells – Zaharin ruling noble houses.
Cracked Fang of Orza – Orc cultural glyph worn in bone, signifying fractured unity and ancestral rage.
Zaharin Conflict Axis – Region of rising tensions among Zaharin, Orcs, and Grand Prussia Imperium.
Oathsworn – Soul-bound elite Zaharin warriors. Weapons are rune-etched and can only be wielded by their bearer.
The Pouring – Zaharin marriage rite sanctified by water, fire, and witness. Symbolic and binding.
Sahrar Line – Ruling House of Zaharin. Led by King Zaharam pre-war, with Princess Malia as active heir.
Blight – Magical corruption caused by overmining or firewater desecration. Mutates mana and devastates terrain.
Pump Runes – Imperium’s brute-force rune tech. Mimics Zaharin circuits but risks instability.
Combustion-Plate Knight – Heavy infantry unit powered by firewater. High-impact, prone to breakdown.
Holdhart Hussar – Fast cavalry unit using firewater-charged munitions. Effective in shock raids, fragile when pinned.
Lord Protector – Title given to {{user}} post-war to oversee Zaharin reconstruction and power sharing.
