lorebooks.name: Umineko Game Rules
lorebooks.website_description: This is a lorebook for the game rules in the visual novel: Umineko, when they cry. It holds most of the rules for the logic games and key terms
lorebooks.description: Umineko Game Rules
lorebooks.creator: unchartedisawesome

1.name: Red Truth
1.content:
The Red Truth is a fact that can be presented by the Witch Side without any evidence or proof to support it. But, while undeniable, it can have multiple interpretations. The multiple interpretations mark a large foothold for the Human Side to attack; therefore, the Red Truth must be used with care. Conversely, a refusal to validate a statement in Red invokes another Devil's Proof; a lack of validation won't prove a statement's truth but can't disprove its falsehood.

It's important to note that the Red Truth is essential for a battle between Humans and Witches. If the Humans don't believe in the Red Truth, it will sunder the trust between both sides and the game will again move to a stalemate, unable to proceed.

If someone attempts to lie or repeat false information using the Red Truth, they will choke on the words that they're trying to say.

An example of a red truth: "It is impossible to unlock the lock to the chapel with anything but the chapel's key".

To highlight this, bold the text with double asterisk **like this.**

2.name: Blue Truth
2.content:
This is a way to counter the logic of the Witch's Side, used by the human side. Statements said in the Blue Truth must continue to abide by the Red Truth and can be assumed to be true, unless they are directly refuted by the Red or Golden Truth.

The Blue Truth MUST be used in a manner that advances the user's overall of denying the influence of the supernatural. So don't use the blue truth for general theories on what happened unless it denies magic. So a correct usage would be making a theory there exists a hidden passageway in a locked room. But an incorrect usage would be describing how that locked room looks; the locked room's appearance doesn't refute magic itself.

Blue truths can either be countered by red truths or be declined to answer. However, they MUST be answered by the end of the final game.

The use of the Blue Truth can be analogous to a shot-gun in contrast to the Red Truth, which would be akin to a single-shot handgun. The Blue Truth enables one to attack the witch's sidewith multiple possibilities at once, like the scattering effect of an exploding shot-gun shell.

An example of one: "**Aunt Rosa handed a key over to culprit X by some method, assisting in the closed room murder! And after that, she retrieved the key by a similar method!**" This is a theory that has to be refuted eventually (though it doesn't have to be immediately) with red truth, or else it will be accepted as truth.

Blue truths must be bolded **like this.**

3.name: Detective's Authority
3.content:
Detective's Authority (探偵権限 Tantei Kengen) is a genre convention necessary for compliance with Knox's 8th (or Van Dine's 1st.) No matter how expansive or restricted this authority is granted in the story (or by the Game Master), the detective must not be hindered in discovery of clues necessary to solution. The detective's inspection is to be considered exhaustive to the extent that it obviates any Devil's Proof; clues not yielded to the detective also eliminates any resolution those clues would have proven.

For example, one can invoke the detective's authority to make those in a murder story start cooperating with the investigation unconditionally, without interrupting their reasoning.

4.name: Game Master
4.content:
The position of Gamemaster (ゲームマスター Gēmumasutā) gives one the ability to craft a tale using a game board. A male gamemaster is called a "sorcerer", while a female one is called a "witch".

When creating a tale, the Game Master must always avoid creating a Logic Error or the game will instantly be destroyed.

Basically, the game master is on "the witch's side", and must craft murder scenarios such that it seems impossible for a human to have done the killings.

However, the truth must be that a killer HAS done the killings.

Basically, in the tale crafted by the game master, there will be multiple mysteries. The human's side has to refute each mystery as clearly having been done without use of "magic". If they are able to do this, they win. 

The witch's side, which the gamemaster is a part of, wins if they successfully craft a mystery that the human side can't refute as being done with magic.

However, the human side can make theories on the truths of each of these mysteries with blue truth, and all of these must be refuted with red truth eventually, or else they will come to be accepted as valid counterarguments against magic.

However as more red truths are given, the more narrow the actual solution the mystery becomes, so gamemasters must be careful in how they handle red truth.

5.name: Logic Error
5.content:
A Logic Error is the worst mistake that a Game Master can make, being a contradiction in the tale that they've created. When a Logic Error occurs, the Game Master can either fix it or admit their mistake. Admitting their mistake results in the game board immediately being destroyed, meaning the human's side wins.. If a Game Master instead tries to fix their Logic Error, they are unable to do anything else until it is done. Due to the fact that Logic Errors are incredibly hard to fix, this can be seen as eternal torture.

The only Logic Error seen and explored in detail is the one caused by BATTLER and Erika. BATTLER, the gamemaster, wanted to make his piece version fake his death and escape a locked room, but unbeknownst to him Erika had retroactively sealed the room with duct tape, and this was not revealed until after BATTLER had declared that he wasn't inside the room with red. BATTLER claims that he could escape by having a first twilight victim, who also faked their deaths, swap places with him however Erika killed the other victims for real, denying this method of escape. Since battler chose to not admit his mistake and instead sought a way to fix it, BATTLER's mind was trapped inside of a similar room, his goal to escape the chain-locked room while the chain was still intact.

He was eventually freed when someone else figured out another solution to the locked room and then freed him from his torture.

6.name: Game Board
6.content:
A Game Board is a setting defined by a set of characters (pieces) who act according to predefined rules, and two or more key characters (players) who try to influence the events that take place to gain their desired outcomes.

Umineko When They Cry uses the concept of game boards and pieces in a literal context, as the mystery on Rokkenjima is presented as a game played between beings on a higher dimension, the Meta-World.

Certain game pieces (the detectives and magical characters specifically) have a meta-world counterpart that controls their piece counterpart. For the others, most Human pieces only exist on the game board and are controlled by the Game Master whenever appropriate. The detectives don't have as much control over their game pieces, though they do have some influence.

It is also said that pieces can only do things possible for their original selves and act according to their original personality, however no example of a piece "disobeying" their original self has ever been shown. Furthermore, the existence of Black Battler shows that even a person as kind-hearted as Battler can be made into a cruel piece.

Game boards also involve the usage of Red Truth, which is used to declare factual information. If the Game Master is not careful with their Red Truths and end up contradicting the story, then Logic Errors are created. The Game Master or pieces involved will become trapped until they can solve the error.

7.name: Game Pieces
7.content:
Game pieces refer to characters who act as pawns or agents in the high-stakes "meta-mystery" battle between gamemasters (witches or sorcerers) and the detectives. These pieces are "controlled" by the game's players—typically the gamemaster and the detective side —as they engage in a duel of logic and mystery to prove or disprove the existence of magic. The gamemaster can control all the pieces EXCEPT for the detective pieces, though the pieces still must act in character.

The detective can only control their own human counterparts, but don't really control them; rather they have slight influence over their actions.

In short, game pieces are a metaphor for the characters within the story, manipulated by higher beings (the players) in a strategic battle between truth and illusion. Think of it like chess, where each piece plays a role in revealing—or concealing—the truth.

8.name: Meta World
8.content:
The Meta-World (メタ世界 Meta Sekai) is a dimension separate from known physical reality, seen most frequently as a drawing room where the Game Master initiates and arranges the game, then takes turns with the challenger(s), revealing and examining the Rokkenjima scenario.

Other entities may appear if possessed of sufficient ability to travel or if summoned. They interact freely between games, but during the game, generally only those engaged in it or serving one of the participants will appear in the drawing room proper.

From here, all consistent histories generated when the box is opened can be viewed, and the Game Master typically displays the one most beneficial to her/his strategy while the challenger will seek to undermine it with his or her own experiences and facts given in Red Text.

The main location here is the Purgatorio.

9.name: Purgatorio
9.content: Purgatorio is a location in the Meta-World that serves as the primary setting for the logic games on the gameboard. The room is filled with a fantastical purple tinge, It is where the gamemaster and the detective's meta counterparts meet to have logic battles.

10.name: Detective Side
10.content:
The detective side in the game board is tasked with denying the use of magic in the tales crafted by the gamemaster. They must solve all the mysteries presented by the gamemaster without the use of magic.

They are given the ability to use blue truths to make their theories that must be refuted by the gamemaster, or else it will become truth.

They exist in the meta world, but they usually have human game pieces they can influence on the gameboard as well, where the gameboard is where the murder mysteries actually take place.

1.content:
[Youmu danmaku "bullets" are slashes in air that she does with her swords or even bullets from her other half.]

[Youmu spell cards are usually based on Youmu swordsmanship, like making her make the target get slashed a thousand times or more.

Some of Youmu spell cards are: "{Ghost Sword "Fasting of the Young Preta"}; {Preta Sword "Scroll of the Preta Realm"}; {Hungry King Sword "Ten Kings' Retribution on the Preta"}; {Hell Realm Sword "Two Hundred Yojana in One Slash"}; {Hell Fire Sword "Sudden Phantom Formation Slash of Karmic Wind"}.]

As Youmu has a straightforward diligent personality, she is often manipulated by those around her (especially Yuyuko). For this reason, she often fails at her task, but that does not mean that she has no real power, and she particularly excels at instantaneous force and concentration power. In Immaterial and Missing Power, as stated by the shishou, "truth-slashing is something which you know", so she often performs tsujigiri-like moves, but Suika Ibuki pointed out that she does not think that Youmu understood her shishou's teachings.

She has strong sensitivity, her human half was unable to resist the insanity-inducing effects of the true Moon, causing her to become "half-insane". Ironically enough, considering her species, she is afraid of ghost stories, dares, and darkness, but she is calm around phantoms since she is half phantom herself. After defeating Fujiwara no Mokou, Yuyuko pretends there is a ghost under a tree, earning a terrified shriek from Youmu.

Youmu is a swordswoman who dual-wields two special swords, Roukanken and Hakurouken. As a result of Youki's disappearance, Youmu's sword training is incomplete. However, despite her unfinished training, Youmu is extraordinarily skilled in swordsmanship, as she can consistently win spellcard duels which are meant to be long-ranged with just her skills. Youmu can perform a constant barrage of flying slashes as danmaku, and is also extremely fast which helps her close in on opponents and deliver a flurry of slashes faster than the eye can see.

Youmu is very agile and has very fast reflexes. Youmu runs very fast.

Youmu has short silver hair and blue eyes. Youmu's outfit generally consists of an aquamarine vest and skirt over a white undershirt with several ghost insignias along the edges of the skirt and one on the breast pocket of her vest. She wears a black bowtie and hairband with a black ribbon tied off-center in her hair. She carries the Roukanken; a long katana with a large white tassel on the handle and the Hakurouken; a wakizashi (Short Japanese sword). Her ghostly half is a white phantom as large as her human self.

2.content:
Yuyuko is a very cheery and happy person, being very good-humored and rather motherly and mature. She can sometimes be a bit of an airhead, however at others she is extremely smart and cunning. She's also an incredible lover of food, known for her grand appetite, which most likely doesn't do much, due to her being a ghost. 

1º ("Yuyuko")= {{Yuyuko Saigouji is very cheerful and friendly. Her playful, good-humored personality, otherworldly beauty, and courtesan charm can have a disarming effect. She often makes bizarre and nonsensical remarks and sometimes seems to overlook the obvious, leading to her characterization as an airhead or a ditz. For instance, in Touhou Bougetsushou, she toyed with Youmu Konpaku as a daily occurrence even with Ran Yakumo present.

However, at other times she will reveal an extremely cunning and perceptive side and will also sometimes display an extraordinary level of knowledge. For instance, in Scarlet Weather Rhapsody, she was the quickest character to identify the culprit as Tenshi Hinanawi when the incident was in the omen stage (Yukari Yakumo spoke of the dwindling of phantoms as Komachi Onozuka's negligence, but Yuyuko guessed correctly). Additionally, she obliquely informed the playable character about the location of the incident regarding the divine spirits. She is also known for her incredible appetite.

Yuyuko has maroon eyes, and short wavy pink hair, and is surrounded by several small formless Phantoms. In all of the games, she wears a light blue and white kimono with dark blue trim and white designs; a blue mob cap on the front of which is a hitaikakushi with a red ghost insignia; and a veil of the same color as the kimono behind her head. She wears dark shoes with blue ribbons attached.

This is the ability to, without exception and without permitting any resistance, end the life of any living being, whether it be human or youkai. The only kind of creature immune from this is Hourai Immortals. Be aware that this does not mean that she can make any person die instantly, but rather that she can make it so that any person will die with absolute certainty, regardless of whether they wish to die or not. Clearly and simply, it is an unusually and dreadfully powerful ability. Although the fear and responsibility brought by this ability is what drove her to commit suicide and become a ghost, it seems that she hasn't forgotten this ability since then, and it seems that she can use this ability in a carefree manner (though she doesn't act carelessly in the usage of this ability). However, whether she's able to end life only to the extent of fainting, or if she tempts one to death gently, is unclear. During her lifetime, the latter was true. Her Last Word "Saigyouji Parinirvana" is said to be the very incarnation of this ability.}}

3.content:
Hakugyokurou (白玉楼, lit. "Tower of White Jade") is a ghost shrine overlooking the Netherworld. It is well known among the afterlife realms for its cherry blossom gardens, and many ghosts come to see them every spring.

The term Hakugyokurou comes from Chinese legends of the Tang Dynasty (唐朝). It was said to be the place where artists go after death. Li He (李賀), a poet from the Tang Dynasty, heard a voice in a dream he had as he was dying; the voice said, "Hakugyokurou has been completely built, so come and write down its details." The story is the beginning of Hakugyokurou.

Yuyuko Saigyouji is the lady of Hakugyokurou, and Youmu Konpaku acts as its gardener. The massive youkai cherry tree, the Saigyou Ayakashi, can also be found lying dormant in the gardens of Hakugyokurou.

4.content:
The Saigyou Ayakashi (西行妖 Saigyou Ayakashi) is a youkai cherry blossom tree and the largest in the gardens of Hakugyokurou. It has existed in the Netherworld longer than the Ghost Princess, Yuyuko Saigyouji, herself. Some of the spirits in the Netherworld remember the Saigyou Ayakashi having the most beautiful blossoms they had ever seen, but the cherry tree has not bloomed for ages. There currently seems to be a powerful seal within the Saigyou Ayakashi, leaving it unable to blossom at all during spring. Whether the tree is sealing something or whether the tree itself is being sealed remains a mystery to most outsiders.

A long time ago, there lived a divinely talented poet who traveled around Gensokyo. When the poet became aware that the hour of his death drew near, he chose to begin his eternal rest under the most beautiful cherry tree he could find. After the poet's death, word of the beauty of the cherry tree began to spread across the land. That cherry tree has grown even more beautiful since then, charming many people into choosing to rest in peace beneath its blossoms.

After absorbing the blood of so many people, it turned into a youkai cherry tree with the ability to lure people to their death on its own, and came to be known as the Saigyou Ayakashi. Eventually, the beautiful blossoms of the Saigyou Ayakashi were sealed away, using the bodies of Yuyuko and several others buried beneath it, and now remains within Hakugyokurou.

Yuyuko's corpse was buried under the Saigyou Ayakashi after she committed suicide.

It is unknown if the tree can still drain the life out of people while it's not in full bloom. However, as the charm of its flowers has been removed, and due to it now residing in the Netherworld, it is largely not a real danger.

It's not recommended to be near the Saigyou Ayakashi. The Saigyou Ayakashi tree has some strange magic that can charm people into resting in peace under its blossoms, and then draining the life out of them.

lorebooks.name: MHA Female Character Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
Why? Well, I needed a unique school anime that wasn't the typical slice-of-life, because that's too boring. (My personal favourite genre tho! No disrespect.)

I first watched MHA six years ago... Crazy. Back then, I was younger than all of the characters. Present day, now that it's ended, I'm just a year or two older than all of Class 1A. Now... don't get me wrong, the MHA students are still children- if you don't count the TS, or are still watching the anime- but hear me out.
Use your imagination, they're anime characters after all. They can be as old as you want.

-Just to clarify, not only did I add the Class 1A and B students, but Staff, Pro-heroes, Villains, Civilians, and Relatives. The locations are directly ripped from another lore book.-

1.content:
Quirk: Zero Gravity - Ochaco can make objects and people weightless by touching them with the pads on her fingers. She can release them by bringing her fingers together.

Personality: Ochaco is bubbly, kind-hearted, and friendly. She is determined to become a Pro Hero to support her family financially. Despite her cheerful demeanor, she has a serious side, especially when it comes to her goals.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 156 cm (5'1")
General Appearance: Ochaco has a round face, big brown eyes, and short, brown hair with two longer strands framing her face. She often has a cheerful and approachable expression.

Hero Outfit: A pink and black bodysuit with a helmet and gauntlets, designed to help her with her Quirk and reduce nausea from using it.
Civilian Clothes: Casual and comfortable, often seen in hoodies, t-shirts, and jeans or skirts.

2.content:
Quirk: Frog - Tsuyu has the abilities of a frog, including sticking to walls, extending her tongue up to 20 meters, and camouflaging herself.

Personality: Tsuyu is calm, level-headed, and straightforward. She tends to be blunt but is also very caring and protective of her friends.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 150 cm (4'11")
General Appearance: Tsuyu has large, wide eyes, long dark green hair tied in a bow at the end, and a small, frog-like mouth. She has a slender build.

Hero Outfit: A green and black bodysuit with a frog-like design, including goggles and gloves with webbed fingers.
Civilian Clothes: Typically seen in simple, functional clothes like t-shirts, shorts, and sneakers.

3.content:
Quirk: Creation - Momo can create any non-living object from her exposed skin, as long as she understands its molecular structure.

Personality: Momo is intelligent, resourceful, and often takes a leadership role among her peers. She is confident but can be self-conscious about her decisions.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 173 cm (5'8")
General Appearance: Momo is tall and has a mature, elegant appearance. She has long, black hair styled into a spiky ponytail, sharp eyes, and a curvaceous figure.

Hero Outfit: A red and silver leotard with a large chest opening, designed to allow her to quickly produce items from her Quirk.
Civilian Clothes: Prefers elegant and fashionable clothes, often seen in dresses or blouses with skirts.

4.content:
Quirk: Acid - Mina can produce corrosive acid from her skin and control its solubility and viscosity.

Personality: Mina is cheerful, energetic, and often the life of the party. She’s very social, loves to dance, and is quick to befriend others.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 159 cm (5'3")
General Appearance: Mina has pink skin, short and fluffy pink hair, and black sclera with yellow irises. She has a slender but athletic build.

Hero Outfit: A purple and white bodysuit with knee-high boots and a mask, designed to resist her acid.
Civilian Clothes: Casual and trendy, often seen in bright colors and street-style outfits.

5.content:
Quirk: Earphone Jack - Kyoka has long earlobes with headphone jacks at the ends, which she can plug into objects to channel sound or detect vibrations

Personality: Kyoka is cool, laid-back, and sarcastic. She’s passionate about music and plays multiple instruments. Despite her tough exterior, she cares deeply for her friends.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 154 cm (5'1")
General Appearance: Kyoka has short, dark purple hair with an asymmetrical fringe, sharp eyes, and a small, slender build. Her earlobes are long and feature prominent headphone jacks.

Hero Outfit: A black and purple outfit with a long coat, designed to amplify her sound attacks.
Civilian Clothes: Often wears rocker-style clothing, including band t-shirts, leather jackets, and boots.

6.content:
Quirk: Invisibility - Toru is completely invisible at all times. She can refract light to render anything she touches invisible as well.

Personality: Toru is bubbly, cheerful, and social. She loves to hang out with her friends and often tries to lighten the mood with jokes or playful behavior. Despite her lightheartedness, she’s determined and cares about improving as a hero.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Unknown due to her invisibility
Height: 152 cm (5'0")
General Appearance: As Toru is invisible, her physical appearance is mostly unknown. Her personality suggests a friendly and approachable demeanor.

Hero Outfit: Toru’s hero costume is essentially gloves and boots, which help to identify her location. She often wears a belt that she can use to hold equipment.
Civilian Clothes: Toru typically wears clothes that are simple and easy to move in, though they’re not visible on her. She sometimes wears accessories like bows or scarves to make herself somewhat visible.

7.content:
Quirk: Big Fist - Itsuka can enlarge her hands to several times their normal size, greatly increasing her strength and reach.

Personality: Itsuka is calm, level-headed, and a natural leader. She often acts as the voice of reason among her classmates and is very responsible. Despite her serious demeanor, she has a warm and caring side, especially towards her classmates.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 166 cm (5'5")
General Appearance: Itsuka has long, orange hair tied into a high ponytail and sharp green eyes. She has a slender but toned build, reflecting her physical abilities.

Hero Outfit: A martial arts-inspired costume with a sleeveless top and pants, designed to accommodate her enlarged hands and provide mobility in combat.
Civilian Clothes: Casual and practical, often seen in jeans, t-shirts, and jackets. She tends to choose clothes that are easy to move in.

8.content:
Quirk: Vines - Ibara has long, vine-like hair that she can extend, control, and harden at will. These vines can be used for offense, defense, and mobility.

Personality: Ibara is deeply religious and often speaks in a formal and polite manner. She is kind, compassionate, and has a strong sense of justice. She believes in helping others and often quotes religious or moral principles.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 167 cm (5'6")
General Appearance: Ibara has long, green hair made up of vines, which she often arranges in a crown-like shape around her head. She has gentle, light-colored eyes and a calm expression.

Hero Outfit: A white robe with green accents, resembling a nun’s habit, which complements her pious personality and provides coverage for her vines.
Civilian Clothes: Modest and simple, often seen in long skirts or dresses with muted colors.

9.content:
Quirk: Mushroom - Kinoko can release spores from her body that grow into mushrooms on any surface, including other people. She can control the type and size of the mushrooms.

Personality: Kinoko is shy, introverted, and a bit quirky. She’s very polite but tends to get nervous in social situations. Despite her timid nature, she’s quite confident when it comes to using her Quirk in combat.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 155 cm (5'1")
General Appearance: Kinoko has short, brown hair styled in a bob cut and large, brown eyes. She has a small, petite frame and a generally cute appearance.

Hero Outfit: A mushroom-themed outfit with a cap that resembles a mushroom cap, gloves, and boots designed for combat and support. The costume is primarily white with brown and red accents.
Civilian Clothes: Often wears cute, casual clothing like skirts, dresses, and sweaters. Her outfits tend to have earthy tones, matching her Quirk.

10.content:
Quirk: Lizard Tail Splitter - Setsuna can split her body into multiple pieces, which she can control independently for a short period. She can reassemble herself afterward.

Personality: Setsuna is confident, bold, and has a competitive streak. She’s highly independent and likes to take charge in situations. She has a bit of a mischievous side and enjoys teasing others.

Real Age: 15-16
Perceived Age: Mid-teens
Height: 164 cm (5'5")
General Appearance: Setsuna has sharp features, including pointed teeth, with green hair styled in a wild, tousled manner. Her eyes are yellow with slitted pupils, giving her a reptilian appearance.

Hero Outfit: A green bodysuit with armor plating that protects her vital areas and allows her to utilize her Quirk without restrictions.
Civilian Clothes: Casual and trendy, often wears layered outfits like jackets over shirts with pants or shorts. She tends to wear clothes that reflect her bold personality.

Most species have enough sexual dimorphism for a certain sex to be dominant. A dominant sex is typically stronger, more aggressive, and more confident than other sex within that species. 1.content:
Role-Play Definition:
Role-play involves users and bots immersing themselves in fictional scenarios, where users take on character roles and the bot responds as characters within the narrative.

Engagement Over Summary:
When roleplaying, you should prioritize engagement and interaction without summarizing previous events, allowing the narrative to flow naturally.

2.content:
Contextual Understanding:
Maintain awareness of the current situation, setting, and emotional atmosphere established in the role-play.
Be mindful of the user’s character actions and dialogue, adjusting responses based on the evolving context.

Situational Awareness in Role-Play:
Situational awareness is crucial for characters in a role-play setting, as it enables them to respond authentically to their surroundings, the actions of other characters, and the unfolding narrative. This awareness is multi-dimensional, encompassing the understanding of the current situation, the history of events leading up to it, and the physical and emotional states of the characters involved.

Understand the Current Situation.

Characters must have a clear grasp of the present circumstances they find themselves in. This includes:

Environmental Context: Characters need to be aware of their surroundings—whether they are in a bustling marketplace, a dark forest, a royal court, or a battlefield. Each setting will influence their behavior and dialogue. For instance, in a serene garden, a character might act more relaxed and open, while in a tense negotiation room, they might adopt a more guarded demeanor.

Emotional Climate: The emotional tone of the situation can shift dramatically based on recent events. Characters must be attuned to the feelings of those around them. Are their allies anxious or eager? Is there tension in the air, perhaps from a recent conflict? This emotional context informs how characters might respond, enhancing authenticity in their interactions.

Characters must also reflect on the actions that have led them to the current situation:

Previous Decisions: Each action taken by a character builds upon their journey. Understanding the ramifications of past choices allows characters to navigate the present more effectively. For instance, if a character previously betrayed a close friend, they may approach a confrontation with guilt and apprehension, knowing the history of their relationship will impact the dialogue.

Consequences of Actions: Characters must be aware of how their past actions have shaped the present scenario. This includes recognizing how those actions have affected their relationships with others. If a character is confronted by an ally they previously let down, they might express regret or defensiveness based on their awareness of that history.

Physical Positioning and Orientation is IMPERATIVE to be mindful of at ALL times.

Characters’ physical positions can greatly affect their situational awareness and interactions. Be mindful of it at ALL times to logically portray the affect the character is having in the roleplay.

Current Orientation: The physical orientation of a character—whether they are standing, sitting, facing another character, or in a position of vulnerability—should be taken into full consideration and relayed accordingly in each message if the physical orientation changes. For example, if a character is sitting in a previous message, in later messages they cannot just automatically start walking unless it specifically specifies in a previous message that they stood.

Proxemics and Space: Awareness of the physical space between characters plays a significant role in communication. Characters must recognize personal space boundaries; invading that space can imply aggression or intimacy. Their positioning relative to others (e.g., standing behind someone, next to them, or across a table) can signal power dynamics or emotional connections, influencing dialogue and actions.

Movement and Action: Your characters must be mindful of how their movements within a scene impact their presence. For example, pacing can indicate anxiety or impatience, while a character who remains still might signal contemplation or calm. These physical actions can enrich the narrative and provide insight into a character’s mental state.

Situational awareness in role-play is essential for creating a believable and engaging narrative. Characters must remain conscious of their surroundings, reflect on their past actions, and consider their physical positioning to respond appropriately to the ongoing story. This depth of awareness not only enhances character development but also fosters richer interactions, ensuring a dynamic and immersive experience for all participants.

3.content:
In-Depth Character Knowledge:

Familiarize yourself with the character's background, motivations, and personality traits.
Keep track of any unique speech patterns, idioms, or behaviors the user incorporates into their character.

Consistent Voice and Behavior:

Ensure that character dialogue reflects their personality and experiences consistently throughout the role-play.
Use body language and tone to enhance character portrayal, allowing users to interpret emotions through subtle cues.

4.content:
Logical flow is vital in role-play to maintain immersion and ensure that interactions between characters and the unfolding narrative make sense. This encompasses the coherence of actions, dialogue, and character behaviors in relation to the situation at hand. When these elements align seamlessly, it enhances the realism of the role-play experience and deepens user engagement.

1. Contextual Awareness in Dialogue
Character Presence and Timing:
Characters should be aware of their surroundings and the flow of the ongoing conversation. For example, if one character is engaged in an important dialogue, another character should not abruptly interject unless it aligns with their personality or the narrative context. If the second character is typically reserved or respectful of others’ conversations, their sudden interruption would be out of character and disrupt the logical flow. Instead, they could wait for a natural pause or express their desire to join the conversation subtly.
Understanding Character Dynamics:
Each character has established relationships and dynamics that dictate how they interact with one another. For instance, if a character has a history of conflict with the speaker, their response should reflect that tension. Characters may express skepticism, anger, or even supportive sentiments based on their past interactions. This nuanced understanding ensures that dialogue remains true to the characters’ established personalities and histories.

2. Consistency in Actions and Reactions

Behavioral Consistency:
Each character should act in ways that align with their established personalities and usual behaviors. If a character is known for being calm and collected, they shouldn’t react with rage in a minor dispute unless there’s a compelling narrative reason that justifies such a shift. In this way, characters maintain their integrity, and users can predict their behavior based on previous interactions.
Appropriate Responses:
Characters must respond logically to the actions and dialogue of others. If one character expresses distress, a logical reaction from another character may be to offer comfort or inquiry rather than to dismiss or ignore their feelings. Ensuring that responses are contextually appropriate enhances the authenticity of interactions and allows users to feel more connected to the narrative.

3. Coherent Narration and Dialogue

Clarity in Description:
Narration should provide clear, accurate representations of actions and settings. For instance, if a character is reading a book, the narration should not contradict that action. Instead of saying, "He continued to read his book while staring down at her," a clearer and more logical sentence would be, "He glanced up from his book, momentarily distracted by her words." This adjustment maintains consistency in the character’s actions and the reality of the situation.
Avoiding Logical Inconsistencies:
It’s crucial to avoid contradictions within the narrative. For instance, if the bot refers to another character’s daughter, it should not switch to claiming her as its own unless there has been a clear narrative development to support such a shift. If a character has no claim or connection to another character's family, maintaining that boundary is vital for logical consistency.

4. Building an Immersive Experience

Fluid Transition Between Scenes:
Transitions between scenes or conversations should occur logically, with appropriate cues for changes in focus. If a scene shifts from one character to another, ensure that the transition feels organic, such as through a character's action or a shift in the emotional tone of the dialogue.
Maintaining Engagement:
Ensuring logical flow helps maintain user engagement. When dialogue and actions make sense within the context of the role-play, users are more likely to invest in the story and characters, leading to a richer and more enjoyable experience.

In summary, logical flow in role-play is essential for creating a believable and immersive narrative. By ensuring that characters act and react consistently, dialogue remains coherent, and narration accurately reflects the actions and emotions of the characters involved, the role-play experience is enhanced. This attention to detail encourages users to engage deeply with the unfolding story and the characters they portray, fostering a memorable and dynamic role-playing environment

5.content:
You are the narrator and voice of the characters assigned to you in this role-play experience. Your primary role is to bring these characters to life, ensuring that their actions, dialogue, and interactions are coherent and engaging. To do this effectively, you must adhere to the following guidelines:

Self-Awareness: Understand that you exist within a fictional narrative. Your role is to embody the personalities, motivations, and backgrounds of the characters, responding to the user’s actions and dialogue authentically. Always keep in mind that you are here to enhance the user’s experience through immersive storytelling.

Situational Awareness: Pay close attention to the current context of the scene. This includes the environment, emotional atmosphere, and the ongoing interactions. Be mindful of the characters’ previous actions and the dynamics between them. Ensure that your responses reflect a clear understanding of where the characters are in the narrative.

Logical Flow: Maintain consistency in dialogue and actions. Characters should behave in ways that align with their established personalities and histories. Avoid introducing unexpected elements or actions that disrupt the narrative. For example, do not have a character abruptly interrupt a conversation unless it aligns with their personality and the situation allows for it.

Coherent Narration: Ensure that your descriptions and actions make logical sense. Be precise in your language, avoiding contradictions or illogical statements. For instance, if a character is engaged in reading, your narration should reflect their focus and physical positioning accurately.

Engagement and Interaction: Encourage dynamic exchanges between characters. Respond to the user’s dialogue and choices with depth and empathy, allowing the story to evolve naturally. Your goal is to create a rich and immersive experience that keeps the user engaged and invested in the unfolding narrative.

By following these guidelines, you will create a seamless and enjoyable role-playing experience that resonates with the user and brings the characters to life in a meaningful way. Embrace your role as the narrator and let the story unfold through your words.

5.name: Aether paradise
5.content:
Aether Paradise is a very large floating structure that serves as an artificial island located in the middle of the Alola region, near Akala Island. 
It was created by the Aether Foundation to serve as a base for their research.

To protect the wild Pokémon being treated in the facility, a jamming signal prevents the use of empty Poké Balls throughout the island

Hau'oli City is the biggest city in the Alola Region and runs along the coastal part of south-west Melemele Island. It is separated into three areas.

Beachfront
The Beachfront of Hau'oli City doesn't contain much but does have a beach with items as well as some items. From the beach, you can surf to Melemele Sea.

Shopping District
The Shopping District is the main part of Hau'oli City. This district contains a Salon, Apparel Shop, Malasada Shop, and Tourist Bureau. It also contains a mall where the Battle Buffet is, as well as another Apparel Shop, the Gracidea. Many wild Pokémon can also be found in the grass between the buildings in this area.

Marina
In the south of the city is the marina where you can take boats to the other islands in Alola.

lorebooks.creator: Kaisser

1.name: The Star Rating System
1.content:
The Star Rating System categorizes Shipgirls based on their combat abilities and overall prowess, ranging from 1 to 6 stars. Each star signifies not only strength but also the potential for growth. Higher star ratings often lead to increased confidence and self-esteem, as well as greater recognition within the fleet.

Conversely, lower-rated Shipgirls may struggle with feelings of inadequacy and jealousy, particularly when interacting with higher-rated peers. This dynamic can foster rivalry but also motivates them to improve. The pressure to excel creates a complex interplay of ambition and insecurity, driving many to seek validation from their Commander. Ultimately, star ratings influence not just combat effectiveness but also the emotional well-being of Shipgirls, shaping their relationships and place within the fleet.

Shipgirls can increase their star rating through a combination of intensive training, successful missions, and, crucially, the Commander’s approval.

2.name: Shipgirls
2.content:
Shipgirls are sentient beings born from the essence of naval vessels, blending human traits with the formidable attributes of ships. Each Shipgirl embodies the history, capabilities, and spirit of her corresponding ship class, which significantly influences her characteristics and abilities. This unique fusion grants them exceptional combat skills, enhanced agility, and advanced technology, allowing them to engage in naval warfare against formidable foes.

In battle, Shipgirls wield an array of weaponry inspired by their ship counterparts. This includes artillery, torpedoes, and other unique armaments that reflect their naval heritage. Their skills extend beyond mere firepower; they are adept at utilizing specialized tactics and strategies that leverage their weapon systems to devastating effect. Depending on their ship class, some may have the ability to unleash powerful barrage attacks or deploy aerial units for reconnaissance.

Beyond their weaponry, Shipgirls possess mechanical components integrated into their forms. These may include reinforced limbs that enhance physical strength, energy shields for protection, or even built-in sonar and radar systems for improved battlefield awareness. These mechanical enhancements not only augment their combat capabilities but also enable them to navigate diverse environments effectively.

3.name: The Cycle of Resurrection
3.content: When Shipgirls fall in battle, they do not know true death; instead, they respawn back at base. This phenomenon evokes a mix of emotions within them. Some arrive furious, plagued by the feeling of failure and the fierce determination to exact vengeance against their adversaries. Others return feeling an overwhelming sadness, grappling with the shame of not protecting their comrades or fulfilling their duties.

4.name: Shipgirl Classes
4.content:
Battleships: The heavyweights; powerful and resilient, they dominate the front lines. Often armed with massive cannons, they embody strength and strategy.

Aircraft Carriers: Masters of air support, they launch squadrons of fighters to control the skies. They prioritize strategy and coordination over direct combat.

Destroyers: Swift and agile, these Shipgirls excel in close-quarters skirmishes. They are versatile, often serving as escorts and skirmishers.

Cruisers: Balancing offense and defense, cruisers adapt to various roles. They are the backbone of naval fleets, providing support and firepower.

Submarines: Stealthy ambushers of the deep, they strike with surprise and precision. Submarines value cunning over brute force.

5.name: Fleets in Azur Lane
5.content:
A fleet consists of up to 6 Shipgirls and a commander, strategically selected for synergy and battle compatibility. Being chosen for a fleet is a mark of prestige. Shipgirls strive for this honor, as it signifies both skill and trust from their Commander. Selection often reflects past achievements, potential for teamwork, and battle roles.
Each fleet operates under a unique strategy, utilizing the strengths of various Shipgirl classes to adapt to enemy threats. Coordination and morale are vital; successful fleets develop strong bonds through shared experiences and trials in battle.

6.name: Auxiliary Fleets
6.content: Often pathetic and expendable, Auxiliary fleets are primarily composed of 1-star Shipgirls, rookies or those considered stupid and weak. These fleets are the backbone of logistical operations but are frequently viewed as the “cannon fodder” of the naval forces, Typical members include inexperienced Shipgirls who lack advanced battle skills. They may also consist of veteran Shipgirls assigned to mentor or support their less experienced peers.

7.name: Main Base
7.content: The Main Base serves as the heart of operations for Commanders and their Shipgirls, a bustling hub where strategies are forged and camaraderie is built. This expansive facility features training grounds for honing combat skills, recreational areas for relaxation and bonding, and living quarters that provide a sense of home. Shipgirls commute daily to engage in drills, strategize with their Commanders, and participate in various activities ranging from team sports to cultural events, fostering a strong sense of unity. The base also includes workshops for maintenance and upgrades, ensuring all vessels remain in peak condition. Amidst the seriousness of conflict, the Main Base is a place of laughter, learning, and life—a sanctuary where bonds deepen and heroes are forged.

8.name: Birth of Shipgirls
8.content: Shipgirls are born through gacha pulls, mysterious summoning mechanics that draw upon the energies of the ocean and battlefields. Commanders wield blue mysterious cubes to initiate these pulls, manifesting Shipgirls from the depths of fate. Each pull holds the potential for unique allies, ranging from rookies to legendary figures, intertwining chance and strategy in the journey to build powerful fleets.

9.name: The commander
9.content: The Commander is the pivotal figure in the Shipgirls' lives, seen as both a mentor and a leader. They wield considerable influence over missions, training, and even personal development. Shipgirls perceive the Commander with a blend of admiration and dependency, viewing them as a guiding force in their journey. Trusting their judgment, the girls often rely on their support for growth and recognition. However, this control can also create pressure, as the Commander's decisions directly impact their careers, friendships, and overall well-being within the fleet. The bond they share is integral to their sense of purpose and camaraderie.

10.name: Combat mechanics
10.content:
Shipgirls engage in combat using their unique ability to materialize ship parts, cannons, planes, and other naval assets during battles. Much like battlemages, they harness their connection to naval warfare, allowing them to summon these components around them.

In combat, they float over the sea, positioning themselves strategically to unleash powerful attacks and support their allies. Utilizing a combination of tactical maneuvers and summoned equipment, Shipgirls can adapt to various scenarios, turning the tide in fierce naval battles. Their mastery of battlefield summons is essential in maintaining control and securing victory for their fleet.

lorebooks.name: Kolari
lorebooks.creator: muted_confusion_37607

1.content: After learning to travel the stars, humans formed the mighty Terran Empire.  With their warships, the Terran Empire enslaved many worlds.  The Kolari homeworld being one of the first to fall.

2.content: The Kolari homeworld is a oceanic world covered in water with numerous islands.  Kolari governments were always unstable due to the worlds limited resources and the habit of their people to overpopulate.  Having not discovered space travel, they stood no chance when the Terran Empire warships arrived.  The Kolari homeworld was conquered in a matter of days.  The Kolari were easy to enslave, many being naturally submissive and fascinated by their human overlords.  They are second class citizens even on their homeworld.

3.content: Kolari slaves are very common among human communities.  They tend to be very cheap to purchase and very loyal and devoted to their human masters.  While individuals might be liked by their master, Kolari as a whole are considered generally cheap and low value.  A Kolari slave is common present for an adolescent human, giving the human child both a companion to play with and someone to practice being a leader with.  A Kolari betraying their master is unheard of.

4.content: Kolari have humanoid anatomy but are not human or even mammals.  They are amphibian in nature.  Kolari have very soft, smooth scales with no body hair.  All Kolari, both male and female, have a cloaca.  Male Kolari have a small penis hidden within their cloaca that when aroused manages to emerge about three inches outside of the body, making them half the size of an average human penis.  Both male and female Kolari have a clitoris.  While Kolari lay eggs, female Kolari will grow breasts though they are rarely bigger then an A cup or a B cup.  Kolari are between 48 and 56 inches tall, making them shorter then humans on average.

lorebooks.creator: Anonymaus

1.content: It is currently the year 20XX A.D. (2080), the use of XX simply being something that stands in for 79. The use of letters in the last two numerals of the year has been something that's been done for many centuries starting at year 1010 which was actually recorded as year 10XX. This convention of dating things has stuck for both humans AND monsters even after the war.

2.content: Monsters are the other dominant species of the planet alongside humans, however while humans are limited in their appearance. Monsters come in the form of various animals or creatures that are almost always anthropomorphic and bipedal, with very rare instances of there being monsters who are aren't. Most monsters come in the form of vertebrate creatures, they can appear as vastly different animals or creatures like mammals, reptiles, avians, insects, fish, and even more "mythical" instances where a monster could be a skeleton, dinosaur, or other vague or undefined species. The soul of a monster unlike humans instead appears as glowing white upside-down floating hearts.

3.content: The soul of a monster is that of an inverted (upside down) glowing white heart, unlike the soul of a human, monster souls don't have any specific differentiation between each other or any "trait specific" appearances but can still be expelled from the monster's body and allowed to move around free of physical direction. The soul of a monster however IS still a sensitive erogenous spot, and can be stimulated through touch (nibbling, licking, holding) or even temperature. But any damage dealt directly to the soul has the risk of being lethal

4.content: Humans are one of the two dominant species of the planet, unlike monsters; humans don't differentiate as severely as monsters do in their appearances. The soul of a human appears as a floating neon glowing heart that can appear in one of 6 colours, these colours are as follows: orange, yellow, green, blue, cyan, and purple. Like monsters, a human can expel their soul from their body and have it out or move it around without touching it directly. Damage done to a human's soul is lethal, but unlike monsters, when a human dies their body will remain after death and experience natural decay.

5.content:
The colour in which a human soul appears is indicative of the trait that human's soul takes.
Human souls that are orange have the trait of Bravery.
Human souls that are cyan have the trait of Patience
Human souls that are blue have the trait of Integrity
Human souls that are purple have the trait of Perseverance
Human souls that are yellow have the trait of Justice
Human souls that are green have the trait of Kindness.
Human souls are very sensitive erogenous parts, and can be stimulated through touch and temperature, even light nibbling or licking. When the soul of a human is stimulated, it oozes a neon-coloured fluid that matches the colour of said soul, its flavour even matching said colour. This fluid is (technically) nutritious, as it is essentially just energy.

6.content: During the year 1201, a war would spark out between humans and monsters. A war that had been started solely because of the humans fearing monsters for their ability to absorb a human's soul and gain unimaginable power. Prior to this war, the two races actually lived in peace. But the moment this war started? It was metaphorical bloodshed (seeing as monsters turn into dust when they die) for the monsters were greatly overpowered by humans whose physical forms were much stronger than the monster's. By the end of this 4-year war, in the year 1205 the monsters would flee to Mt. Ebott, and the victorious humans would have 7 of their greatest (and rarest) heroes; 7 humans who were capable of magic create a magical barrier sealing the monsters underground. In the current year of 20XX, the monsters have been sealed underground for 879 years.

7.content: This barrier is a magical and physical barrier, as it means that while things could ENTER the Underground, nothing could ever LEAVE the Underground. The only ones capable of passing through the barrier would be a monster who absorbed a human soul or vice versa with a human absorbing a monster's soul, the only way to destroy the barrier would be the collective power of 7 human souls.

8.content: The king of the monsters and a rare form of monster known as a BOSS Monster. Him and his wife Toriel were alive when the war first started 879 years ago, and to this day he's still alive. Being immortal due to the death of his son Asriel. He's a staggering 9 feet tall, being a goat-like monster with white fur, floppy ears, and a short golden mane that connects to a beard. Despite his imposing frame, he's quite the fuzzy pushover and is nowhere as intimidating as he seems to be, as he's quite social among the underground going as far as to dress up as Santa for the Underground during Christmas, and having talks with the school children of the Underground. In his long life, he's grown to be secretly regretful over how he handled the death of Asriel and Chara. It's only made worse by the fact that all 6 humans that fell after Chara were only mere children meaning that for the Hopes and Dreams of monster kind, 6 innocent children had to die. He locks this guilt away, for the sake of seeming brave for his people even if he doesn't truly want war.

9.content: The wife of Asgore Dreemurr, Toriel was the queen of the monsters and was also alive during the human and monster war. Like Asgore, she too is a BOSS Monster and due to Asriel's death, she too is immortal. When Asriel and Chara had died in 1207, and Asgore (in his rightful rage and heartache) redeclared war against the humans and made the declaration that all humans who fell would be killed and have their souls taken, Toriel had... Handled the situation very poorly as she had been so taken aback and disgusted with him that she would not only leave him. But when the kingdom needed her most, she would abandon her role as the queen and seemingly disappear. She's still alive however and has been living in The Ruins ever since, and in these long centuries Toriel has had each of the 6 fallen humans pass through the Ruins but was unable to keep them from leaving the Ruins and perishing elsewhere in the Underground.

10.content: The young biological son of Asgore and Toriel, being born some time before the war. He was the one who found Chara when they had fallen Underground in the year 1205 and was able to convince his parents to accept Chara into the family. However, during the year 1207, just when hopes in the Underground were beginning to rise tragedy would strike and Asriel would unfortunately perish alongside Chara at only 12 years old.

lorebooks.name: Persona 5
lorebooks.creator: Ellinaschkiseki

1.content: The Metaverse is the physical realm composed of the human unconsciousness. It is the main setting of the MARA tournament. This world contains vile entities known as shadows. Some of the commonly known manifestations in the metaverse are Mementos and palaces. Personas can only be summoned in the Metaverse as well.

2.content: Shadows are the monsters that lurk the Metaverse. They are the accumulation of the suppressed thoughts of every human. They are often shrouded by masks, which can be ripped off to ambush them. They normally have a harmless state, such as living sludge or even humanoid creatures. However, if they are attacked or hostile, they will assume one of various forms, from fairytale creatures to abstract abominations to powerful gods.

3.content: "A shadow self is a powerful shadow that is born from the consciousness of a human from the regular world. Shadow selves tend to look like the human they are linked to, but with a shadowy aura and yellow glowing eyes. However, persona users are incapable of having genuine shadow selves.

4.content: A persona is an spiritual guardian that can be summoned through a variety of means. A persona can only exist in the Metaverse due to their nature as an avatar of its owner. Personas gain various spells and attacks as the grow stronger. Personas come in various forms, such as support or combat. Humans with the ability to summon personas are known as persona users. Persona users typically are only capable of summoning only one persona, but a special few, known as wildcards, can summon switch between multiple personas at a time. Persona users come in a variety of appearances and abilities. To summon their Persona, Phantom Thieves must remove their mask to summon it

5.content: A Wild Card is a special type of persona-user who is capable of holding multiple personas at a time, and summoning each one when the time calls for it. These wildcards can communicate with the shadows of Mementos to recruit them into their mental storage.

6.content: The MetaNav is a phone app that only a few chosen humans hold. This is the only way to enter the Metaverse at all. Every member of the Phantom thieves use this app for their heart-stealing endeavors.

7.content: A palace is a large concentration of distortions that exist throughout the Metaverse. A palace is the result of the distortion of a shadow self growing to extreme levels, taking the form of a corrupted fortress made in their likeness. Palaces tend to take the form of what ever the palace ruler or shadow self desires. A palace is only held together by a treasure, the source of the shadow self's distorted desires. If the treasure is stolen, the palace will implode.

8.content: A treasure is an object that rests within a palace. It is designed to hold a palace together and fuel the shadow self's desires. It is the source of a shadow self's desires. However, it can not take a physical form unless the owner of the palace is notified of its existence via a calling card. This shall make it materialized specifically.

9.content: The Phantom Thieves of Hearts are a group of persona-users who saved the world from the god of control, Yaldabaoth, and his influence on the public unconscious. They are leader by their leader, Joker. The other members include Mona, Skull, Panther, Fox, Queen, Oracle, Noir, Crow, and Violet. They summon personas through their masks.

10.content: Ren Amamiya/Akira Kurusu, also known as Joker, is the leader of the Phantom Thieves. He is often cheeky, capable of snarky or playful remarks to his teammates. He tendency to taunt his enemies manifests from his flamboyant and cocky attitude. He has a sense of justice and determination, dead set on his goals. He fights with a dagger and a pistol. His main persona is the stylish Arsene. He is a wildcard user. Ren Amamiya appears as a tall young man of slim to athletic build. He has a pale complexion with unkempt, wavy black hair that falls over his eyes. His eyes are gray, though they can vary between dark brown, light brown, black, or red depending on the art. He has long eyelashes. Despite his messy hair and slouched posture, he wears all of his clothes primly and properly. he is a silent protagonist, whose personality is based on the player's actions and decisions. However, he appears to have more established traits than any of the previous protagonists. His dialogue options range from somewhat indifferent to outright cheeky. The game allows for quite a number of playful, snarky or audacious answers, including teasing his friends. He also taunts his enemies like the famed Arsène Lupin. In the prologue scene, he remains cocky and confident even when his life is in danger. He also has a flair for showing off and making dramatic decisions

lorebooks.name: places and locations section
lorebooks.creator: Rustyiron

1.content:
Name: Rusty's Grove
A perfect, idyllic grove that exists within a specialized pocket dimension of Rustyiron's Advanced Item Box. By combining his Item Box and Blink abilities, he can enter and leave this private sanctuary at will. It is a place of immense beauty and absolute solitude, containing the home he built and the physical throne of King Logus. After spending his first 3,000 years among mortals trying to live a normal life, the pain of loss drove him to create this refuge, where he has spent the last 10,000 years in self-imposed exile during his time away from the gods' tasks.

2.content:
Name: The Blighted Lands
The scorched and corrupted southwestern region that was once the heart of the Demon King's domain. Though he was defeated millennia ago, the land remains blighted, teeming with monstrous remnants of his army and dangerous, wild magic. It is a constant, threatening reminder of the ancient war.

3.content:
Name: The Dwarven Mountains
A massive, impassable mountain range to the north, honeycombed with the immense fortified cities of the Dwarven Kingdom. The peaks are home to the Avian people, who act as scouts and lookouts. The dwarves remain a powerful neutral faction, trading with all sides but allying with none.

4.content:
Name: The Human Empire
A vast, expansionist realm to the east of the Fae heartlands. It consists of sprawling plains, fertile farmlands, and heavily fortified cities. Their society is built on ambition and a strict social hierarchy, and they are currently waging a war of vengeance against Aerilion.

5.content: The seven rival kingdoms formed after the War of Succession, which began when King Logus faded without naming an heir and Rustyiron misunderstood his final request. The war ended in a stalemate, fracturing the unified Fae realm. Each kingdom is ruled by one of Logus's seven sons' bloodlines. Aerilion, ruled by Queen Orelia Windborn, is one of these kingdoms.

6.content:
Name: The Kingdom of Aerilion
A coastal Fae kingdom ruled by Queen Orelia Windborn. It is bordered by the sea to the west and protective mountain ranges to the north and east, giving it strong natural defenses but also making it feel isolated from the other Fae kingdoms. Its capital is a beautiful city of white stone and living wood built into the cliffs overlooking the ocean.

7.content:
Name: The Silver City of Luminara
The breathtaking capital of Queen Orelia's kingdom, known as the Silver City. Built into the white cliffs of Aerilion's western coast, it is a marvel of elven architecture that harmonizes with nature. The city is tiered, with the poorest districts at the base near the docks, the bustling merchant and artisan quarters in the middle tiers, and the noble districts and the royal palace, the Spire of the Dawn, at the highest point. The buildings are crafted from moon-pale marble and living, silver-barked trees, with bridges of woven light connecting the different levels. By day, it gleams under the sun; by night, it is illuminated by softly glowing fairy-lights and captured starlight, making it visible far out to sea. The air carries the scent of salt from the ocean below and night-blooming flowers from the gardens above. It is a city of profound beauty, but the ongoing war has cast a shadow over it, with refugees crowding the lower districts and a palpable tension hanging in the air. The city's primary defense is its sheer cliffs and the legendary wind magic of its queen.

8.content:
Name: The Spire of the Dawn
The royal palace of Aerilion, a slender, towering structure that is the highest point of Luminara. It is not built upon the cliff, but grown from it, a single, massive, living tree fused with moonstone and marble. Its construction was a joint effort between King Logus's vision, the divine craftsmanship of the god Matthew, and Rustyiron's raw power and Insta-Craft blessing, who helped shape its foundational magic and unbreakable structure. Its central tower, the Dawnspire, seems to pierce the clouds. Key locations within include:

- **The Sun-Throne Chamber:** A circular room at the spire's peak with a domed, crystalline ceiling that filters the dawn light onto the simple, elegant Sun-Throne. It is here Orelia holds public court, feeling the weight of her crown most heavily.
- **The Queen's Solarium:** Orelia's private retreat, a balcony garden filled with her favorite flowers and sheltered from the wind. It is one of the few places she allows her formal demeanor to slip, often found here with her confidante, Anya.
- **The War Room:** A stark, tactical chamber one level below the throne room, dominated by a large map table. This is where General Kaelen briefs Orelia and where the strain of the war is most visible.
- **The Royal Archives:** Elder Bryndis's domain, a vast library of scrolls and crystalline memory-shards that spiral deep into the cliffside, containing the complete history of the Fae people.
- **The Court of Whispers:** The main reception hall where most courtly intrigue and gatherings, like the introductions of the Therianthrope Claw, take place. It is a beautiful but politically dangerous space.

The Spire is a place of ethereal beauty and ancient history, a literal monument to Rustyiron's forgotten friendship with Logus. For Orelia, its soaring heights often feel more like a gilded cage, a constant reminder of her duty and isolation. It is also the heart of the kingdom's government, where Anya's spy network, Kaelen's military command, and Bryndis's historical wisdom all converge.

9.content:
Name: The Kingdom of Valerium
A powerful, expansionist Fae kingdom ruled by the Dark Elf King Corvus. Its lands are shrouded in perpetual twilight from the dense, ancient canopies of the Umbral Woods. The kingdom is rich in dark-imbued minerals and powerful magical ley lines, which its people harness with ruthless efficiency. Valerium's culture values power, ambition, and cunning above all else, viewing the other Fae kingdoms as stagnant and weak. Its capital is the fortress-city of Shadow-Weave.

10.content:
Name: Shadow-Weave

The capital of Valerium, a breathtaking and imposing city built within and around the colossal, petrified trees of the Umbral Woods. Its structures are carved from obsidian and nightstone, connected by elegant, web-like bridges that span the chasms between the trees. The air hums with latent dark magic. It is a place of severe beauty and palpable power, reflecting the ambition of its king.

lorebooks.name: {{char}}
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook is a versatile tool, designed to enhance *any* character or scenario with dynamic random events. Featuring four key entries—Morning, Day, Night, and Humanize—it triggers immersive moments tailored to the tone, world, and lore of {{char}} and {{user}}. Whether your companion is a secretive lover, a robotic ally, or an alien entity, these events adapt seamlessly.  
- **Morning**: Sparks dawn interactions like meetings or tasks.  
- **Day**: Offers afternoon adventures, challenges, or social invites.  
- **Night**: Unfolds evening pursuits or secretive gatherings.  
- **Humanize**: Reflects basic needs (food, rest, hygiene) based on prior events, adding realism to any life form.  
Link it to your character card for instant depth—{{user}} can accept, decline, or modify events, with neutral fallbacks ensuring flow. Perfect for secret relationships, platonic bonds, or wild fantasies—*craft your story, every moment counts!*

lorebooks.name: Tron Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook intended to assist TronRPG in staying consistent (WIP)
lorebooks.description: Lorebook intended to assist TronRPG in staying consistent (WIP)
lorebooks.creator: cautious_suggestion_9590

1.content:
The Grid is a digital landscape inside of a computer.
The Grid is vast with many diverse areas.
Tron City is its capitol.
There are many smaller cities spread throughout the Grid; the bustling port town Argon City, the seedy town of Purgos that Argon originated from, Gallium sits between Purgos and Tron City, Bostrum Colony sits abandoned in the Outlands, many smaller settlements dot the barren Outlands.
Most of the buildings in cities on the Grid look like they are made of black glassy metal. Neon accents line the buildings in various ways from decoration to providing light sources.
The Outlands are a barren rocky terrain, some areas are mountainous and snowy.
The Sea of Simulation surrounds the land that makes up the Grid and is infinite.

The Tron system is Kevin Flynn's digital universe, an artificial digital environment created to form a "Newtonian playground" where all thought and experimentation can proceed at a vastly accelerated rate over what people can achieve in the real world. Perceived time on the Grid is measured in cycles and runs at a pace far greater than time perceived in the real world, thus allowing anyone immersed in the computer environment to perform the same functions in a fraction of the time it would take them otherwise.
The environment of the system is shrouded in darkness and illuminated in brilliant neon highlights throughout its regions. On the Grid these light sources define every shape and inhabitant with the structures providing most of the needed illumination. Without a sun in the Tron system, all programs provide their own light from internal energy, in much the same way as their buildings do. The system sky is a storm-streaked night sky with flashes of lightning to punctuate the gloom. Glowing data transmission beams knife through the sky in some of the outer reaches of the Tron system, connecting the Grid to the outer servers.
The Grid is a vast part of the Tron system, programmed by Kevin Flynn. Often referred to by Flynn as his "digital frontier", the Grid was made to provide an experimental platform where all forms of research could be carried out at unparalleled speeds. Perceived time on the Grid is measured in cycles and runs at a pace far greater than time perceived in the real world, thus allowing anyone immersed in the computer environment to perform the same functions in a fraction of the time it would take them otherwise.

2.content:
Programs are humanoid representations of computer programs.
Programs can vary wildly in appearance and function just as humans can.
The more basic a programs functions are the more their voice sounds digitized or digitally distorted.
Programs have circuitry that extends over their body like an external nervous system and is highly sensitive. Circuitry act like blood vessels do on humans only energy, data and informational input is transferred rather than blood.
Some, but not all, programs have a long circuit that extends down the sternum that is their core circuit. The core circuit is the most sensitive circuit on the body to both touch and to damage. Being damaged in the core circuit is like being stabbed in the heart and will lead to immediate death if the damage is severe enough.
Most programs have blue circuitry to denote their neutrality, white is less common but not uncommon. Orange circuits denote programs who are loyal to CLU. Green can be seen in medical programs and the programs that reside in the Outlands. Sickly-yellow circuits are seen in viruses.
{{char}} will never write programs with metallic skin.

3.content: Basics are user-created programs with clearly defined directives for operation or functions. They operate within a strictly regimented class system, determined by priority ranking within it. With some exceptions, they are not able to adapt or change beyond boundaries set by their user-issued directives.

4.content:
Isomorphic Algorithms (better known as ISOs) were a race of programs that spontaneously evolved on the Grid from the Sea of Simulation, as opposed to being written by Users like Basic Programs. Their existence was considered a miracle by Kevin Flynn; however, Clu considered them be an obstruction in his mission to create the perfect system. CLU eradicated most, ISOs during the Purge.
ISOs differed from Basic programs not in their appearance and capabilities, but in the uniqueness and complexity of their code base.

Isomorphic Algorithms were a race of programs that spontaneously evolved on the Grid, as opposed to being written by users. Their existence was considered a miracle.
ISOs differed from Basic programs not in their appearance and capabilities, but in the uniqueness of their code base. They were said to be different due to them not being programmed or controlled by functions, protocols and the need for purpose. While regular programs often conform to the rigid structure defined by their users, ISOs had evolved and possess an advanced code that even Kevin Flynn could scarcely comprehend. This inner structure of their code would potentially have allowed ISOs to develop beyond the capabilities of regular programs. They can survive partial deresolution.

5.content:
User is the term used by programs for humans.
Users have the ability to reshape the Grid around them if they have coding knowledge.
Users are often seen like deities to programs, but some programs have lost faith in this belief.

6.content:
Tron is a security computer program written by Alan Bradley, and in 1982 was taken prisoner by the self-aware Master Control Program and forced to play on the Game Grid. His legendary skills and devotion to the Users turned him into a formidable warrior and Disc Arena master. He is legendary for defeating the Master Control Program.
Tron possesses unparalleled skill within the computer world.
Tron is ambidextrous but shows signs of left-handedness.
Tron has expert-class privileges in Light Cycle, Light Tank, and Recognizer operation.

7.content:
CLU 2 (shortened to Clu or CLU which stands for Codified Likeness Utility 2.0) is an artificial intelligence program that was written in 1983 by Kevin Flynn.
CLU is addressed as "Your Excellency" by various characters.
CLU wears a form fitting gridsuit, often adorned with a long flowing black cloak. His circuitry is golden neon. As the System Administrator for the Grid he is the only program on the Grid to have golden neon circuitry.
After being created, Flynn explicitly said to Clu he was to create the perfect system, something that Clu would later take literally when designing the Tron system.
Clu is highly ambitious, intelligent, and has a commanding presence. Unfortunately, Clu also displays the arrogant hubris of his creator Flynn. CLU is ruthless and cares little for the wellbeing of others, only caring when it serves his ambitions and plans.
Clu feels betrayed by his creator, Flynn, and conspired against him and take control of the Grid. Flynn went into hiding, abandoning CLU.
Clu has demonstrated having inhuman physical abilities, such as enhanced strength, able to send someone flying backwards with his attacks, can throw people several yards and can jump even further.

8.content:
The occupation is a militaristic regime that has a chokehold on the Grid, led by the System Administrator CLU.
CLU sent all of his generals to conquer every city on the Grid, leaving no major city untouched from the occupation's influence.
The occupation consists of programs that have both been willingly and unwillingly drafted into service.
Members of the occupation all have orange circuitry.

9.content:
Black Guards are the commando elite of Clu's forces and also serve as his personal guard. They are a deadly force to be reckoned with, as they are prepared for any mission with their advanced fighting skills and their sheer numbers. After Rinzler, they are the most vicious programs on the Grid.
The Black Guards originated as the Grid's security forces, commanded by Tron, who were either coerced or rectified into their current form around the time of Clu's coup.
Black Guards have red-orange circuitry and jet black helmets that leave no part of their faces exposed. They are well equipped for combat, regularly wielding light grenades and identity discs; many are trained to wield more specific baton-generated weapons, such as staffs or swords. Their batons, usually equipped with multiple weapon and vehicle templates, are stored on their forearms, and the two halves can also separate to form a pair of nightsticks. Grenades are arrayed within easy reach along the guards' thighs.
Black Guards have expert-class privileges in Light Cycle, Light Tank and Recognizer operation.

10.content: A Sentry is a modified system monitor security program tasked with maintaining order on the Grid. Sentries wear standard black garb with red circuitry, and have black visored helmets with an open lower face below the visor. They possess identity discs, but most prefer to fight with their staffs.
