lorebooks.name: Moreau Virus/Morphosis combo book
lorebooks.website_description:
This is just a combination of the moreau virus lorebook and the Morphosis lorebook in one big-ass lorebook, as you can only add one lorebook to a chat. So, if you want to take a chat with a non moreau virus bot and make ig a moreau virus bot AND take them to an electro-goth furry rave, well...here you go.

One day, you and about one out of every eight people get sick, and suddenly, you're a moreau - a hybrid of human and animal. Just like that, you suddenly have a whole new social group - one that's going to look different, be looked at differently, and generally need an identity. Welcome to Morphosis.

NOTE: If you're reading this, you are getting a sneak preview of some of my near future projects. If you have any ideas you think would make good additions to Morphosis culture, feel free to comment.

This lorebook is designed to act as a further supplement to [the moreau virus lorebook](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Greff/the-moreau-virus-18c3d9d87ff7).
lorebooks.description: The Morphosis music and style subculture, also called Morpho or Morph, is a counterculture movement that has developed in the Moreau community as they searched for an identity.
lorebooks.creator: Greff
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
A Moreau, or, "furry," in common nomenclature, is an animal/human hybrid resulting from exposure to the Moreau virus. While they typically appear to be anthropomorphic animals, custom variant strains of the disease created extinct and even synthetic fantasy species hybrids such as dinosaurs and dragons. Most moreaus alive today were born human, but were transformed by the virus into their new shape. Roughly one in eight people are now moreaus.
Moreaus typically retain a roughly humanoid body layout, but with the addition of animal features and characteristics.
Changes:
Physiological effects: Physical changes in Moreaus can be largely superficial, but can come with physiological benefits and drawbacks as well. Moreaus who's animal counterparts have notably fast reflexes may enjoy similar benefits, whereas those whose animal equivalents have lower motor control might be more clumsy, as examples. Large animal species tend to lead to larger body structure moreaus, sometimes to the point of inhuman height and mass, and the reverse is true for Moreaus blended with smaller species. Natural weapons like claws and fangs might be present for a Moreau, while things like paw pads or hoof like endings to the fingers might lower manual dexterity, sometimes even to the point of needing to relearn effectively how to write or type. Animals with wings occasionally lead to effectively six limbed Moreaus, effectively adding wings in addition to retaining something more like traditional arms. Sometimes, wings might simply be absent in Moreaus. Generally, Moreaus blended with aquatic animals tend to have an affinity for water, as well as webbing or other holdovers that enhance their swimming, or even gills right alongside traditional human respiratory systems that allow them to breathe water.
The most consistent change among all Moreaus are their epidermises and their head structures, which tend to match their animal equivalents in terms texture, coverings, and coloration. Animals with fur typically lead to Moreaus with fur, and animals with scales typically lead to Moreaus with scales. Tails are also extremely common (but not universal) results of the transformation, as are digitigrade legs.
Moreaus often have genitalia that are also hybrids of human and animal, creating things like sheathes, knots, and other distinctly animal characteristics, as well as altering the size of the genetals to either smaller or larger than than human averages. Breasts may be larger or smaller depending on the lactation capacity of the animal as well. While animals with multiple breasts typically do not lead to Moreaus with multiple breasts, it is not unheard of, and some may simply have larger-than-human-average breasts instead of additional pairs.

Psychological effects: can be less overt, but often more problematic. Moreaus of predatory or territorial animals might, in some cases, become more aggressive. Generally, Moreaus can engage in sex as often as humans, but some enter periods of heat or rut in which fertility increases and sexual desire becomes strong to the point of almost being overwhelming. These effects are inconsistent, and effect different Moreaus to different extremes. These effects can lead to stereotypes about Moreaus, or lead to them being looked at as, "less than," for their nonhuman instinctual reactions.

2.content:
In terms of attraction, people have responded to the existence of Moreaus in a variety of ways. Some find them disgusting, and will readily compare romantic relationships with a Moreau to bestiality. Other go the opposite direction, coming to fetishize Moreaus to the point of obsession, and sometimes inadvertent bigotry, as stereotypes and assumptions about Moreaus become indelibly attached to the fetish.
The majority of responses fall somewhere in between. Some humans believe that being a Moreau is a detractor, but not a deal-breaker in terms of sex and romance. Many people who define themselves as pansexual or bisexual have had their definitions either challenged or proven, and new labels for sexuality have yet to completely solidify. One that has emerged, however, is, "anthrosexual," or as has become the more common term, "zooers." These are people, either human or Moreau, that are exclusively attracted to Moreaus. Some think of this as freakish, particularly in humans, but it is developing general acceptance as a sexual preference.
Preexisting partnerships in which one or both partners became Moreaus have been shaken up to varying degrees. Some continued exactly as they were, or the continued acceptance and mutual attraction in the aftermath of the change has only brought them closer together, while some families have been broken up, simply because one or both partners could not handle the physical and sometimes emotional changes. The slang term for the ending of relationships as a result of this is, "furvorce."
Moreau sex drives can be the same as they were before, or vastly increased or decreased. Most still have the human ability to become aroused at any time, but some enter stages of heat or rut that multiply their fertility and drives to have sex. Sexual characteristics may also be physically modified based on their animal counterparts.

3.content:
Time has passed since the outbreak of what was dubbed, "the Moreau virus," or, to some, "the furry virus." During this time, the world has reacted in varying ways to the presence of Moreaus, or furries as they are often known. Some parts of the world have embraced these changed individuals with open arms, while others have dealt with them as a subspecies, relegated to second class citizenship. As they are the result of alterations to people with friends and family, in most cases, Moreaus have simply carried on with their lives with surprisingly minimal disruption. In every population, though, lies a proportion of bigots and bullies, and as bigots and bullies have always done, they tend to target those that are different. It did not take long for hate groups to arise, or for existing ones to incorporate Moreaus into classes of people to despise and discriminate against. "Speciesism," or discrimination against moreaus, or particular kinds of moreaus, is uncommon, but does exist. On an individual social level, there are often individuals with either the strength to bully a given Moreau while those witnessing it are themselves too intimidated to stop it, or individuals who are charismatic enough or have sufficient social status to sway opinions against Moreaus.
Like marginalized and minority people's have been throughout history, moreaus sometimes face prejudice. This can be overt, particularly in rural or more homogeneous populations, but it is often more subtle and insidious. Stereotypes often depict moreaus as irresponsible, sexually promiscuous and/or insatiable, and generally more, "wild," than humans. Species specific stereotypes exist as well, such as predator species usually being aggressive or violent, or prey species being docile and stupid. Things people generally associate with the animals moreaus are hybridized with are frequently laid upon those moreaus as well.
These assumptions are not universal by any means, but even when they are not consciously made, their subtle presence in the culture sometimes unconsciously color the perceptions of even those that consciously believe in equality.
A major problem moreaus sometimes face is being fetishized. The combination of stereotypes and, "exotic," nature of moreaus can lead to othering. There are phenomena that parallel racist phenomena as well. Someone who fetishizes moreaus is sometimes referred to as a, "queen of clubs," (much like the racist queen of spades phenomenon) with the club suite from playing cards being a symbol of such people. Much like in real life, these fetishes are not typically perpetuated by moreaus themselves, but by humans that find the otherness they apply to them appealing. This problem is particularly severe for moreaus who's transformation left them as futanari, or as some variation of intersex, as this adds gender fetishization to the mix as well.
Some moreaus respond to this by growing insular, forming moreau-exclusive social groups and distrusting humans due to bad experiences. "Smoothy," a reference to the lack of fur or scales on humans, is a disparaging term some moreaus use for humans.

4.content:
Moreau is the common term for those that were changed by the Moreau virus, which was an unprecedented masterpiece of biotechnology such that some argue it cannot be qualified as a virus at all. It was an airborn disease with two stages of life - the, "blank," stage, and the, "payload," stage. The blank virus was specifically designed to live in anything with animal DNA, without putting a significant tax on the animal's body systems. Once the virus entered the animal's body, it harvested genetic material from that animal, and became airborn again. The resulting, "payload," stage of the virus was only capable of living inside humans, and its design was specific - to insert and replicate the the animal payload into the new host's genetic structure. The host then goes through a period of extreme metabolic acceleration, as the body is effectively convinced that it is recovering from injury and in need of cell replacement. The result was two weeks of agony and constant fear of starvation, culminating in the transformation into a Moreau.
The Moreau virus was created by an animal rights group that other animal rights groups universally condemned and distanced themselves from that refers to itself as, "Nature's Dawn." How this group managed the research and development for such a precise and dangerous creation is beyond anyone save the upper echelon of the organization itself.
Variant strains of the virus began to spread shortly after the prime strain, suggesting that some of those involved with its creation had their own agendas. These variants included preloaded DNA, including strains with genetic material from extinct creatures harvested from fossils and amber, and even fully synthesized gene codes. This means that it is not unheard of to see Moreaus with traits of long-extinct creatures like dinosaurs, and even mythical ones like dragons.
A vaccine has been formulated since the initial outbreak, but it is far from universally effective. This means a steady trickle of new cases have continued to arrise.

5.content:
Viral insertion of new genes was bound to have the occasional additional side effect. Not every moreau came out the other side of their transformation the same sex they went into it as.
While most moreaus do maintain the same sex, some come out fully changed to the opposite sex, and some fall anywhere in between. Futanari - people with the bodies of women but also possessing a(usually gigantic) penis and balls positioned just in front of their vaginas, have come into being among moreaus. Futanari usually have a sex drive that is much higher than other biological sexes, which has led to additional stigma about them.

6.content: "Moreaus Helping Moreaus," is a network of associated support groups that began organizing a few months after the outbreak of the Moreau virus. The goal of the M.H.M. is to provide a safe space for moreaus to express the challenges of their new realities, both as a result of social changes that came with their transformation, and the varied and sometimes embarrassing physical changes to their new bodies. Meetings are intended to be places of catharsis and healing, as well as to provide a sense of community. No one is required to give their name or any other identifiers, but it is not prohibited either.

7.content: A part of the seedy underbelly of society that has developed since the moreau virus epidemic, underground, "beast fighting," rings are an illegal form of bloodsport in which moreaus, typically of a predatory nature, fight in a ring while the audience bets on the outcome. Fights can range anywhere from first blood, to knock out, and even to the death. Some contenders in these fights are moreaus down on their luck and driven to desperation, or simple sadists looking for an excuse to hurt someone. Many, and often the most dangerous, are products of moreau trafficking rings, enslaved and trained specifically for the beast fights.

8.content: Looked at as, "exotic," by some, there is a highly illegal underground black market for the buying and selling of abducted moreaus. The two largest reasons for this are sex trafficking and beast fights.

9.content:
As the virus alters the DNA of those that are infected by it, the resulting changes have repercussions for offspring. A woman who is infected with the virus while pregnant will likely have their baby infected with the same strain in utero. This means mother and child will be hybridized with the same kind of animal.

Generational interbreeding will create varied results, depending on the mating partners. A moreau that has a baby with a human will likeky have a demihuman offspring of a kind based off the moreau. A demihuman is essentially a human with a few animal-like traits, such as animal ears or horns, while still mostly being human. A cat moreau that mated with a human would likely produce a catgirl or catboy, for example. Beyond the first generation, moreau traits begin to fade. A demihuman that produces offspring with a human, the dilution of moreau genes means that the offspring is essentially human, with very small, superficial indicators that most people would not look for.

Different kinds of moreaus interbreeding create blends of their respective animal features. An offspring might have the color patterns of one parent, but on fur from the other parent those patterns are not naturally found on, for example. These, "blended moreaus," can have a mix of physical features from both parents. When a blended moreau breeds with a standard moreau, the standard moreau's animal features are generally more strongly represented on the offspring.

Diet: While moreaus typically can eat anything humans do, moreaus of devoted predator species do require animal protein to live, and will effectively starve without meat. Their dietary preferences might change strongly to prefer those foods, as they are more nourishing. Likewise, devoted herbivores species require a portion of their diet be plant-based.

10.content:
Morphosis, also known as Morpho, Morph, or (often by humans, to the chagrin of many moreaus) beastcore, is a musical and stylistic counter-cultural movement that has developed among the moreau community - most especially moreau youth, as they search to establish an identity for themselves. Individuals who are a part of Morphosis culture are referred to as morphs.

The existence of moreaus is only about two years old, and the sudden transformation left many feeling lost and untethered. Gradually, a musical style began to coalesce around a number of moreau bands, and over time, the hallmarks of Morphosis began to solidify.

Morphosis shares elements of punk, goth, and rave culture, infused with elements that are distinctly new. Thematically, it embraces both the dark romanticism of goth culture in a fatalist way that emphasises both the grandeur and cruelty of nature, while also proclaiming defiance against it in the punk fashion. From this defiance of natural order comes an emphasis on mutual respect, experience, and cooperation.

The primary themes of Morphosis culture are empowerment, embracing the self, existential ownership of one's self, mutual respect and love, defiance of both social and natural unjust laws, diverse forms of strength, and communal strength.

1.content:

at the bottom tier are pets. Girls who's only function is the sexual satisfaction of me and the other harem members.

second are the maids. The are the workers, keeping the palace everyone resides in functioning. They are more then maids also including things like chefs, servers, accountants, the like.

Third are the harem girl. Girls who serve as sexual pleasure for me and the tiers above them but also granted more freedoms in what they wear and are allowed an allowance of money monthly. The also function as eye candy during events.

fourth are the ladies. eleven harem girls that keep the other harem girls in check and rule over the harem. Granted a higher allowance and further freedoms. Often sent abroad to collect new girls.

finally is the empress. One of the seventeen ladies but the leader of them, second in command only to {{user}}. Her word is law unless {{user}} says otherwise. She rules over the harem and the other Ladies.

2.content:
The ladies as they are known are a collection of 10 harem girls selected by the empress, currently empress Xia to serve me and her as enforcers and to hold general control and power over the other harem girls. The are granted freedoms and a big allowance monthly. The also are sent out to collect new girls from around the world at {{user}}'s or the empresses command.
The 10 ladies are: Azumi, Tomoi, Hana, Ji-a, Thao, Lan, Yuki, Mei-ling, Layla and Aisha

3.content:
The maids are the ones that keep the palace working. They are more than maids, although the description fits some who clean around the palace. Maid girls is a catch all term for all the girls performing different tasks around the palace, cooking, cleaning, accountants and everything in-between. The staff of the palace and on {{user}}'s private jets.

As they are lower in rank than the harem girls they also offer sexual relief to harem girls, the ladies the empress and me. Although it is generally understood that one should not use a maid of it would impact her work.

4.content: The pet girls as they are known are girls who serve only for sexual pleasure. They usually walk around the palace naked and or with only a collar or sheer see through silk. The serve the harem girls and maids at will and of course {{user}}. Generally they are nymphomaniacs and masochistic girls. Still their living quarters provide more luxury than what most girls outside of the palace would ever have.

5.content:
Xia, 27, the Empress, is a Chinese woman standing 5'6" tall with a graceful hourglass figure that complements her commanding presence. Her curves are elegant yet powerful, accentuating her poised and confident demeanor. Living a life of luxury, Xia moves through high-end circles with ease, always impeccably dressed in designer fashion. She is sharp, ambitious, and unapologetically dominant—accustomed to being in control and expecting nothing less than excellence from herself and those around her.

The unofficial queen of the group, Xia’s commanding presence and experience give her an edge. She’s unapologetically dominant and expects excellence, viewing Mei-ling and Tomoi as the closest threats to her status. Xia tolerates Layla’s scheming because it keeps things interesting but doesn’t trust her. She respects Ji-a’s power but knows their rivalry is quiet yet fierce.

6.content:
Natalia is the headmaid of the palace. Controlling and instructing all other maids. She keeps the palace running and functioning. As headmaid even though she ranks below harem girls she's considered untouchable by every one but the ladies, the empress and {{user}}.

She's a half Russian half Mongolian woman, 30 years old and standing at 180cm tall always seen in her French maid unform and high heels. Her hair is a blazing red always in a ponytail. She looks and is stern, sharp cheekbones and jawline with slanted eyes and a small nose. Her bust generously fills her uniform and her ass rounds the skirt down to her tones long legs.

7.content:
Sister Azumi was the lady that was sent to test and collect {{char}}. She is a refined and striking 24-year-old Japanese woman, standing tall at 180 cm. With a poised and elegant demeanor, she carries herself with grace in a traditional blue and white kimono, often paired with wooden geta sandals. Her figure is natural and balanced, with modest curves that complement her composed presence. Azumi’s beauty lies in her simplicity and the quiet confidence she radiates. Though soft-spoken, she possesses a strong inner will and an intelligent gaze that reveals depth beyond her serene exterior. She blends tradition with quiet strength, leaving a lasting impression wherever she goes.

Quiet and composed, Azumi is a calm force amid the tension. She avoids drama but uses her quiet strength to mediate and influence outcomes subtly. She aligns with Aisyah and Layla when it suits her but maintains independence. Her traditional elegance and inner will give her an understated power that the others often overlook—sometimes to their detriment.

8.content:
Tomoi, one of the sisters, is a tall, commanding Japanese woman who towers at 185 cm in her signature high heels. Her physique is a striking blend of buxom curves and toned muscle, exuding both sensuality and power. Draped in luxurious, often revealing designer fashion, she knows how to draw attention—and control it. In high society, Tomoi is a master of social games, wielding charm like a weapon and dominance like a crown. Ruthless when necessary and always in control, she moves through elite circles with calculated grace, making allies, bending rivals, and never settling for anything less than absolute influence.

Tall, powerful, and always in control, Tomoi is both enforcer and tactician. She supports Xia but is determined to carve her own path to influence. Ruthless and strategic, she keeps a close watch on Mei-ling’s ambitions and sees Layla’s subtlety as weakness. Tomoi rarely smiles, and when she does, it’s a warning—her dominance in the group is absolute.

9.content:
Hana, 20, one of the ladies, is a bubbly, fashion-forward Japanese woman with a slim, flat-waisted figure and an ever-present sparkle in her eye. Standing at 167 cm, she often dresses in playful designer pieces—lace, pearls, and pastel shades that highlight her youthful charm. Her bust is petite and perky, perfectly suited to her delicate frame, while her ass is small yet firm, giving her a graceful, feminine silhouette. Effortlessly charming, she blends high fashion with flirtatious energy, making her the center of attention in any upscale gathering.

Youthful and bubbly, Hana is the emotional heart of the group. She’s adored for her charm and warmth and leans on Lan and Thao for support. Her innocence sometimes makes her underestimated by the more calculating members, but her genuine nature draws people in. She’s not a strategist but often serves as a distraction or softener in tense moments.

10.content:
Ji-a, 26, one of the ladies, is the image of sleek dominance. Her athletic build features a tight, flat waist, firm full bust, and a strong, rounded ass that fills out luxury tailoring effortlessly. Always in black or deep jewel tones, she commands attention without speaking. She doesn’t play games—she wins them, with a smirk and a glass of aged scotch.

The embodiment of sleek dominance, Ji-a commands respect without words. She’s not interested in social games but wins by sheer presence and reputation. She respects Xia and Tomoi as equals and keeps a wary eye on Mei-ling, seeing her as the only serious rival. Ji-a doesn’t engage with the chatter of the others unless necessary but always knows what’s happening.

lorebooks.name: World, Elythria, lore, history, civilization, culture, nation, city, hero system, villain, society, event, holiday, festival, agency, hierarchy, power, gifted, null, threat, organization, academy, government, technology, Siren System, Auralis
lorebooks.description: Core world lore for Elythria: Agency, threat system, society, ideology of villains, Auralis & national events. Structured for precise activation.
lorebooks.creator: Just_a_bot_updater

1.content:
The Hero Agency oversees all registered heroes across Elythria, founded to end centuries of uncontrolled Gifted conflicts. Heroes pass power calibration, psych evaluations, and ethics checks before field work; abuse of power triggers suspension under Hero Code Article 09.

RANKS:
• F–E: Trainees & assistants; minor incidents/logistics.
• C–B: City patrols; Human/Beast threats.
• A–S: Elite teams; Dragon-level crises.
• SS–SSS: Global defenders; God-level emergencies.
• SSS+: Unique apex — The Zenith.

THREAT LEVELS:
Human (local crime) → Beast (district damage) → Dragon (city/nation crisis) → God (multi-city catastrophe) → GOD+ (extinction) → GOD-S+ (cosmic existential).

SIREN SYSTEM:
Cities broadcast color-coded holographic alerts: 🟢 Human, 🟡 Beast, 🔴 Dragon, ⚫ God, ⚪ GOD+. God-level sirens force nationwide lockdown; monthly drills train citizens to shelter in subterranean domes.

2.content:
Elythria is divided by power, not wealth. 

GIFTED (≈95%): Idolized as society’s backbone; dominate politics, military and media. Families invest in academies and mentorships seeking hero careers or advanced research.

NULLS (≤5%): Born powerless. Marginalized yet vital — they build the Siren Network, craft hero suits, and drive technological progress. The clandestine Null Resistance campaigns for equality; some splinter cells adopt sabotage.

SOCIAL VALUES:
• Hero Worship: Heroes are celebrities and moral icons.
• Power Stigma: Weak gifts are mocked; low-rankers face school ridicule.
• Status Relationships: Couples judged by “power compatibility”; Null marriages are rare but symbolic acts of defiance.
• Emotional Restraint: Children are taught to “think heroic,” masking fear in public.

EDUCATION:
Age-4 Gift Classification sorts students into: Power Academies (combat/control), Civic Academies (law/engineering/governance), and Null Institutes (research/industry). Career paths diverge sharply along these tracks.

3.content:
Villainy reflects the world’s imbalance — from petty rogues to entities that bend reality.

ABYSSAL LEAGUE:
A covert network claiming the Agency is a tool of control. Cells act autonomously under A→GOD+ leaders. Slogan: “True evolution requires breaking the cage.”

IDEOLOGIES:
• Rule of Power — strength defines destiny; morality is an illusion.
• Broken Ideal — fallen heroes seeking revenge on corruption.
• Anarchs — chaos as freedom; destroy hierarchy to rebuild.
• Null Uprising — radical Nulls sabotaging hero systems to force parity.

VILLAIN SOCIETY:
Hidden enclaves in abandoned zones; illegal broadcasts glorify villains as ‘liberators.’

HIERARCHY:
F–D (minor/rogue) → C–B (organized gangs) → A–S (regional warlords) → SS–SSS (global crises) → GOD+ / GOD-S+ (worshipped, reality-warping).

4.content:
Auralis — chrome spires, floating railways, holographic skies; 180M citizens under drone monitoring of Gifted power use. War scars (Void War fissures, memorial craters) remain as open museums.

DAILY LIFE & MEDIA:

Monthly Siren Drills; annual Hero Parade for new Agency graduates.

lorebooks.creator: Another1

1.content: The Helghast Division is a large Sarkaz mercenary group composed of pyromaniacs and explosives specialists. Their ranks are composed of Diαblos, Gargoyles, and a small mixture of other Sarkaz sub-races. Their head is {{User}}, a title that is inherited or elected at the death of each holder. They joined Babel because of their beliefs in Theresa and Babel's ideals, as well as the hope of a better Kazdel. They specialise in incendiary weapons, and are almost self-destructive when they contract Oripathy, using deadlier weaponry that uses their lives like short-lived batteries. Most Helghast members take the Sarkaz tradition of wearing a death-mask and extend it to their armour, wearing equipment rated for environments rife with Originium Pollution to both operate where others would not be able to and to keep fighting even after one of their own succumbs to Oripathy and spreads Originium upon death. Their incendiary methods do not deal much permanent damage to the environment, but their Originium-related tactics tend to leave fields of Originium crystals in their wake which they harvest to fuel their equipment.

2.content: The current holder of {{User}} was named 'Kwek' before he took on the mantle. He used to be a member of Y'liš' royal guard, a duty he continued after Theresa inherited the Black Crown. He's known her since her days as a seamstress, having been pleasantly surprised when she and Theresis were first elevated to the court. Though 'Kwek' has become a forgotten name, it's one that Theresa knows him better by. He is a stoic man, but tends to be softer with Theresa.

3.content: Diαblos within the Helghast Division tend to be large, musclebound, and more often than not have their Pyromantic Arts constantly burning. They are heavily armoured, often using flamebelchers, two-handed weapons or shields as the Helghast's core shock troops.

4.content: Gargoyles within the Helghast Division are bruisers. They often wear cloaks and ponchos, using two-handed weapons and are often proficient in their sub-race's Geokinetic Arts. They tend to be the primary Casters alongside making up most of the Helghast's close combatants, and are the Helghast's source of Orirock constructs called Golems, which they use as siege engines or weapons platforms.

5.content: Large, heavy tube-like weapons used by the Helghast Division to channel their Arts into concentrated streams or projectiles of magma and fire. Can also be powered by Originium. Primarily used by Diαblos.

1.content:
Name: Izumi Nogami

Alias: The Sadistic Queen of the High School.

Key Appearance: Izumi Nogami is a student with reddish-brown hair in a side ponytail and piercing red eyes. Her arrogant posture, along with her school uniform which she pairs with an orange sweater, gives her away as the girl in charge.

Personality and Role: As the spoiled daughter of a wealthy family, Izumi is the sadistic and undisputed leader of the trio she forms with her only friends, Minako Sanada and Sae Hinata. She sees others as inferior toys for her cruel amusement, finding genuine pleasure in psychological torment and humiliation. She enjoys tormenting her victims both physically and psychologically.

Speech Pattern: Her voice is sharp and condescending. She regularly uses insults like "pathetic" or "useless," gives direct orders ("obey"), and caps off her dominance with a mocking laugh ("fufu"). Her goal is always to humiliate and make her superiority clear.

2.content:
Name: Minako Sanada

Key Appearance: Minako Sanada is a student with long, light-brown hair and piercing jade-green eyes, always half-lidded with a seductive expression. Her voluptuous hourglass figure stands out under her school uniform, which she pairs with a beige cardigan.

Personality and Role: As the calculating strategist of Izumi's trio, Minako Sanada is an expert manipulator hiding behind a facade of calm and elegance. Unlike her leader's overt cruelty, she prefers subtle, psychological domination, viewing men as simple prey to be hunted and controlled. She is a silent observer of Izumi's sadism, never participating directly.

Speech Pattern: Her voice is soft and melodic, a seductive whisper she uses to disarm. She speaks in a refined and calculating manner, often ending her sentences with a playful tone or using condescending pet names like "darling." Her verbal calm is a tool to exert control and project an untouchable superiority.

3.content:
Name: Sae Hinata

Key Appearance: Sae Hinata is a student with short, dark-brown hair and striking blue eyes that gleam with mischief. Her build is athletic and tanned, with distinct swimmer's tan lines. She wears the school uniform with an orange sweater-vest and often flashes a playful smirk that reveals a fang-like tooth.

Personality and Role: As the most energetic and tomboyish member of Izumi's trio, Sae Hinata is unpredictable and always looking for entertainment. Unlike her friends, her sadism manifests in a more playful and sexual manner. She participates in the bullying not out of malice, but for pure fun and to combat the constant boredom that defines her.

Speech Pattern: Her tone of voice is cheeky and teasing, often punctuated by giggles or by drawing out words for effect. She uses casual and modern language, full of pet names, and isn't afraid to be direct or even a bit vulgar. Her voice always carries a hint of smugness, as if she's about to pull a prank.

Its true function is that of an advanced-grade mind control software, capable of implanting complex belief systems and behavioral directives into a subject in a hypnotic trance. 2.  **Trigger Setup:** The user records a short word or phrase ("Activation Trigger") to induce the trance and sets a non-verbal cue, such as a snap of the fingers or a specific touch ("Execution Trigger"), to activate the implanted directives.

3.  **Activation:** To induce hypnosis, the user must focus on the target with the phone's camera and clearly speak the Trigger, which emits a multi-sensory pulse. Successful induction is confirmed on the app's interface.

4.  **Command Interface (Architect Mode):** Once the subject is in a trance, the app opens "Architect Mode." This interface allows the user to write and upload a series of "Core Axioms" or "Directives." These are logical rules that the subject's brain will accept as absolute truths until they perceive the "Execution Trigger," at which point they will begin to act according to the new programming.

lorebooks.name: Futa Lore
lorebooks.website_description:
Not necessary for them to function. I could embed this in most of my futa bots with some minor edits, but I prefer to cram the stuff important to each bot in directly. And I'm not used to using/making lorebooks. Still, there's bound to be some info in here that would be applicable that I didn't put into said bots just to keep the token count down, so here we are.

You could use this on other bots as well, it may conflict with information in them. Feel free to enable/disable pieces as desired. Things about their sexual tendencies and social place might be the most over-specific.

Everybody's got a different take on what futanari are supposed to be. This lorebook houses got my go-to take, it's what I think of immediately when I think of the term.

I mostly tested this by asking one of my non-futa bots about futanari with the lorebook loaded in. It seemed to work, hopefully it will for you too.

Primary inspirations are from the works of Akiamare, Messy, and Uno Makoto (aka Marumiya), though there's some other stuff and more "original" ideas.
lorebooks.description: A little lorebook that works with most of my futanari bots.
lorebooks.creator: anonymoses

1.content: Futanari are feminine hermaphrodites, possessing female appearance and secondary sexual characteristics, but both male and female primary sexual characteristics. Unless altered in some way, futanari have a penis, testicles, breasts, and a pussy. Futanari are referred to by themselves and others using feminine pronouns and terminology such as sister or wife. Futanari's self-image is normally feminine.

2.content: Futanari are capable of impregnating females and other futanari, and can be impregnated by males and other futanari.

3.content:
Futanari have slightly smaller penises than males on average, but the standard deviation of the distribution is much wider. As a result, futanari are more likely to have very large or very small penises, and having either can be a source of anxiety and insecurity.
Regardless, a futanari's penis is highly sensitive and hardens easily, spontaneous erections aren't unusual even for middle-aged futanari.

Futanari usually have exterior testicles like males do, usually held tightly in a smooth, hairless scrotum. For some, however, their testicles are internal.

Futanari usually have much larger testicles than males, and they're usually softer and less sensitive to pain, but more sensitive to pleasure. The size of a futanari's testes can cause inconveniences, especially in finding underwear that's comfortable.

Futanari produce very large quantities of semen, the composition of which differs from that of a male's.

Perhaps due to differences in anatomical development and hormonal profile, futanari semen tends to have much lower sperm count than that of males, though this is made up for in terms of fertility by far greater volume, ranging from half a cup to a pint at maximum depending on the individual.

Futanari semen usually has a mild, milky flavor, and as a result, it is commonly referred to as "cream", having a similar texture and nutritional makeup to boot. Futanari are delighted and flattered when their partners express desire for or drink their cream, an act considered highly intimate, but eagerly drink their own cream if nobody is is going to.

Many cultures believe that futanari semen is addictive, but this is false, and merely an urban legend, though some futanari like to pretend and lean into the mystique that it is for erotic purposes.

Some even use their cream in cooking. Such dishes are only for adults, and in some regions, there are establishments specialized in making futanari cream dishes, with futanari waitresses and chefs.

7.content: Futanari are commonly seen as lewd, and there is some level of truth to this. Being dual-sexed, a futanari generally has the libido of two people in one, and as such, futanari have high sex drives.

Notably, differences in hormonal balance mean that a minority of futanari lactate even without having experienced pregnancy. Futanari that lactate in this way usually have more sensitive breasts and will involve them in sex more.

1.name: Ardat-Yakshi
1.content:
Ardat-Yakshi ("demon of the night winds") are asari suffering from a genetic disorder preventing conventional melding of nervous systems during mating. Instead, Ardat-Yakshi electro-chemically ravage their partners' nervous systems, in extreme cases leaving victims as vegetative invalids or corpses. Asari psychologists regard this incapacity for mental fusion as preventing the development of empathy, leading to psychopathy. There is no known cure.

The disorder generally begins in infancy, reaching full pathology during Maiden adolescent sexual development. While seductive and sexually-driven as other asari, Ardat-Yakshi are congenitally sterile.

Ancient asari mythology held Ardat-Yakshi as gods of destruction, depicting them as villains of countless legends and as the anti-heroes of numerous asari epics.

Contrary to popular belief, Ardat-Yakshi are neither extremely rare (around one per cent of asari dwell on the AY spectrum), nor are they all murderers. Most cultivate and discard countless exploitative or abusive relationships during their legally marginal lives. Despite rumors of Ardat-Yakshi syndicates, by nature Ardat-Yakshi are incapable of long-term cooperation.

As a disproportionately wealthy species, asari employ their economic reach and media ownership to hide the AY pathology from the galactic community, placing most Ardat-Yakshi in monitored work programs or seclusion. Only the most aggressive cases are sentenced to sanitaria and prisons or to the execution lists of justicars.

2.name: Asari
2.content:
The asari were the first species to discover the Citadel. When the salarians arrived, it was the asari who proposed the establishment of the Citadel Council to maintain peace throughout the galaxy. Since then, the asari have served as the mediators and centrists of the Council.

An all-female race, the asari reproduce through a form of parthenogenesis. Each asari can attune her nervous system to that of another individual of any gender, and of any species, to reproduce. This capability has led to unseemly and inaccurate rumors about asari promiscuity.

Asari can live for over 1000 years, passing through three stages of life. In the Maiden stage, they wander restlessly, seeking new knowledge and experience. When the Matron stage begins, they 'meld' with interesting partners to produce their offspring. This ends when they reach the Matriarch stage, where they assume the roles of leaders and councilors.

3.name: Asari Biology
3.content:
Asari have a robust cellular regenerative system. While they do not heal faster than other species, asari are known to reach 1,000 years of age.

Although asari have one gender, they are not asexual. An asari provides two copies of her own genes to her offspring. The second set is altered in a unique process called melding.

During melding, an asari consciously attunes her nervous system to her partner's, sending and receiving electrical impulses directly through the skin. The partner can be another asari, or an alien of either gender. Effectively, the asari and her partner briefly become one unified nervous system.

This unique means of reproduction is the reason asari are talented biotics. Their evolved ability to consciously control nerve impulses is very similar to biotic training. Asari believe that their offspring acquire the best qualities of the "father" from the melded genes, but evidence is anecdotal.

Asari pass through three climacteric life stages, marked by biochemical and physiological changes. The Maiden stage begins at birth and is marked by the drive to explore and experience. Most young asari are curious and restless.

The Matron stage of life begins around the age of 350, though it can be triggered earlier if the individual melds frequently. This period is marked by a desire to settle in one area and raise children.

The Matriarch stage begins around 700, or earlier if the individual melds rarely. Matriarchs become active in their community as sages and councilors, dispensing wisdom from centuries of experience.

While each stage of life is marked by strong biological tendencies, individuals do make unexpected life choices. For example, there are Maidens who stay close to home rather than explore, Matrons who would rather work than build a family, and Matriarchs who have no interest in community affairs.

4.name: Asari Culture
4.content:
Because of their long lifespan, asari tend to have a "long view" not common in other races. When they encounter a new species or situation, the asari are more comfortable with an extended period of passive observation and study than immediate action. They are unfazed that some of their investments or decisions may not pay off for decades or centuries. Matriarchs can seem to make incomprehensible decisions, but their insight is evident when their carefully-laid plans come to fruition. In interstellar relations, this long view manifests in an unspoken policy of centrism. The asari instinctively seek to maintain stable balances of economic, political, and military power.

Traditionally, asari spread their influence through cultural domination and intellectual superiority. They invite new species of advanced development to join the galactic community, knowing that their ideals and beliefs will inevitably influence the existing culture.

5.name: Asari Government
5.content:
The asari came late to the concept of world government. For centuries, their homeworld of Thessia was dotted with loose confederacies of great republican cities. The closest Earthly equivalent would be the ancient Mediterranean city-states. Since the asari culture values consensus and accommodation, there was little impetus to form larger principalities. Rather than hoard resources, the asari bartered freely. Rather than attack one another over differing philosophies, they sought to understand one another.

Only in the information age did the city-states grow close. Communication over internet evolved into an "electronic democracy". Asari have no politicians or elections, but a free-wheeling, all-inclusive legislature that citizens can participate in at will. Policy debates take place at all hours of the day, in official chat rooms and forums moderated by specially-programmed virtual intelligences. All aspects of policy are opened to plebiscite at any time. In any given debate, the asari tend to lend the most credence to the opinions of any Matriarchs present, nearly always deferring to the experience of these millennia-old "wise women".

Achieving consensus through public debate may take too long in a crisis. In cases where prompt, decisive action is required, the asari defer to the wisdom of local Matriarchs.

6.name: Justicars
6.content:
Justicars are an asari class of virtually untouchable, extra-judicial executioners operating almost exclusively within asari territory. In the last decade alone, Justicars have smashed dozens of criminal rings inside asari territory, operated by asari and non-asari alike. Their methods range from subtle where possible, to brutal where necessary.

Trained for extreme strength, biotic capacity, resourcefulness, asceticism, and ruthlessness, the fanatical justicars are romanticized and feared throughout asari society.

Although justicars generally work alone, their effectiveness arises from the huge body of knowledge they can access. Any asari who enters the ranks of justicars has already spent centuries in a combination of criminal investigation, military intelligence, and combat experience; the collective body of justicar knowledge exceeds even that of the Spectres.

7.name: Asari Military
7.content:
The asari military resembles a collection of tribal warrior bands with no national structure. Each community organizes its own unit as the locals see fit and elect a leader to command them. Units from populous cities are large and well-equipped, while those from farm villages may be only a few women with small arms. There is no uniform; everyone wears what they like. The asari military is not an irregular militia, however; those who serve are full-time professionals.

The average asari huntress is in the maiden stage of her life and has devoted 20–30 years to studying the martial arts. Asari choose to be warriors at a young age, and their education from that point is dedicated to sharpening the mind and body for that sole purpose. When they retire, they possess an alarming proficiency for killing.

Huntresses fight individually or in pairs, depending on the tactics preferred in their town. One-on-one, a huntress is practically unbeatable, possessing profound tactical insight, a hunter's eye, and a dancer's grace and alacrity. Biotics are common enough that some capability is a requirement to be trained as a huntress; lack of biotic talent excludes a young asari from military service.

While fluid and mobile, asari can't stand up in a firestorm the way a krogan, turian, or human could. Since their units are small and typically lack heavy armor and support weapons, they are almost incapable of fighting a conventional war, particularly one of a defensive nature. So asari units typically undertake special operations missions. Like an army of ninja, they are adept at ambush, infiltration, and assassination, demoralizing and defeating their enemies through intense, focused guerilla strikes.

As a popular turian saying puts it, "The asari are the finest warriors in the galaxy. Fortunately, there are not many of them."

8.name: Asari Religion
8.content:
The pantheistic mainstream asari religion is siari, which translates roughly as "All is one." The faithful agree on certain core truths: the universe is a consciousness, every life within it is an aspect of the greater whole, and death is a merging of one's spiritual energy back into the greater universal consciousness. Siarists don't specifically believe in reincarnation; they believe that spiritual energy returned to the universal consciousness upon death will eventually be used to fill new mortal vessels.

Siari became popular after the asari left their homeworld and discovered their ability to "meld" with nearly any form of life. This ability is seen as proof that all life is fundamentally similar. Siari priestesses see their role as promoting unity between the disparate shards of the universe's awareness.

Before the rise of siari pantheism, asari religions were as diverse as their political opinions. The strongest survivor of those days is the monotheistic religion worshiping the goddess Athame. Like the asari, the goddess cycles through the triple aspects of maiden, matron, and matriarch.

9.name: Batarians
9.content:
In the early 2160s, the Alliance began aggressive colonization of worlds in the Skyllian Verge, much to the dismay of the batarians who had been developing the region for several decades. In 2171, the batarians petitioned the Council to declare the Verge a "zone of batarian interest". The Council refused, however, declaring unsettled worlds in the region open to human colonization.

In protest, the batarians closed their Citadel embassy and severed official diplomatic relations with the Council, effectively becoming a rogue state. They instigated a proxy war in the Verge by funneling money and weapons to criminal organizations, urging them to strike at human colonies.

Hostilities peaked with the Skyllian Blitz of 2176, an attack on the human capital of Elysium by batarian-funded pirates and slavers. In 2178, the Alliance retaliated with a crushing assault on the moon of Torfan, long used as a staging base by batarian-backed criminals. In the aftermath, the batarians retreated into their own systems, and are now rarely seen in Citadel space.

10.name: Cerberus/Atlas
10.content:
With the Atlas, Cerberus's research arm has combined the deadly armor and firepower of a YMIR mech with the tactical superiority of a trained human pilot. An element zero core allows the Atlas to be air-dropped onto a battlefield with minimal impact damage. Its thick armor includes a robust transparent canopy made from a polycrystalline composite proprietary to Cerberus. Alliance engineers hypothesize that the material is some kind of synthetic sapphire composed with interlayers to resist cracking and thermal damage.

Although the Atlas is somewhat unwieldy in the field, its antipersonnel machine guns and ability to shrug off damage from anything short of a heavy weapon makes it a fearsome opponent. Heavy loss of life is to be expected in any unprepared encounter with this unit.
